We should not seek an alibi for our failures in others. Let us apply the Scandinavian model of cooperation, not the Balkan one. Our future is in our hands.
Bosnia and Herzegovina supports projects that contribute to development and strengthen the living standards of citizens.
Let us use the Energy Support Package of the European Union (EU) to help the countries of the Western Balkans in solving the energy crisis.
Improving energy efficiency and building capacity in response to climate change, such as the recent major floods in Slovenia and Croatia, are common challenges facing the entire region and the EU itself and as such require our unified approach.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is determined to participate in the energy transition towards green energy sources. In this regard, the EU's help in a just energy transition is very important to us, and will reduce the social impact.
Our goal is to intensify work on the development of the transport network and the completion of the construction of corridor 5c, as well as the start of work on the Adriatic-Ionian road through Bosnia and Herzegovina. We all need to work together on infrastructural, energy and economic connection of the countries of the Western Balkans with the EU.
The membership of the countries of the Western Balkans in the EU represents an irreplaceable framework for strengthening peace and stability in Europe.
We have taken on the obligation to harmonize the common foreign and security policy with the EU. We must respect that obligation and show that we are credible partners.
I believe that the voices of the highest EU officials who advocate not only the acceleration of the European integration process, but also a different approach to the enlargement process are important and encouraging. Such an approach, which I fully support, implies easier access to the EU structural and cohesion funds for countries in the enlargement process, as well as greater participation in the work of the EU institutions. This is the best way to reduce the economic gap with the EU, build infrastructure, create jobs and reduce the departure of young people.
Let us permanently close the Balkan Pandora's box.
Attempts to redraw and draw new state borders are the greatest source of evil and unhappiness. We have seen that such attempts result in great suffering. Let us learn something from our past. Instead of dangerous ideas about border changes, let us turn to economic development and true friendly cooperation.
Thank you for your attention!

title: The Serb member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina Željka Cvijanović delivered a speech on the topic of ‘The Western Balkans in Regional and European Integration’ at the 32nd Economic Forum i
content:
Distinguished Excellencies, Dear colleagues and friends, Let me first congratulate the hosts for the excellent organization of this prestigious gathering and express my deepest gratitude for the opportunity to briefly address you on the topic of “The Western Balkans in Regional and European Integration.”
I hope I will be able to shed some additional light on the important issues confronting the Western Balkans, both in the context of the region’s common European perspective and in the context of the mutual relations of our countries, including some open issues that burden the overall political, economic and security situation in the Western Balkans.
As we all know, in the last 18 months the world has experienced tremendous geopolitical changes and challenges. And the countries of the Western Balkans, of course, are not immune to these challenges and the crises they have brought to Europe.
In addition, the countries of our region have been struggling with their own longstanding problems. The reasons for this can be found in the geopolitical position of the Western Balkans, and its ethnic, religious, cultural, and political complexity.
One could rightly say that the growing democratic capacities of the countries in our region have not been sufficient to overcome the various problems that are manifested both within our countries and in our mutual relations.
The heavy involvement of the international factor has not helped either, and it seems that international interventions have quite often complicated rather than reduced the accumulated problems, hostilities, and misunderstandings we are dealing with.
On the positive side, all our countries share common aspirations when it comes to the process of European integration and the goal of full membership in the European Union.
On the negative side, however, some EU countries have little understanding of our above-mentioned regional complexities. This lack of understanding in many situations makes the EU’s approach inadequate, and often promotes double standards in how it deals with these complexities. Some EU countries promote political or constitutional practices in our countries which they would never accept in their own home countries.
Another problem we are dealing with in the Western Balkans is that our own European perspective has been in a form of limbo for the past twenty years. Some countries in the region have become EU candidate states in the past two decades but still have no clear timetable for when they can become members. Consequently, across the region there has been a loss of confidence in the belief that any of the states in the region will ever be granted membership status.
Thus, it should come as no surprise that we now hear many voices warn that the “EU perspective” will never turn into actual membership, not only because of our own internal burdens, but also because the EU is pretending that these burdens will in some miraculous way disappear by themselves.
On the other hand, we hear some voices claim that the EU’s ambivalence about accepting the Western Balkans countries as full members is changing under the new geopolitical circumstances of the past eighteen months, and that the accession process for the Western Balkan countries will now be accelerated.
How the EU ultimately resolves this dilemma will depend largely upon whether it decides to see the Western Balkans as an added value to the union, or merely as a future burden.
Whatever the outcome, I want to use this opportunity to thank Poland, its president and government, for their support in the process of the EU granting candidate status to B&H in December of last year.
We understand that the recent decisions to grant candidate status for certain countries emanated from the new geopolitical situation, and that these decisions were not based on the actual records of any of the new candidate countries, which are of course carefully monitored by the EU.
As for Bosnia and Herzegovina itself, after obtaining candidate status we have continued to work towards fulfilling our obligations from the package of fourteen priorities Brussels set out for the country. Some EU officials are signaling that the accession talks might be set to begin at the end of this year or at the beginning of next year. But we are aware that some in Brussels do not share this view.
Unfortunately, the countries of our region have already experienced many such contradictions, and Bosnia and Herzegovina is not an exception. Another such example is certainly Northern Macedonia, which has encountered various bilateral and multilateral obstacles while waiting to start negotiations with the EU.
Let me remind you that one of the requirements the EU has set before us is the issue of regional cooperation. Therefore, various bilateral and multilateral arrangements have been developed in the region dealing with everything from trade to political and security cooperation. Most of them are initiated by international actors and imply their participation, coordination, and monitoring.
It is fair to say that such initiatives have had a positive impact, as they have helped us increase trade throughout the region, gradually establishing a single market in the Western Balkans.
These initiatives have also led to different forms of police and security cooperation and have promoted increased freedom of movement; for instance, the recognition of diplomas and professional qualification for people across the region has significantly increased freedom of movement for our labor forces.
This cooperation is evident. However, it still cannot hide the fact that in the Western Balkans there remain many open issues and serious problems that have their own specific historical and political dimensions.
Given the situation in Bosnia and Herzegovina where its democratic institutional capacity and sovereignty are practically usurped by certain foreign centers of power or the recent violent developments and hostilities toward the Serb population by the Prishtina regime in the northern part of Kosovo and Metohija I can freely say that internationally driven political initiatives or tools have been unfair, inadequate, and have promoted double standards.
This has resulted in a growing sense that since the wars in the former Yugoslavia international actors not only have failed to find adequate modalities for the resolution of the region’s problems but have also quite often exacerbated these problems.
For instance, Bosnia and Herzegovina is recognized as a candidate country for EU membership, but at the same time its sovereignty is severely limited due to the continued existence of the Office of High Representative and of foreign judges on its Constitutional Court—twenty-eight years after the signing of the Dayton Peace Accords.
Please allow me to put the absurdity of this situation into an historical and comparative context for you. International supervision was ended, and sovereignty was returned to Germany and Japan ten years after the end of World War II. International supervision was ended, and sovereignty was returned to the Iraqi government and people two years after the invasion of Iraq, even though that country was in the midst of a full-scale civil war.
Yet in Bosnia and Herzegovina, almost three decades after the signing of the Dayton Peace Accords, a foreign bureaucrat imposed on the country by outsiders—whom the citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina have had no role in choosing—still claims to have the right to arbitrarily impose laws and remove democratically-elected public officials from office.
This neo-colonial arrangement is an embarrassment to the values and ideals of twenty-first century Europe, and it is an embarrassment for a country that has been granted EU candidate country status.
Indeed, the arbitrary and malign constitutional and political interventions of various high representatives have so often proven detrimental and counter-productive for political processes in our country that former high representatives themselves now say that the OHR is part of the problem in Bosnia and Herzegovina, it is not part of the solution.
None of us should be under any illusions on this issue. Real, genuine, and organic democratization and progress in Bosnia & Herzegovina is impossible as long as the anachronistic institution of the so-called “Office of the High Representative” continues to exist.
The sooner the OHR is closed down, the sooner Bosnia & Herzegovina can begin evolving into a stable, multiethnic and democratic polity, and the quicker we can begin fulfilling our EU accession requirements.
Postwar Bosnia and Herzegovina has also experienced serious security problems as a result of the Islamist radicalization that has occurred within some segments of its population. Numerous Al Qaeda and ISIS cells were established in Bosnia & Herzegovina during and after the war, and as the various terrorist attacks with Bosnian connections carried out across Europe over the past twenty-five years attest—from the Madrid Train Bombings in 2004 to the Vienna terrorist attack just a couple of years ago—both the region and Europe as a whole, are still threatened by this dangerous problem.
In conclusion, I want to end on an optimistic note. As I have argued, the Western Balkans are a sensitive, fragile area, burdened with different challenges and problems. But this was also true of much of Western Europe seventy-five years ago.
In the case of Western Europe, however, enlightened, intelligent, and sensitive policies helped transform historic enemies into stable and cooperative allies. I believe the same transformation can occur in the Western Balkans if international policy towards the region shows the same degree of enlightenment, intelligence, and sensitivity that the founders of the European Community and so much of the post-World War II international order showed in those years.
The challenge at this moment is to make EU and international policy towards the region more realistic, and more sensitive to the historic complexities we are trying to overcome.
Thank you once again for your time and for your attention.

title: Speech by the Serb member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Željka Cvijanović, at the commemoration of the Day of the Missing Persons and the Dead in the Defence-Fatherland (Patriotic) War
content:
Dear All! We have gathered today to remember all those who died and went missing in the Patriotic War. To those to whom we owe eternal gratitude for the freedom they won together with their comrades. For their sake, as well as for our own sake, we are obliged to defend this freedom in peace and leave it to future generations. The freedom I am talking about is called Republika Srpska.
And today we are not at Ozren by chance.
This mountain is a symbol of the suffering of the Serb people in the past war.
The NATO aggression against Republika Srpska, which began on this very day, 28 years ago, contributed to this suffering and the exodus of Serbs from these areas.
Ozren is a place of pain, suffering and brutal crimes committed by members of the El-Mujahedeen squad.
Those monsters - who lived thousands of kilometres away from Bosnia and Herzegovina - are respected today in Sarajevo as heroes and defenders.
And their victims, the Serbs from Ozren who have lived here for centuries, they call aggressors and criminals without any shame.
It is about the complete absence of all logic, morality, and common sense.
Twenty-eight years after the end of the war, Republika Srpska is still searching for 1,646 missing persons, soldiers and civilians, among who are more than 300 women and children.
They are not a number or a statistic, but someone's children, brothers and sisters, fathers and mothers, whose families deserve they be found.
The process of searching for missing persons of Serb nationality has been so flawed, slow and shameful for years that I absolutely understand the anger and indignation of their families.
The ignorant attitude of the Institute for Missing Persons of BiH towards the families of missing Serbs is no less shameful.
It is their professional and human obligation to treat everyone equally and not to favour or ignore anyone based on nationality.
The same is the case in many other institutions at the joint level, and we are fighting against it in every place.
It is precisely the effort of Bosniak representatives to privatize BiH institutions that is the key reason for its failure.
In previous years, I have had numerous conversations with representatives of the families of dead and missing persons.
The long-term struggle they lead, seeking justice and their loved ones, is not only theirs, but the struggle of all of us.
It is a struggle for dignity and equality that the Constitution and the Dayton Peace Agreement guaranteed to the Serb people and Republika Srpska.
No one gifted that to us, but your loved ones fought and won it.
That is why we will always be by your side and with you.
That is why your fight will never be yours alone, but ours together.
In the institutions of Republika Srpska, as before, you will always have support.
This is also our institutional obligation, but it is, above all, a human duty.
Thank you.

title: Address by the Chairman of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina Željko Komšić at the Third Summit of the International Crimean Platform in Kyiv, Ukraine
content:
"President Zelensky, distinguished excellencies, dear friends! As the chairman of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, it is my honour to participate in the Third Summit of the Crimean Platform and send from this place a clear and unambiguous message of support to the Ukrainian people in the fight to preserve the sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, which, of course, includes Crimea. Crimea is Ukraine!
I come from a country that has also been a victim of aggression and attempts to forcibly seize its territory. As in the case of Ukraine, the military aggression of a far stronger and larger military power towards Bosnia and Herzegovina was preceded by political, media, economic, and any other aggression, including cultural ones - an attempt to deny the cultural identity of Bosnia and Herzegovina and its peoples, presenting them as fictional , regardless of the thousand-year history of Bosnian statehood.
Even the circumstances of the aggression against Ukraine and my country are similar. In February 1992, the citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina voted in a referendum choosing an independent and sovereign, multi-ethnic, democratic, European Bosnia and Herzegovina. That democratic expression of the will of the vast majority of the citizens of my country was met by aggression, ethnic cleansing, camps, genocide in Srebrenica and the siege of the capital Sarajevo.
While we followed the events in Kiev at the end of 2013 and the beginning of 2014, when the Verkhovna Rada and the citizens of Ukraine sent a clear message through democratic means that they wanted to tear their country out of its vassal relationship with Russia, and direct it towards the free part of the world and the European Union, we feared we are facing a similar scenario that we experienced twenty years earlier - illegal aggression and attempted annexation of sovereign Ukrainian territory. These acts were a clear violation of Article 2 of the United Nations Charter, the Helsinki Final Act, as well as the Treaty of Friendship between Russia and Ukraine.
Unfortunately, the seizure of Crimea, followed by ethnic cleansing and numerous other violations of human rights and freedoms, was only a prelude to the continuation of the aggression that followed in February 2022. This time, the goal of the aggressors was and remains the overthrow of the democratically elected Ukrainian authorities, the submission of the Ukrainian people to the regime in the Kremlin.
Together, we must resist such intentions and protect the basic principles of international law and order, on which the security, stability and prosperity of the entire world depend. The inviolability of state borders, as well as the political independence of sovereign countries, must be collectively protected. There must be no compromise on these matters. Defending its right to exist and be free, Ukraine today pays a huge price for defending those basic principles. That is why we must be loud and clear in supporting Ukraine and condemning the aggressors.
Thank you for your attention. Glory to Ukraine!"

title: Speech by the Chairman of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Željko Komšić, on the Maidan in Kyiv, on the occasion of Ukraine's Independence Day
content:
"President Zelenskyy, your excellencies, proud citizens of Ukraine! It is my honour to address you today, on the occasion of the Independence Day of Ukraine. On this day, 32 years ago, the free citizens of Ukraine restored their independence. The fate of Ukraine finally belonged to its people.
We cannot fully celebrate today's holiday because Russia's unjust, unjustified and illegal aggression against your country continues. As we speak here, brave Ukrainian soldiers are defending the country on the lines and bleeding to reclaim Ukrainian land under temporary Russian occupation. Along with the soldiers, millions of Ukrainians are working hard to contribute to Ukraine's victory - factory workers, computer specialists, farmers, teachers, doctors, they all continue to work to keep the heart of this country beating stronger every day.
Your government, led by President Zelenskyy, has not only worked hard to respond to the enormous current dangers. It has taken bold steps to secure a European future for your country. Obtaining candidate status for membership in the European Union is the clearest sign of where Ukraine's future lies - among free, stable and prosperous European countries.
People around the world, including myself, are amazed and inspired by the indestructible Ukrainian spirit. Your fight to preserve your territories, your independence and freedom, is nothing short of heroic. It reminds us every day how fragile peace and freedom are, how hard we have to fight every day to preserve our democracy and independence.
Supporting Ukraine in this historic struggle goes far beyond the narrow interests of geopolitics. What is at the heart of this struggle is the preservation of the most basic human values - the desire to be free, to be safe and to have own identity. These principles are unbreakable even when defended with bare hands. About these values, there must be no calculations.
I am encouraged by the global support that Ukraine has received since the beginning of the aggression. But now is the time to expand and strengthen that support. With each new day, Ukraine becomes stronger, the aggressor weaker, more desperate, but also more dangerous. His downfall must be hastened.
The free people of Bosnia and Herzegovina are with Ukraine. We know very well everything about the horrors of war, aggression, destruction and war crimes. By witnessing the struggles of Ukraine, we are reminded of our own recent armed struggle, but also of today's challenges of attempts to destroy our country, its institutions and its unique identity.
As you fight for your country and its future, be wary of compromises that may threaten in peace what you so bravely defended in war. Make sure you achieve peace on your own terms, because the future of your country depends on it.
As I said at the beginning, this Independence Day cannot be fully celebrated because the aggression against Ukraine continues. But we can certainly celebrate Ukraine's indomitable spirit, knowing that in the end Ukraine will win. No one should have any doubts that the heroic and patriotic struggle of forty-four million Ukrainians will ever be defeated.
I congratulate Independence Day to you, with the wish for just, lasting peace and prosperity. Glory to Ukraine!"

title: Address of the member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dr Denis Bećirović at the ceremony on the occasion of the Day of the City of Cazin
content:
At the ceremony marking the Day of the City of Cazin, BiH Presidency Member Denis Bećirović, said that Bosnia and Herzegovina is under attack by nine dangerous strategies of lies and manipulation.
"The first strategy is a strategy of redirecting attention. There is a targeted attempt to divert people's attention from fatefully important issues to unimportant ones. They try to flood people with irrelevant information so that they don't think about crucial things important for the preservation of the state.
The second strategy is to destroy the state gradually, month by month, year by year. The planners of this strategy know that the sudden collapse of the state would cause strong resistance, and that is why they want to implement their goals through years of attrition and a policy of small steps. Their intention is to imperceptibly, in peace, destroy the country, without the patriots of Bosnia and Herzegovina being aware of the tectonic changes.
The third strategy is to purposefully cause confusion, to present enemies as friends and friends as enemies. We must recognize this and not allow this vicious hoax.
The fourth strategy is the political, psychological and media acclimatization of people to the project of dividing the state. The public is systematically trying to prepare itself to calmly and without resistance accept the cataclysm of the destruction of the state.
The fifth strategy is the abuse of emotions, with the aim of making rational judgment impossible. An approach is deliberately imposed in which we need to replace critical awareness with emotional impulses (anger, fear, etc.).
The sixth strategy is based on strong media indoctrination so that people do not understand the mechanisms of manipulation and the extent of the danger. The goal of this strategy is to keep people as ignorant as possible, so that it is easier to implement manipulative steps.
The seventh strategy is creating an environment of insecurity, apathy and pessimism. They are trying to disgust us with everything that is Bosnian. The anti-Bosnian power centres want us to renounce our history, our culture, our religion, our language, our country, our heroes...
The eighth strategy is to discredit all relevant forces and individuals who defend the state. The goal of this strategy is to expose all BiH. patriots to a strong attack from the outside, and at the same time to have installed individuals from the inside who equalize the responsibility of those who destroy and defend the state. It is not by chance that we have a series of texts discrediting the Bosnian cadres. It is part of a dangerous project.
The ninth strategy is to cause disunity and fragmentation of the forces fighting for the preservation of the state. That is why the most panic is caused by calls for pro-state forces to gather in the fight for issues of capital importance for the state.
Why did I talk about these nine dangerous strategies? We have to warn people about this hellish plan. We must truly inform, make aware, connect and activate people. Only with the state do we have a secure future."
The entire speech of the member of BiH Presidency, Dr Denis Bećirović can be found below:
Dear fighters of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
respected relatives of shaheeds and fallen fighters,
respected representatives of veterans' associations,
Citizens of Cazin,
respected mayor and friend Nermin Ogrešević!
The Day of the City of Cazin is an important date not only for Cazin, but also for the entire Krajina and the country of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The sixth of August is the Day of the city of Cazin, but also the date when we celebrate the anniversary of the breaking of the blockade of the Bihać district after 1,201 days of brutal aggressor's blockade. It is a date that has a special place in the hearts of all people who love Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Cazin is a city of heroes, a city of virtuous and hardworking people. In the last ten years, it has developed from a small Bosnian town into a modern European city that the entire Krajina and Bosnia and Herzegovina are proud of.
Today, from Cazin, I want to send a message that there is no trade with the homeland, Bosnia and Herzegovina is sacred.
There are no dilemmas: state or people, state or religion, state or party, state or family. The state must be in front and above everything. Why am I saying this? Because without the state, we will not preserve the people, religion, parties, or families.
The state is not just a mere bureaucratic apparatus, it is something more, more substantial and existential. For us, it is the fundamental assumption of freedom and survival.
It is time for all political entities to understand this. The sooner the better.
Our country does not need one-time, but long-term and statesmanlike messages.
We must dethrone stupidity, naivety, vanities, and the insatiable desire for power.
It is time to recognize the mother of Bosnia and Herzegovina's history and let it be our inspiration to come up with the best solutions.
We must overcome all that numbs our caution and strength.
The citizens and peoples of Bosnia and Herzegovina need the truth, because half-truths and untruths destroy the present and threaten the future.
Accepting a historical lie is a crime in peace! The principles of defence of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina were absolutely opposite to the aggressor's concept of ethnic persecution, mass war crimes and genocide. They were based on the fight for the human rights of every person and the construction of Bosnia and Herzegovina as a state of equal citizens and nations.
Civilizational, legal and moral distinctions between those who defended and those who attacked Bosnia and Herzegovina are clear to anyone who wants to face the facts. Legal and illegal, democratic and criminal, civilized and anti-civilized cannot and must not be equated.
The state of Bosnia and Herzegovina is under attack from nine dangerous strategies of lies and manipulation.
The first strategy is a strategy of redirecting attention. There is a targeted attempt to divert people's attention from fatefully important issues to unimportant ones. They try to flood people with irrelevant information so that they don't think about crucial things important for the preservation of the state.
The second strategy is to destroy the state gradually, month by month, year by year. The planners of this strategy know that the sudden collapse of the state would cause strong resistance, and that is why they want to implement their goals through years of attrition and a policy of small steps. Their intention is to imperceptibly, in peace, destroy the country, without the patriots of Bosnia and Herzegovina being aware of the tectonic changes.
The third strategy is to purposefully cause confusion, to present enemies as friends and friends as enemies. We must recognize this and not allow this vicious hoax.
The fourth strategy is the political, psychological and media acclimatization of people to the project of dividing the state. The public is systematically trying to prepare itself to calmly and without resistance accept the cataclysm of the destruction of the state.
The fifth strategy is the abuse of emotions, with the aim of making rational judgment impossible. An approach is deliberately imposed in which we need to replace critical awareness with emotional impulses (anger, fear, etc.).
The sixth strategy is based on strong media indoctrination so that people do not understand the mechanisms of manipulation and the extent of the danger. The goal of this strategy is to keep people as ignorant as possible, so that it is easier to implement manipulative steps.
The seventh strategy is creating an environment of insecurity, apathy and pessimism. They are trying to disgust us with everything that is Bosnian. The anti-Bosnian power centres want us to renounce our history, our culture, our religion, our language, our country, our heroes...
The eighth strategy is to discredit all relevant forces and individuals who defend the state. The goal of this strategy is to expose all BiH. patriots to a strong attack from the outside, and at the same time to have installed individuals from the inside who equalize the responsibility of those who destroy and defend the state. It is not by chance that we have a series of texts discrediting the Bosnian cadres. It is part of a dangerous project.
The ninth strategy is to cause disunity and fragmentation of the forces fighting for the preservation of the state. That is why the most panic is caused by calls for pro-state forces to gather in the fight for issues of capital importance for the state.
Why did I talk about these nine dangerous strategies? We have to warn people about this hellish plan. We must truly inform, make aware, connect and activate people. Only with the state do we have a secure future.
In the turbulent times of undisguised threats to the constitutional order, we must be united in the defence of independent, sovereign and indivisible Bosnia and Herzegovina.
In normal political circumstances, it is desirable for political parties to compete in offering ideas, programs and projects for a better arrangement of internal contents in the state. However, at the time of direct and brutal attacks on the constitutional order of Bosnia and Herzegovina, it is necessary to gather, connect and coordinate the activities of pro-Bosnian parties in a common front for the preservation of the homeland of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
We must completely subordinate party, group and individual interests to state interests. Personal, group, party or any particular animosities cannot and must not come before state interests.
Among the pro-Bosnian parties, there must be no division into position and opposition when deciding on capital issues such as: preservation and affirmation of the independence and sovereignty of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, protection of the territorial integrity of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, respect and affirmation of the principles of constitutionality and legality, unreserved support acceleration of the Euro-Atlantic integration of Bosnia and Herzegovina; promotion and assurance of human and civil freedoms.
We must make it clear to political extremists, as well as their mentors outside the borders of Bosnia and Herzegovina, that we will respond institutionally, uniquely and decisively to any activity that threatens the independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
What to do and how to move forward?
We need to start correcting the mistakes that have been building up for years and decades. It is not simple, but it is healing.
It is not a good practice that disempowers legal state bodies, and puts essential decision-making in the hands of party leaders and their headquarters.
It is not good for party leaders to talk in hotels while state bodies are not working.
It is not good for party leaders to turn parliaments and governments into flow boilers and not places of true decision-making.
Those are some of the mistakes we need to start correcting.
At the end of the address, let me underline, we will never give up on our homeland. Never!
May mercy be upon all the noble shaheeds of Bosnia and Herzegovina and may eternal memory be upon the fallen fighters of our defence and liberation war!
Let's protect our only homeland - Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Long live Bosnia and Herzegovina!

title: Address by the member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dr Denis Bećirović at the ceremonial academy on the occasion of the event of "Defence of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
Dear veterans of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, respected relatives of shaheeds and fallen fighters, respected representatives of veterans' associations, citizens of Sarajevo, Dear friends!
Today we have gathered here to pay our respects to the brave and honourable soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina (RBiH Army) who defended Igman, Sarajevo and Bosnia and Herzegovina. The battle for Igman is one of the biggest and most famous military victories of the soldiers of the RBiH Army. That victory was of decisive importance for the defence of the capital of Bosnia and Herzegovina, but also for the defence of the entire country.
The heavily armed aggressor was defeated by the superhuman fight of the RBiH Army fighters. On Igman, it was confirmed that nothing in this world is stronger than people who defend their families and their homeland.
No one in the long history of our country has such a place as the RBiH Army. It is an authentic, unique and famous armed force that saved the country, the people and a thousand years of Bosnian history. We cannot and must not forget that.
Today, 31 years after the beginning of the aggression against the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, we have the truth established by the courts.
We must remain silent on the truth. The highest courts of the United Nations proved that genocide against Bosniaks and aggression against the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina was committed.
For decades, big-state power centres have been spreading lies about the civil war. Now, there are court rulings that it was not a civil war. It is about an international armed conflict and aggression against the internationally recognized state of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Joint criminal enterprises were conducted against our country during which genocide was committed against Bosniaks. However, the aggressors did not succeed. They failed thanks primarily to the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina Army, whose heroism remains a permanent testimony of the honourable fight for the homeland.
Recently, the theory of equidistance has been promoted more and more often, which tries to equalize the role of the legal authorities of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina with the illegal authorities of parastatals.
Such attempts to level history are futile and doomed to failure. We must never fall into the trap of accepting baseless simplifications. Such an approach blurs the past, makes it difficult to understand the present and threatens the future.
The truth is a whole and without it there is no healthy communication between people and nations. The citizens and peoples of Bosnia and Herzegovina need the truth, because half-truths and untruths destroy the present and threaten the future. It is of inestimable importance for the future of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina that we never allow the killing of the truth about the history of our country.
Accepting a historical lie is a crime in peace!
The principles of defence of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina were absolutely opposite to the aggressor's concept of ethnic persecution, mass war crimes and genocide. They were based on the fight for the human rights of every person and the construction of Bosnia and Herzegovina as a state of equal citizens and nations.
The civilizational, legal and moral differences between the defenders of the state and those who attacked it are clear to anyone who wants to face the facts. Legal and illegal, humane and criminal, civilized and anti-civilized cannot and must not be equated.
Today, Bosnia and Herzegovina is once again under attack by followers of big-state policies. We are again under the attack of anti-Bosnian propaganda.
There are many of us who are not ready to remain silent while the project of breaking up the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina is being implemented before our own eyes.
Everyone who protects the state is the target of targeted media attacks. Such propaganda has been going on for decades. The time and the context are new, but the lies, subterfuge, and rigging are not new.
However, the enemies of Bosnia and Herzegovina must know: they will neither scare us nor stop us! We are not afraid of the followers of big state policies and we will fight against their project of destroying the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
It's time to start understanding politics beyond daily-political, narrow-party and personal understandings.
It is time to act pragmatically and strategically. It is time to act within the scope of the possible, with an eye to the future. That is why we must pave the way to the future regardless of the attacks.
The great writer Dostoevsky said, "If you set out for the goal and on the way start stopping and throwing stones at every dog that barks at you, you will never reach the goal."
We will not waste energy on the mercenaries who attack us on a daily basis, we will continue the unstoppable movement towards our goal - a safe, modern and Euro-Atlantic Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The state of Bosnia and Herzegovina is under attack from nine dangerous strategies of lies and manipulation.
The first strategy is a strategy of redirecting attention. There is a targeted attempt to divert people's attention from fatefully important issues to unimportant ones. They try to flood people with a flood of irrelevant information so that they don't think about crucial things important for the preservation of the state.
The second strategy is to destroy the state gradually, month by month, year by year. The planners of this strategy know that the sudden collapse of the state would cause strong resistance, and that is why they want to implement their goals through multi-year exhaustion and a policy of short steps. Their intention is to imperceptibly destroy the country in peace, without the patriots of Bosnia and Herzegovina being aware of the tectonic changes.
The third strategy is to purposefully cause confusion, to present enemies as friends and friends as enemies. We must recognize this and not allow this wickedness
The fourth strategy is the political, psychological and media acclimatization of people to the project of dividing the state. The public is systematically trying to prepare itself to calmly and without resistance accept the cataclysm of the destruction of the state.
The fifth strategy is the abuse of emotions in order to prevent rational judgment. An approach is deliberately imposed in which we need to replace critical awareness with emotional impulses (anger, fear, etc.).
The sixth strategy is based on strong media indoctrination, so that people do not understand the mechanisms of manipulation and the extent of the danger. The goal of this strategy is to keep people as ignorant as possible so that it is easier to implement manipulation steps.
The seventh strategy is creating an environment of insecurity, apathy and pessimism. They are trying to disgust us with everything that is Bosnian. The anti-Bosnian power centres want us to renounce our history, our culture, our religion, our language, our country, our heroes...
The eighth strategy is to discredit all relevant forces and individuals who defend the state. The goal of this strategy is to expose all BiH patriots to a strong attack from the outside, and at the same time to have installed individuals from the inside who equalize the responsibility of those who destroy and defend the state. It is no coincidence that we have a series of commissioned texts that discredit the Bosnian cadres. It's part of a dangerous project.
The ninth strategy is to cause disunity among the forces fighting for the preservation of the state. That is why the most panic is caused by calls for pro-state forces to gather in the fight for issues of capital importance for the state.
Why did I talk about these nine dangerous strategies? We have to warn people about this hellish plan. We must truly inform, make aware, connect and activate people. Only with the state do we have a secure future.
We will never forget the sacrifice of the shaheeds and fallen soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and we will teach new generations about it.
We will never give up our homeland.
We will never forget the best sons and daughters of our homeland.
They are a beacon that will permanently illuminate our honourable path of struggle for the homeland.
May mercy be upon all the noble shaheeds of Bosnia and Herzegovina and may eternal memory be upon the fallen fighters of our defence and liberation war!
Let us love and protect our only homeland - Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Long live Bosnia and Herzegovina!

title: Address of the member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dr Denis Bećirović on the occasion of the commemoration of the 28th anniversary of the genocide against Bosniaks in the "Safe Zone of
content:
Respected families of genocide victims, citizens of Srebrenica, Podrinje and Bosnia and Herzegovina, respected Excellencies, respected brothers and sisters!
Today, Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as the entire civilized part of the world, show deep respect for the victims of the only genocide in Europe after the Second World War.
Today we are here to say that we must never stop spreading the truth about the committed genocide against Bosniaks.
We will never give in to the politics and ideology of evil. We will not do it for the sake of the dead and those alive
It is our permanent human and civilizational obligation to find the strength and wisdom to speak about the committed genocide.
We must pay special respect to the Mothers of Srebrenica.
They have been tirelessly and courageously fighting for the truth and justice for twenty-eight years. These brave women deserve the highest possible recognition and respect.
They truly deserved to be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize.
A culture of memory strengthens truth and justice.
With the culture of memory, we oppose the culture of lies, the culture of denying crimes and genocide.
The culture of memory is the only way out of the spiral of violence and evil, the only way to heal society from the disease of hatred. That's why the choice is simple: either the culture of memory or the repetition of evil.
All those who offer Bosnia and Herzegovina a strategy of oblivion do not think well to our country. We must never agree to an institutional reckoning with memory. We must never consent to the erasure of memories.
The highest courts of the United Nations (UN) proved that genocide against Bosniaks and aggression against the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina were committed.
There was no civil war in our country, as some wanted to portray it. It was an international armed conflict. Brutal aggression was committed against the internationally recognized Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Joint criminal enterprises were conducted against our country during which genocide was committed against Bosniaks.
These are the facts that cannot be hidden or erased. These are permanent condemnations of the criminal large-state projects of breaking up Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Judgments of the International Court of Justice and The Hague Tribunal do not exist to be archived. They must be read in detail, analysed and implemented. Let us not forget that these are a part of binding international law.
The United Nations has admitted their mistake towards Bosnia and Herzegovina and Srebrenica.
Through the inaction and omissions of the UN, according to their own admission, they bear part of the responsibility for the genocide committed against the Bosniaks. The UN Secretary General's report on Srebrenica from 2000 clearly states:
"Through mistakes, bad decisions and the inability to recognize the evil that opposed us, we failed to fulfil our duty and help save the people of Srebrenica from the Serb campaign of mass killing (...) The tragedy of Srebrenica will haunt us forever".
Bearing in mind the public recognition of the responsibility and mistakes of the UN by the Secretary General of this organization, the verdicts of the highest courts of the UN, the adopted resolutions of the European Union, the United States of America, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Canada, Australia and numerous other countries, today I publicly ask the following questions:
Why are the mistakes made not corrected? Why is it allowed to pour salt on the wounds of the families of genocide victims? Why are those who deny the genocide against Bosniaks not sanctioned? Why are some representatives of the international community once again taking the path of yielding to policies that have been condemned by the courts as joint criminal enterprises?
Well-meaning people all over the world expect answers to these and similar questions because neither these questions nor the answers to them refer only to Bosnia and Herzegovina.
What we say today is not only directed towards the past but also towards the future.
When we talk about genocide, we must answer essential questions: Why was it committed? What are the motives? Who are the ideologues, planners and organizers? What is at the core of politics that committed genocide? Among the important questions, the following question arises: can the genocide against Bosniaks be repeated? To answer this question, we must compare the policies that led to the genocide in 1995 and the policies that threaten us again. So I will publicly ask and answer the following nine questions:
1. Do we again have politicians who speak publicly and work on the realization of the criminal project of Greater Serbia? The answer is - yes.
2. Do we again have politicians who threaten the independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity of Bosnia and Herzegovina? The answer is - yes.
3. Do we again have politicians who deny and attack the ethnic, religious and linguistic identity of Bosniaks? The answer is - yes.
4. Do we once again have politicians on the scene who openly destroy the constitutional order of the country? The answer is - yes.
5. Do we again have targeted attempts of political, media, intelligence and other forms of discrediting and demonizing Bosniaks? The answer is - yes.
6. Do we again have those who are insulting victims and glorifying criminals? The answer is - yes.
7. Do we have a repetition of dangerous media propaganda that discredits all those who defend the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina? The answer is - yes.
8. Do we again have those working on the demilitarization of Bosnia and Herzegovina while the neighbours are arming themselves to the teeth? The answer is - yes.
9. Are there again among us those who do not see and do not know what danger is looming over Bosnia and Herzegovina? The answer is - yes.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
The danger of repeating the genocide against Bosniaks has not been removed. Ideologies, policies, media, large-state power centres, large-state pretensions and other factors that led to the genocide against Bosniaks in the 90s are again present and threatening again.
What to do in Bosnia and Herzegovina?
We have to take special care of three elements.
The first is the strengthening of state-building awareness and politics. It is high time that we understand that the state must be at the top of the pyramid of values. Without the state, we will not preserve any other value.
The second element is the need for unity around strategic state issues.
And the third relates to the strengthening of the defence and security system. Only people who are willing, ready and equipped command the respect of the perpetrators of genocide. It is a lesson we must learn well.
A necessary step to resist the mindless attempt to collapse the Dayton Peace Agreement is to gather around strategic national issues that must be above personal, group and party interests.
We must all be aware that an unprecedented attack on the constitutional order of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina is underway. The foundations of the Dayton Peace Agreement were attacked. The peace process was attacked. An attempt to destroy the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina is underway.
All democratic and patriotic forces must gather together under the flag of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Disunity due to functions and pieces of government can lead to much bigger troubles. Political quarrels and failed forms of political action are not allies of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
All political parties that recognize and respect the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina should jointly and resolutely protect the fundamental values of civilization and Bosnia and Herzegovina, defend the Constitution of Bosnia and Herzegovina, the laws of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the final decisions of the Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Difficult challenges and the expected continuation of dangerous attacks on Bosnia and Herzegovina will inevitably, sooner or later, force all relevant political actors to subordinate party interests to state interests, in the interest of more effective protection of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The centuries behind us have carved Bosnia and Herzegovina as a common state of citizens and nations.
Every road in our country is a common road.
And the road to evil is a road to common evil and the road to good is a common road to good.
We are a country where there is no selective path.
So let's condemn evil and at the same time build a common path to the future.
Our path to the future is connected with membership in NATO and the EU.
That path is complex and attacked.
However, it is the path that has no alternative.

title: Address of the member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dr Denis Bećirović at the commemoration on the occasion of the 28th anniversary of the genocide against Bosniaks in the "United Natio
content:
Dear representatives of the Parliament and Government of His Royal Majesty, Ladies and Gentlemen, Dear friends!
First of all, I want to express my gratitude on behalf of myself and the vast majority of citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina to the Government and Parliament of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland (United Kingdom) for the principled struggle to preserve the truth about the genocide committed against Bosniaks.
I express my sincere gratitude to the chairman of the "Remembering Srebrenica" Foundation, Waqar Azmi, and to my appreciated friends from this foundation.
I would also like to pay my respects to Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher and Lord Paddy Ashdown, who are no longer with us, and who, during the aggression against the internationally recognized Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, demanded the just action of the international community.
Lord Paddy Ashdown, as a high representative of the international community in Bosnia and Herzegovina, will forever remain inscribed in the history of Bosnia and Herzegovina and Europe as a man who persistently and strongly fought to overcome the consequences of aggression and genocide. This diplomat and humanist will remain inscribed in capital letters in the history of our two countries.
I also express my gratitude to the Government of the United Kingdom for their contribution to the implementation of the Dayton Peace Agreement and the support for the Euro-Atlantic path of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina highly appreciate the engagement of the United Kingdom, which in 2015 proposed to the United Nations Security Council (UN) Resolution S/2015/508 on Srebrenica.
Although the adoption of the text of the Resolution was stopped by the use of the right of veto by the Russian Federation, we saw the Resolution as an important civilizational step forward in the fight for truth and justice.
We are convinced that this resolution is as important for the world as it is for Bosnia and Herzegovina, because it unequivocally expresses, on a global level, the condemnation of genocide and support for the victims.
The highest courts of the UN proved what happened in Bosnia and Herzegovina from 1992 to 1995.
There was no civil war in our country, as some wanted to portray it. It was an international armed conflict. Brutal aggression was committed against the internationally recognized Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Joint criminal enterprises were conducted against our country, during which genocide was committed against Bosniaks.
These are facts that cannot be erased. These are permanent condemnations of the criminal large-state projects of breaking up Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Verdicts of the International Court of Justice and the Hague Tribunal do not exist to be archived. They must be thoroughly analysed and implemented.
Numerous final verdicts of international and national courts have proven that the only genocide in Europe after the Second World War was committed by the so-called army and police units of Republika Srpska.
During July 1995, over 8,000 Bosniaks were liquidated in a ruthless killing operation, with a clear intention, organized and according to a precisely determined plan and pattern, in a horrific manner. More than 800 children were among those killed.
In and around Srebrenica, thousands of captured Bosniaks were brutally liquidated and buried in mass graves. Hundreds of them were buried alive. Children were separated from their mothers and killed in front of their eyes. Mass and individual liquidations, forced relocation of residents, committed crimes of rape, violent separation of families, deliberate and targeted destruction of property and civilian objects, and imposed difficult existential living conditions, were consciously committed with the intention of physically or biologically destroying Bosniaks as an ethnic group.
About everything committed in and around Srebrenica, in July 1995, there is a lot of evidence, including mass graves - primary, secondary and tertiary.
The so-called political and military authorities of Republika Srpska planned the crime of genocide, its execution, the provision of logistical support, and then the concealment of the crime through the digging of mass graves and their concealment, which, I emphasize, was confirmed by the decisions of the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia.
For the crime of genocide against Bosniaks in and around Srebrenica, the Hague Tribunal sentenced the first president of the self-proclaimed Republika Srpska, Radovan Karadžić, to life imprisonment, as well as other top political and military officials of this parastate. They have been legally condemned, but their politics is not dead.
Unfortunately, the current president of Republika Srpska entity, Milorad Dodik, did not learn a lesson from the judgments of international courts. On the contrary, similar to the criminal Radovan Karadžić, Dodik denies the committed genocide, insults the victims and their families, and takes actions that represent a serious threat to the preservation of peace and security in Bosnia and Herzegovina and the region.
For the investigation of the genocide committed against Bosniaks in and around Srebrenica, the verdict of the International Court of Justice is of particular importance, in terms of Serbia's responsibility for not preventing the genocide. According to the verdict, Serbia is the only country in Europe that violated the UN Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide.
The genocide against Bosniaks in Srebrenica was not the result of spontaneity. In addition to the perpetrators of the genocide, we must shed light on the role of intellectuals, the media and other structures that designed, organized and supported the execution of the genocide.
The United Nations and the democratic countries of the world have acknowledged the mistakes committed towards Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The Secretary General of the United Nations, Kofi Annan, admitted the guilt of the international community, saying that "Srebrenica represents the greatest shame in the history of the United Nations."
Committed mistakes can no longer be corrected, but new ones can be stopped.
Therefore, the pro-Russian president of the entity Republika Srpska should be urgently and decisively stopped before he destabilizes Bosnia and Herzegovina and the Western Balkans.
It is time for the European Union to join the sanctions imposed by the United Kingdom and the United States of America against genocide deniers and destroyers of the Dayton Peace Agreement.
The world and Europe must learn from Srebrenica.
Since the July days of 1995, the word Srebrenica has echoed around our planet as a symbol of the only genocide in Europe after the Second World War.
Any evil that we do not stop at the beginning becomes much bigger and more dangerous later on. Together, let us stop the new evil that threatens peace in Bosnia and Herzegovina again.
The brutal Russian aggression against Ukraine should be a reminder of what happens when the stage is to compromise and ignore dangerous policies.
The democratic and free part of humanity must clearly distinguish democrats from autocrats, victims from criminals. The direct or indirect equating of victims and criminals leads to a complete collapse of morality and our civilization.
In Europe, Bosnia and Herzegovina and the world, we must build a culture of remembrance of the genocide.
The genocide against Bosniaks in the heart of Europe must not be forgotten, marginalized and denied. We must not allow this for the sake of the future of humanity.
A culture of remembrance is not a culture of revenge. It is a culture of education about policies and ideologies that bring evil and violence.
The purpose of the culture of memory is not to create discord and hatred, but to prevent evil and crime.
With the culture of memory, we fight for democracy and human rights.
By remembering, we preserve the dignity of those who are not among us alive.
With memory, we fight for a safe future for new generations.
Thank you to the United Kingdom for preserving the truth about Srebrenica and giving hope for a more just future.

title: Address of the member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dr Denis Bećirović at the Academy in the National Theatre Mostar on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the unblocking of Mostar
content:
Dear members of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
respected families of fallen fighters and shaheeds,
respected veterans and war commanders, representatives of veteran associations, disabled war veterans,
representatives of all levels of legislative and executive power in Bosnia and Herzegovina,
dear guests, dear friends,
citizens of Mostar and Herzegovina,
Today is the third day of Eid al-Adha and allow me to once again congratulate all Muslims in Bosnia and Herzegovina, the region and the world this great holiday with the words: Eid Mubarak!
The fight for Mostar was a fight for the survival of Bosnia and Herzegovina. That is why today, with pride, we celebrate one of the brightest dates in the history of Mostar and our country.
As a member of BiH Presidency, I have the great honour to address you today on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the unblocking of Mostar and the death of the famous hero of the liberation war, Brigadier General Midhad Hujdur Hujka.
Remembering the glorious past of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina (RBiH Army), recalling the commander Midhat Hujdur Hujka and his fighters, I want to clearly say that we are completely open to building the future on the foundations of truth and justice
Mostar was attacked by two evils from two sides. Nevertheless, even in such unfavourable circumstances, the RBiH Army managed to preserve the fundamental idea of freedom and equality.
In almost impossible conditions, when it had a double enemy against it, an embargo on the import of weapons and blocked borders, the RBiH Army managed, on this day, thirty years ago, to unblock a part of the city and connect Mostar with the rest of the free territory.
By unblocking Mostar, a message was sent to Bosnia and Herzegovina, Europe and the world, that the heroic RBiH Army will not deviate from the idea of a free and complete state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Today I especially want to emphasize the role and importance of the Fourth Corps of the RBiH Army, which heroically led the fight for the freedom of Mostar and the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The heroic struggle of the people of Mostar saved not only this city, but also the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina in these areas.
The importance of the Fourth Corps for the defence of the country is immeasurable, and that is why I use this opportunity to express deep respect to the best sons of our country for everything they have done.
It will be permanently recorded that the weakly armed fighters of the RBiH Army heroically stopped the many times superior aggressors. They are most responsible for saving Mostar and the idea of a multi-ethnic and free Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The fighters of the RBiH Army wrote an unforgettable epic of the fight for the defence of their city, state and the civilisation values of modern Europe.
We must never stop speaking that truth.
The truth about the heroic struggle of the defenders of Mostar and Bosnia and Herzegovina was also recognized by Europe on May 9, 1995.
The RBiH Army is the only legal armed force from Bosnia and Herzegovina that received an invitation on May 9, 1995 to participate in the military parade in Paris on the occasion of Victory over Fascism Day.
In this way, Europe also recognized the honourable struggle led by the RBiH Liberation Army and included it in the European anti-fascist family. The honour of carrying the flag of Bosnia and Herzegovina went to the celebrated commander of the 41st Mostar Glorious and Knight Brigade, Semir Drljević Lovac.
It was a recognition of the heroic struggle of the inhabitants of Mostar, who in impossible conditions defended the statehood of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the principles of common life in these areas.
The highest courts of the United Nations provided legal satisfaction to the defenders and citizens of Mostar and Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The Hague Tribunal confirmed the legal nature of the war waged against the internationally recognized state of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Final verdicts, including verdicts on JCEs, proved that it was an international armed conflict.
Neighbouring states fought a war for territories with the aim of creating a greater Serbia, and in one period of the war, a greater Croatia.
The crimes that were committed were not random, they were planned and organized with a clear goal in mind. The crimes were individualized, but it was proven that they were committed within the JCE, with the coordination of the highest officials of the neighbouring states and the entire system of civil and military authorities of para-state that were formed as part of the crime system.
The attempt to build the HVO (Croatian Defence Council) Museum on the site of the concentration camp and the scandalous messages of the war criminal Dario Kordić also speak of the failures of the international community.
Unfortunately, they failed to establish transitional justice in Bosnia and Herzegovina. That mistake must be corrected by the international community.
All legal mechanisms and diplomatic influence should be used to stop the construction of the HVO military museum on the site of the former Heliodrom camp.
Instead of building a museum, a suitable marker should be placed on this location, which will testify that there was a concentration camp in this place.
Unfortunately, the attacks on the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina did not stop even in the third decade of the 21st century.
After 1995, the big-state protagonists changed their methods and tactics, but the goal remained the same. This, among other things, is evidenced by the views of the Great Serbian ideologue Dobrica Ćosić, who openly explained how the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina should be destroyed: "For two centuries we have had the same goal, which is the fight for the liberation and unification of the Serb people. (...) No war objective was achieved only in the trenches. (…) All war goals in the history of the world were achieved in peace (…) We have to conclude peace in order to end the war in peace and achieve our historical goals".
Against the backdrop of these and similar instructions, the leaders of Bosnia and Herzegovina entity of RS, with the help of some external power centres, are trying to achieve in peace what the war criminals could not achieve with the aggression against the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the genocide against the Bosniaks. We must oppose such criminal policy decisively and in an organized manner.
A dirty political, media, psychological, diplomatic and intelligence war is being waged intensively against our country and all those who sincerely defend it.
The manipulators are once again applying the tried and tested recipe of discrediting the cadres who unreservedly protect the state. The destruction of Bosnia and Herzegovina always started and took place through cadres. Cadres are the secret of politics.
As in the darkest times of aggression against the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, theses are again replaced by targeted propaganda, the truth is twisted, lies are spread, labels are made, mocked, denigrated, accused, judged...
However, they must know that we will never give up. We must not be cowards and keep silent about new injustices towards the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina and its citizens.
Experience tells us that only the state and state institutions can protect people and the state.
Bosnia and Herzegovina's political forces must be ready to use all available potential to help legal state bodies, with the aim of stopping political extremists. We must all show together that legalism is stronger than outlawry and legal violence.
We must not stop looking for the most effective way to protect the independence, sovereignty and territorial integrity of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Let tehre be no dilemma, it is about the political dimension of protection, because there are competent institutions of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina for international law, criminal law and security aspects, as well as institutions authorized by the Dayton Peace Agreement.
Before us is the fight for equal human rights of all people and the democratic state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
It's not time to calculate: Will we or will we not? Can we or can we not? We simply have to! We have to show people a good way in bad times.
Our vision of Bosnia and Herzegovina is one, unique, democratic and legal state, a member of the Euro-Atlantic family of countries, in which different identities - ethnic, religious, regional, social and other - are freely developed and respected, but also builds a common state identity of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
In the coming years, we must make additional efforts to speed up the legally defined path to the EU and NATO.
What in the war was the unblocking of Mostar, the defense of Sarajevo, Bihać, Goražde, Tuzla and other cities, today is the dynamism of Euro-Atlantic integration.
Bosnia and Herzegovina belongs to the world family of free and democratic countries and our place is among the most developed countries in the world.
Complete and unique Bosnia and Herzegovina has no alternative!
Freedom has no alternative.
We do not have country of our own but Bosnia and Herzegovina.
I firmly believe in the future of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
May there be mercy and glory to those who wove their lives into the foundations of the free and democratic state of Bosnia and Herzegovina!
May the indomitable state of Bosnia and Herzegovina live forever!

title: Address by the Serb member and BiH Presidency Chairwoman Željka Cvijanović at the Astana International Forum
content:
First of all, I want to thank our hosts for their hospitality and the excellent organization of this important event. It is so nice to be here in the beautiful country of Kazakhstan. But it is also very nice and useful to have the opportunity to exchange opinions and views with other participants on some key issues of the modern world.
In the past several decades, especially after the Cold War, we have lived in the world of globalization where multilateralism is one of the prerogatives of international relations and actions, not only to achieve cooperation, but also to address various challenges and threats.
In this new pattern all the actors of international relations, be it states or other entities, are strongly oriented towards each other and are highly interdependent. And this is something that certainly never existed in earlier periods of human history.
It is quite logical that in such circumstances multilateralism has become a standard of communication and action in the modern world. And It is also logical that it has created “new rules of the game” that must be respected by all. But in reality this is not always the case which leads to the situation where multilateral structures become a tool or an instrument for realizing the interests and selfish goals of small number of countries who possess superior economic, political or military power.
And let’s be honest to say that some major crises in the world have occured due to the inability of multilateralism to solve accumulated regional or global problems.
The policy of power or force on one side and the policy of democratic multilateralism, on the other one, represent two opposite mutually irreconcilable poles.
We have learned so far that functional multilateralism cannot exist without a proper environment = that is a system of multipolar balance of power, where no actor or group of actors will be able to impose their own rules and attitudes on others and where the level of mutual respect and communication is much higher than is the case nowadays.
Therefore, in this globalized world, it is necessary to more sincerely return to a wider universal platform, while at the same time nourishing all regional forms of cooperation.
But evidently, the UN as the global platform has encountered numerous problems in fulfilling its own mission and basic function.Now it is more obvious than ever that there is no "International community" as a real collective category. The atmosphere within the global or international frame is too divisive for it to be seen as a uniform collective body.
But if we really want to consolidate the collective multilateral structures then it is necessary for certain actors to give up the policy of force. Obviously international relations are militarized and in order to overcome such a situation the concept of dialogue and diplomatic efforts needs to be revitalized .
This means indivuidual states must not use or misuse the regional or global structures to impose their own interests on the others.
I come from a country which is a perfect example of how multilateral structures have been misused by some countries in order to manipulate the implementation of an international treaty that established peace and constitutional order in BiH.
Following the war in BiH (1992 – 1995) and based on the above treaty the OHR was established to facilitate and coordinate some aspects of the post war processes. Contrary to the initial purpose and by acting beyond their mandate these foreign diplomats acting as HRs have turned into rulers who have usurped the competencies of our domestic institutions and have imposed numerous pieces of legislation, amended entities constitutions and even dismissed elected officials from office all by decree and without any due process. Their continued presence and the powers they illegaly excercise have created a situation where BiH is treated as a colony.
Therefore international structures and organizations must not serve as a playground of the “big ones”. If we speak about partnership then it should be partnership for all not partnership for one or several at the expense of all the others.
In the past decades we have seen many situations where one actor or a group of actors have tried to format the whole world in accordance with their own interests and goals. Great powers, as a rule, behave as superior and act from the position of dominance.
Thus, the key responsibility for the current state of affairs in the world, and for the fate of multilateralism, lies with those who act from the position of power. By doing so they may endanger and eventually completely ruin the major principles of multilateralism. On the other side, small or less powerful countries are far more ready for dialogue.
What we can see within the multilateral structures nowadays is far from shared values or common interests.
That is why the international structures and organizations must be redesigned in such a way that they ensure equality of all actors.
Sadly, double standards and hypocrisy are part of many multilateral processes of today.
The evident failure of the multilateral geopolitical concept does not necessarily mean that we should give up all the forms of multilateralism. It would be very dangerous even to think that international cooperation and multilateral approaches are no longer needed. On the contrary they are very much needed, but the current multilateral system should be rehauled and re-energized in order to address the complexities of a rapidly changing world.
Obviously a new rational and realistic agenda is needed to gather all the actors together within multilateral structures of the future otherwise multilateralism will end up in complete anarchy. And this is exactly what we need to avoid.

title: Address by the member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dr Denis Bećirović to the public in the BiH Presidency building, on the occasion of the pronouncement of the verdict of the Internati
content:
Respected families of victims of genocide and war crimes, respected representatives of the media, ladies and gentlemen, citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina! At the beginning of my address, I would like to remind once again that 31st of May is marked as the Day of White Ribbons, as a sign of memory and deep reverence for the 3,176 citizens of Prijedor who were killed during the aggression against the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Among those killed are 102 children. We must never forget the innocent victims.
Today is an important day for Bosnia and Herzegovina, the region, Europe and the world. Thirty years of the history of the Hague Tribunal (the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia - ICTY and its legal successor the International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Courts -IRMCC) are behind us. Based on the judgments of this tribunal, we must continue our common journey towards justice and truth.
With today's final verdict against the leaders of the State Security Service (SDB), Jovica Stanišić and Franko Simatović, we are closer to establishing the full truth about the aggression against the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The tribunal was established in accordance with Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations (UN) due to crimes committed in the former SFRY, and especially in the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, which, according to the assessment of the UN Security Council, represented a threat to international peace and security.
The President of the International Residual Mechanism for Criminal Courts (IRMCC), Judge Graciela Gatti Santana, emphasized, among other things, that the search for international criminal justice is a "journey that never ends". Recalling the importance of the establishment of the ICTY, the president of the IRMCC emphasized that the pronouncement of the appeal verdict in the case of the Prosecutor v. Stanišić and Simatović "represents a firm sign of a step towards achieving justice".
The establishment of the ICTY had legal, historical, civilizational and moral significance.
The tribunal was the first international criminal court formed after the Nuremberg and Tokyo tribunals, which prosecuted criminals after World War II.
The Hague Tribunal left a huge archive of committed genocide, crimes against humanity and other crimes. Among other things, the legacy of The Hague consists of: 2.5 million transcripts of court proceedings, 422,000 documents and 30,000 videos. 10,800 trial days were held at the Hague Tribunal, and over 4,600 witnesses testified. In total, almost 1,500 years of imprisonment and seven life sentences were imposed. The tribunal did not judge nations but determined individual responsibility.
After this verdict, politicians from neighboring countries, as well as some from Bosnia and Herzegovina, must understand that the policy of force, aggression and crime does not pay off and that there are always mechanisms that sanction such policies.
One of the goals of the ICTY was to bring to justice those responsible for the most brutal crimes committed after the Second World War.
The Hague Tribunal contributed to the establishment of historical facts, fight against the denial of the truth and helped the states created after the dissolution of the former SFRY to face their past.
The truth about the committed genocide and the legacy of the Hague Tribunal remains a permanent reminder to humanity.
The ICTY's legacy of civilization is that some of the highest officials responsible for genocide, crimes against humanity and other crimes were brought to justice.
