That is evident in their efforts to force inequality among citizens on the basis of ethnicity, which, to remind you once again, is a form of racial discrimination, and the efforts to create ethnically pure territorial units. I am telling you all this to show on real examples of how the neglect of human rights and creating an environment of inequality among citizens, individuals, can have political agendas, which lead to destabilization of entire regions in the world, such as the Western Balkans. Apart from the fact that something like this is completely unacceptable, it is also very dangerous.
Mr. President,
Distinguished colleagues,
I mention this situation in my country in the context of the importance of the mechanisms of the United Nations. By means of two resolutions, the UN established the institution of the United Nations High Representative in Bosnia and Herzegovina, to take care of the implementation of the Dayton Peace Agreement. Thus the obligation of the United Nations itself to protect the international order, through the protection of acts of international law. One of those acts is the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. Therefore, I believe that this is the right place to emphasize the expectation that the new High Representative of the international community in Bosnia and Herzegovina will take into account the need to protect international legal acts and their fundamental values. That is one of his most important tasks. Otherwise, if the international community itself in Bosnia and Herzegovina wants to abandon the implementation of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, then the following question rightly arises - is the Universal Declaration even necessary if its implementation is selective? Should we even talk about the protection of human rights in general if, in the specific case of Bosnia and Herzegovina, where the United Nations still has an executive mandate through the Office of the High Representative, we do not show by example that we are ready to stand for common values such as protection of human rights and equality of every citizen in relation to someone else and different.
I believe that, despite all the differences of political views within Bosnia and Herzegovina, including the international community represented by the Peace Implementation Council in BiH, which assists the High Representative, the only guiding light to further political development of my country, as a pledge to preserve its peace and future, must be respect for human rights values. All the people of my country, regardless of their identity, ethnicity, religious affiliation or absence thereof, must have the same rights. Otherwise, we will end up in an “Orwellian society”, where it is accepted that some are, after all, more important than others. That always jeopardizes the stability of a society and undermines peace and security. From this very place, I call upon the United Nations institutions to insist on the values of human rights protection in every segment of their activities.
Mr. President,
Finally, I would like to express my support for the efforts of the Secretary-General, who, with the help of his services and the UN agencies, has managed to preserve the role of the United Nations in these difficult circumstances of the pandemic. Also to you, President, for your effort this year to provide a live opportunity to exchange views on current world problems reflecting also on our social activities in the countries we come from.
I believe we will next year have a General Debate under better epidemiological circumstances. That certainly requires us to promote the necessity of vaccination as the only scientifically proven way to avoid fatal consequences for human health, but also severe economic consequences for the society.
Thank you

title: Address by BiH Presidency Chairman Željko Komšić at press conference during the official visit by President of the Republic of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdoğan
content:
Mister President, esteemed members of the Presidency, ladies and gentlemen, media representatives. On behalf of the Presidency of BiH and in my personal name, I wish to express once again my pleasure to have the opportunity to talk with President of the Republic of Turkey, Mr. Erdogan, a man who has certainly proven himself as a true friend to Bosnia and Herzegovina together with his administration and the people of the Republic of Turkey. We had very useful and honest conversations, some tete-a-tete, some as delegation meetings.
The topics certainly included those related to bilateral relations, but also wider regional relations, given the current political situation. Of course, we also touched on some current global issues.
In short, I would highlight certain topics. The agreement is that the next trilateral meeting, meaning the trilateral meeting between Bosnia and Herzegovina-Republic of Turkey-Republic of Serbia, will be held in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The exact date will be defined. It is a continuation of a whole cycle of such meetings which, in general, proved to be very useful, primarily in terms of stabilization of the political situation in relations between our countries. It furthermore is useful in enabling stabilization of the whole situation in the region, especially because they are related to some specific projects. Primarily, I mean a large infrastructure project, the construction of the Sarajevo-Belgrade-Sarajevo highway, which is going at its own pace, maybe not as fast as we had expected, but still there are positive steps forward in this respect.
We also discussed the need, the opportunity, especially for Bosnia and Herzegovina, that the trade exchange between our two countries will finally reach that magical figure of 1 billion euros. Okay, dollars, euros, the exchange rate for both is similar.
We have successful economic cooperation, but there is really a lot of room for development and further improvement of economic relations. Naturally, we are aware of President Erdogan's situation regarding the state of investments, primarily of Turkish partners in BiH, problems encountered by, for example, Turkish Ziraat Bank, which wants to increase its capital, however, it cannot realise this because the Federation of BiH has not completed the process of appointing the Securities Commission.
We talked about certain specific projects when it comes to the need to bring Turkish investors, that is, the companies operating in BiH, on an equal footing with domestic companies. You will probably guess this refers to "Natron" in Maglaj and the former soda factory in Lukavac, that is, the supply of these companies with coal.
In addition, we discussed the intention and need for our two countries to sign a letter of intent for cooperation in the field of energy, which we consider to be vital given the situation in the energy sector and the challenges that await us in the coming years.
What I believe would be of particular interest to media in Bosnia and Herzegovina is that there was talk about internal political situation in Bosnia and Herzegovina. I do not wish to interpret who said what, especially since all the participants are present here. Therefore, if you are interested, which I guess you are, please ask each individual what they think about it, naturally during the question time session. That would be all from me at the start. We stand at your disposal for the questions, naturally as both time and space allow. Thank you.

title: Address by President of the Republic of Turkey Tayyip Erdoğan at the press conference at the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
Dear Chairman Mister Komšić, dear members Mr Džaferović and Mister Dodik, dear ministers, respected journalists and media representatives.
I would like to express my great satisfaction with the visit to Sarajevo after two years. I feel at home in this remarkable place. Bosnia and Herzegovina is in our hearts, thank you for the warm welcome.
I would also like to thank the Chairman and esteemed members of the Presidency of BiH for the hospitality they have shown us.
This year, on March 16, a joint meeting was held in Ankara, where I was the host. Later, we met in Antalya, 17-20th of June at the South East Europe Cooperation Process Summit, and this visit represents our third meeting this year. This frequency of our contacts is a concrete indicator of the value we attach to our relationships and close dialogue. Bosnia and Herzegovina has a special place in the hearts of our people.
Messages of solidarity from Bosnia and Herzegovina after the fires and floods we have faced in recent weeks, are an indication that this love of our peoples is not unrequited. On this occasion, I would like to express my great gratitude to our brothers and sisters in Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as to the chairman and members for the messages of solidarity they sent us.
Dear media representatives, at the meeting we just held with the members of the Presidency, we focused on the work we can do in the coming period. We also talked about bilateral relations, as well as relations in the region and globally. We spoke in the field of political and economic ties that exist between our peoples. We agreed that we should speed up the implementation of this peace project.
We updated the Free Trade Agreement that we signed during the official visit of the Presidency of BiH in Ankara, in May 2019, and which entered into force on August 1, 2021. Therefore, this development will contribute to the increase of our trade and investments in BiH. But we also want to develop cooperation in the fields of industry, tourism, education, agriculture and livestock breeding. Of course, we also attach importance to strengthening our strong ties in the cultural and other fields.
Distinguished media representatives, during our meeting we exchanged views on current developments in the Balkans and we agree that we should take steps to increase economic development and, of course, prosperity in our region, for the benefit of all our peoples.
Furthermore, our goal for a billion-euro trade exchange is important and of great value. I want to say that we have confirmed our support for BiH's integration into Euro-Atlantic organisations. Territorial integrity, political unity and, of course, the sovereignty of BiH are the keys to regional peace. We will continue to work together to preserve regional stability.
Of course, on this occasion, I would like to say that at the meetings we held, we also talked today about Afghanistan. I wish to say that we are together with Afghanistan in a very short period of time. The world has moved towards another situation, towards another condition, with 170 people have already died in Afghanistan, already in this period. All this shows that developed countries have to be very careful when leaving an area. However, that was not the case in Afghanistan. Unfortunately, terrorist organizations have taken over this country. Other countries have left Afghanistan and handed it over to terrorists. It will be a great burden. ISIL has taken responsibility for this act, but who is fighting ISIL the most? Turkey fought ISIL the most. Turkey is not just doing it in words. What should we do? We need to work concretely on solving these problems, on a global level.
Now I’m talking about the Taliban. These present-day Taliban are not the old, former Taliban. So, it doesn't matter who says what, but who does what. Today, the Taliban are in Afghanistan. What they do is important. What they will do in the future is important, not what they did before. We, as Turkey, are currently focused on moving our civilians to Turkey. We have about 50 people left, technical staff. Beyond that, we have withdrawn everything, we have moved everything to our country and we hope that peace will be established in that area. We will continue to support the construction of infrastructure, as we have done to date in Afghanistan. Future developments will determine our attitudes towards the area.
Once again, allow me to express my deepest respect to this people and this country.
Thank you.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Šefik Džaferović at the press conference during the official visit of President of the Republic of Turkey Recep Tayyip Erdoğan
content:
Dear President of the Republic of Turkey, Mr. Erdogan, dear colleagues, Chairman of the Presidency of BiH Mr. Komšić and Member of the Presidency Mr. Dodik, ladies and gentlemen, journalists, dear friends, I greet you all.
Right at the beginning, I wish to say that everything Chairman of the Presidency of BiH, Mr. Komšić, and President of the Republic of Turkey, Mr. Erdogan, said in their introductory speeches, is what we discussed at the meetings today. There is nothing to be added and I agree with everything that has been said, but it seems customary now for us, the members of the Presidency of BiH, to make an address at press conferences.
If I evaluate the relations between the Republic of Turkey and Bosnia and Herzegovina, I can say that, as everyone knows, they are friendly and brotherly relations. The Republic of Turkey is a great friend of BiH, President Erdogan is a great friend of BiH. The Republic of Turkey practically does not ask anything from BiH, it only offers readiness to help BiH. We are grateful to have one such friend as the Republic of Turkey and President Erdogan, a friend to the whole of BiH, to all peoples, to all citizens in BiH. In summary, in the past three years since the current Presidency has been operating there have been numerous high level meetings, from May 2, 2019 in Ankara, then on March 16 this year in Ankara, then in July this year in Antalya, and then the meeting on July 8, 2019 here in Sarajevo, in the Presidency of BiH, when we had SEECEP. All these are meetings at the highest level.
Then we could say the following. First, the Republic of Turkey and President Erdogan are an important factor in the stability of the Western Balkans, and that is a very important fact. We also ask President Erdogan and the Republic of Turkey to continue with this policy, the stabilizing policy in the Western Balkans. The Republic of Turkey has initiatives in this context, in which it plays a part, like Bosnia and Herzegovina. These are trilateral meetings: Turkey-Serbia-BiH and Turkey-Croatia-BiH. It is very important that these trilateral meetings are revived and we plan this year, if pandemic conditions allow, to hold a trilateral meeting: the Republic of Turkey-Republic of Serbia- Bosnia and Herzegovina, here in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is on its European path, it is on its NATO path, but within that, cooperation with the Republic of Turkey and our friends, such as the Republic of Turkey, is very important. The Republic of Turkey also has its own European path, it is a member of NATO, and as we could hear from President Erdogan's speech, the Republic of Turkey supports the Euro-Atlantic path of BiH.
Another thing I would especially like to point out here are the untapped opportunities for economic cooperation.
In this convocation of the Presidency of BiH, we signed the Memorandum on May 2, 2019 in Ankara, and on March 16 this year in Ankara, the Agreement on Cooperation in the Field of Infrastructure.
This agreement is vital in the construction of the Sarajevo-Belgrade highway, it is the permission of the states to start this project, which is, besides economic and infrastructural, also a very important political project. Moreover, it is a politically restabilizing project in the Western Balkans. It remains for the Parliament of Turkey to ratify the agreement and then start with concrete activities on the construction of the highway. I am in favor of starting the construction of this highway in as many places in BiH as possible, both in respect to the northern as well as the southern connection. There are interests to make it so. We expect and I have no doubt that the Republic of Turkey will offer favorable conditions to Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The other thing is the Free Trade Agreement. We signed the Free Trade Agreement in May 2019 in Ankara. It has been ratified in both parliaments and there are untapped opportunities.
Turkey has given Bosnia and Herzegovina the best benefits in relation to all countries in the world when it comes to free trade. I thank the Republic of Turkey, President Erdogan for this. Still, we don't use this benefit. We have to organize ourselves to make use of this great comparative advantage for Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Finally, there are companies from the Republic of Turkey that operate in BiH, large companies such as Sisajam, Hayat, Ziraat Bank, which have problems in doing business here. President Erdogan, it is up to us in Bosnia and Herzegovina to help these companies, because by helping these companies, we are helping ourselves first and foremost.
Thank you once again for this visit, I wish for you to feel comfortable in BiH and of course, we will continue and intensify this cooperation.
I said at the end, I don’t like it when I say at the end, and then something important comes to me again that I didn’t say, but it really is at the end now. BiH needs peace, it needs stability, it needs the functioning of institutions, it needs a stable environment. It is in the interest of all of us in this country to move forward strongly.
I said at the end, I don’t like it when I say at the end, and then something important comes to me again that I didn’t say, but it really is at the end now. Bosnia and Herzegovina needs peace, it needs stability, it needs the functioning of institutions, it needs a stable environment. It is in the interest of all of us in this country so that we can move forward strongly.
Thank you for your attention.

title: Address delivered by BiH Presidency Member Milorad Dodik at the press conference on the official visit of Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, President of the Republic of Turkey
content:
It is always certainly an important issue that such a great statesman, great politician, great leader as President Erdoğan is among us. He is a representative of a powerful and strong country indeed. I am also glad that his visits take place continually. We have discussed important issues for a long time. I have always felt his affinity which is reflected in view of assistance to economic development, for development of infrastructure and for development of all areas that we have discussed continuously, and that is exactly what took place today, tonight, here. I just want to affirm what the President himself has said.
I do hope that we will go into detail about the fine tuning related to the building of the motorway. Details are always a problem. I believe, as I said to the President, that BiH can sustain, our economy can sustain the conditions which are usual in a commercial sense, but we do count on the position of our friends in that regard. Thus, what we need to do is to start discussion on details, on a commercial contract as I understand it, to specify it and know the way we will proceed. This is a historic, infrastructure project, which is the result of both willingness and wish of President Erdoğan to support exactly both the development and connectedness in the Balkans in this way.
Of course, we also discussed some other important political issues. I presented to President Erdoğan the facts related to the political situation and the internal situation here in BiH. Afghanistan shows best that foreigners can introduce order in a country and maintain it. We believe in internal agreement only, which is always necessary on each issue because that is the best way. Further, I stated here, and I want to re-affirm that position in public hereafter that we do believe in cooperation with President Erdoğan more than with some other failed attempts conducted here in BiH, aimed at imposing some solutions. I am convinced, therefore, that, if Turkey were included in the story about the so-called promotion related to High Representative, the current travesty would not have taken place, and that, in view of it, it is absolutely clear that no high representative exists here. There is a certain person who has been trying to present himself like that. That is my position, I am stating it here tonight, fully convinced of the fact that President Erdoğan understands it very well, and he has proven to be a man who listens to all of us. Of course, he has got his own positions.
Therefore, in that sense, it is definitely not good for BiH that any non-elected foreigner shows up here, who, moreover, presents and introduces himself as high representative, in order to impose laws onto us here. This is not a civilizational achievement, some old history remembers it, and in that sense, we cannot accept that a non-elected foreigner passes laws here for us. Again, I will re-iterate that it is best for us here in BiH to do that, with a friend such as Erdoğan, President Erdoğan. I am ready for such a dialogue, and I am ready for us to accept good services from President Erdoğan in that sense. And, this is not disputable. Furthermore, I also stated at the meeting that we cannot accept the arrival of someone who is elected by some Peace Implementation Council, which is a self-elected body, which is not a part of the Dayton Agreement, and that such person takes over decision making on our behalf. That is not what I am elected for. The people elected me, and my people elected me to represent them, and it would certainly not be right for me to accept that any foreigner who does not have a mandate of the international factor, first of all of the Security Council, can do anything here, and the previous one, any one of them, to be able to impose laws because he himself remembered that he should do that.
Therefore, I call for an agreement, I call for discussions, and I invite friends to help us in creating these. I invite the people from Sarajevo to show understanding and comprehend the seriousness of this situation, that is what I discussed here. And what is important indeed is that we preserve peace here, and regardless of the development of political relations, problems, crises or solutions, the peace is ultimate here and it must be maintained. It depends only on us in BiH how things will develop in BiH. And do not let the experience of Afghanistan here in BiH, when the foreigners leave this country, turn out to be a warning which we did not take into consideration. Therefore, give me an agreement, I want an agreement. President Erdoğan, I am ready to discuss all possible issues with you, and with others in BiH. And I think that everything should be on the agenda. I am for maintaining the territorial integrity of BiH, whereas the political arrangement must be inside, as we agree on. The Dayton Agreement has almost ceased to exist because it has been destroyed by the interventions of the international community, and it is, in that sense, I think, that we have to reach a new agreement which can stabilize Bosnia in the following few decades. If we fail to do this, still preserve peace, but also, and I also said it here regardless that it was not pleasant for some ears, that any decision to be or solution to be, it has to be a peaceful one, even if it is a dissolution in BiH. I hereby call for a constant dialogue, of course with the assistance provided by our friends.
I hereby thank the President for having patience to listen to our problems, and only friends can do that. And thank you for explicitness, readiness to help in the area of economics, and I am sorry that our economic cooperation and trade are not much better at this moment.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Šefik Džaferović at the opening of the Memorial to the shaheeds and fallen soldiers of Stolac Municipality
content:
Dear soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, respected families of the shaheeds and fallen soldiers, representatives of the Veterans' Associations, respected members of the Organizing Committee for erecting a memorial to the shaheeds and fallen soldiers of Stolac Municipality, representatives of legislative and executive governments at all levels in Bosnia and Herzegovina, eminence, citizens of Stolac, dear attendees!
Allow me to begin by thanking the leadership of the "Unified Union of Veterans, Union of Veterans of Stolac Municipality" for their determination and efforts to preserve the memory of the heroic path of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the achievements of the 1992-1995 liberation war.
The unveiling of the monument to the shaheeds and fallen soldiers of this area is another confirmation of such efforts, which should be to the honor of each of your members, but also of all of us.
Stolac is a special place. The crossroads of cultures. From the medieval Bosnian state, through Ottoman Bosnia and Stolac waqif Ali-pasha Stočević, anti-fascism to the heroic defense during the last aggression against Bosnia and Herzegovina. Defiance and humanity, that is what connects all these epochs and all the people of this region. That is why the invitation to today's event represents a particular honor to me.
Dear soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina!
First, I wish to address you, but also the families of the shaheeds and fallen soldiers who laid down their lives for the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, our homeland.
Today, you are unveiling a memorial to your comrades-in-arms, with the desire that the goals of your struggle remain permanently recorded. We must not forget them. We must not forget their sacrifice and the most turbulent times for Bosnia and Herzegovina.
You have won a battle that was not just a defense of human lives and territory, but a battle for the very being and idea of this country. The battle for democracy and equity. For the possibility for people of different faiths and nations to continue to live together. And that is the most valuable thing for which one should stand up and fight.
You defended and preserved it.
And no one can take that away from you.
Dear citizens of Stolac,
These days, you are also marking 28 years since the expulsion of 8,000 of your fellow citizens from Stolac, of which 3,000 ended up in the "Kostana bolnica" concentration camp. The survivors of the camp and the families of the victims are returning to convey and thus preserve the truth about the crimes committed. During the war, this building of terror was the seat of the HVO Military Police which today is awarded by the President of the Republic of Croatia with the highest order of that country.
What was the fault of your fellow citizens? What was your fault? What was the guilt of every innocent victim killed in the aggression against Bosnia and Herzegovina? That we have remained consistent with the fundamental principles of Bosnia and Herzegovina as a community of diversity, not seeking this country only for ourselves, excluding or defying that right to others.
There lies the essence of all conflicts, from medieval Bosnia to the last aggression against Bosnia and Herzegovina. These facts should be repeated, persistently and devotedly. Let us never again forget why we have been exposed to the violence and injustice by our neighbors for centuries.
Dear friends,
The unique multiethnic culture of Bosnia and Herzegovina is woven in a thousand years of tolerance and respect among citizens, regardless of their ethnicity and religion.
The necropolis of Radimlja's stećak tombstones, here in Stolac, is a pearl of Bosnia and Herzegovina's and world cultural heritage, but also a testimony to a single, unique Bosnia and Herzegovina that no one has ever managed to divide.
The intention of the perpetrators of genocide and joint criminal enterprise was to destroy the multiethnic fabric of our society through mass slaughter, torture, rape, expulsion, and looting.
Their followers still dream of completing the political project of Slobodan Milošević, Radovan Karadžić and Ratko Mladić, Franjo Tuđman, Gojko Šušak and Mate Boban, that brought bloodshed to the entire region.
They, almost on daily basis, threaten with the secession of part of Bosnia and Herzegovina or they abuse the Dayton Constitution with various blockades to force us to agree to a policy of division, a policy of exclusivity and inequality for all citizens. We will not accept that.
The highest officials of Serbia and Croatia come to parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina sending bad and irresponsible messages. Recently, right here, in Stolac, at Radimlja, a high-ranking official commemorated the Bleiburg victims. It is not clear to anyone what kind of relationship Radimlja, the good Bosnians, Stolac and Bleiburg are in. But where does the right of anyone to abuse this place come from? Where does the right of anyone over the monuments of the world cultural heritage, in Bosnia and Herzegovina, to evoke memories of Bleiburg come from? Stop doing that.
It is truly surprising that the leadership and leading institutions of the Republic of Croatia allow themselves something like this. A country that is a member of the European Union should not do that primarily for the sake of its citizens and their future. It is time for the Republic of Croatia to think seriously about this.
The Republic of Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina are turned towards each other. This will remain so. The importance of good relations between the Republic of Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina goes beyond the importance of open issues. But then why does the Republic of Croatia refuse to resolve open issues with Bosnia and Herzegovina? It is not good for a state to illegally exploit the good of its neighbors. It is not good for its top leadership to openly side with one political party in Bosnia and Herzegovina, the one that supports and encourages the secessionism of Dodik's SNSD. The leadership of the Republic of Croatia needs to think seriously about all this. Good relations between our two countries also relax the relations between Bosniaks and Croats in BiH.
I wish to stress this in particular:
Stolac does not exclusively belong to anyone, nor does any place in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Every part of Bosnia and Herzegovina belongs equally to all citizens. Stolac is a city of all Bosnians and Herzegovinians to whom the wellbeing of this country is in their hearts.
Those who think differently, who under the motto of legitimacy seek to maintain and deepen divisions in our society, I tell them from this place: you will not achieve that. Because no one wants such a Bosnia and Herzegovina anymore. Most of our citizens want a modern, democratic, European state in which all citizens will have equal rights. The European Union does not want that anymore. The messages of European officials are clear and unequivocal and reject the policy of divisions and ethnic exclusivity.
Dear friends!
Someone once nicely said: If you wish Bosnia and Herzegovina well, just leave it alone. Bosnians and Herzegovinians will find their own way, just as was the case before. This particularly relates to BiH's neighbors.
Those who wish better relations with Bosnia and Herzegovina will have to face the truth, prevent the sovereignty and territorial integrity of our country from being brought into question, stop insulting victims and survivors of genocide and joint criminal enterprise, and deny court-confirmed historical facts. They have recently been obliged to do so by the Amendments to the Criminal Law of BiH, which prohibit the denial of genocide and other war crimes and the glorification of war criminals, for which, during the mandate to this date, this Presidency Member has persistently called. It has been proven I was right.
You cannot receive and reward The Hague convicts for crimes committed in Bosnia and Herzegovina, come to Bosnia and Herzegovina like it was your province, bypass the official highest institutions in Bosnia and Herzegovina by visiting parts of another entity or only cantons with a majority of one people. That is not how friendship is made with Bosnia and Herzegovina.
This is my message to them: Take a lesson from the words of the great Miroslav Krleža. Krleža devoted some of his most beautiful sentences and thoughts to Bosnia and Herzegovina.
“Lady Europe might pardon us, but only Bosnia has its monuments. The Stećci. What is a Stećak?
That is the personification of a highlander Bosnian! What is a Bosnian doing on the Stećak? Standing erect! His head and arm lifted high! But nowhere, nowhere, nobody has ever found a Stećak with a Bosnian kneeling or begging or one in which he appears as a slave...”
Dear friends,
Nonetheless, Bosnia and Herzegovina's progress can no longer be stopped. Most of our citizens want peace, stability, and prosperity, they want to build a common and secure future for themselves and their children.
Time is on the side of those who love our country, who work for its progress and who want to see it safe and prosperous, as a member of the European Union and NATO. And we will make it happen. There is no longer any doubt about that.
Bosnia and Herzegovina will gradually return to what it has always been - a place where people of different religions, cultures and identities live together in security and prosperity. Yet, with a bitter experience which does not allow oblivion and tragic mistakes leading to a new genocide or joint criminal enterprise. Rest assured.
Thank you.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Šefik Džaferović at the “Freedom Days of the Knightly City of Bužim"
content:
Respected fighters of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, 505th Bužim Knight Brigade, respected relatives of martyrs and fallen fighters, representatives of veterans' associations, respected members of the Organizing Committee of the event "Freedom Days of the Knightly City of Bužim", citizens of Bužim, dear attendees,
At the beginning, let me express my gratitude to the management and members of the Organizing Committee of the event "Freedom Days of the Knightly City of Bužim" for perseverance in organizing this important event, but also for the efforts to preserve the memory of the heroic path of the Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the goals we fought for.
Also, I take this opportunity to congratulate all members of the 505th Knights Brigade on the 29th anniversary of the founding and beginning of the heroic journey.
It is a special honour to be in the knightly city of Bužim today. Here, freedom, honour, pride and homeland are the most important words. White martyr's tombstones are the clearest testimony of your struggle for Bosnia and Herzegovina, freedom and dignity.
Furthermore, I would like to use this opportunity to congratulate the 29th anniversary to all 505th Bužim Knight Brigade members.
Dear friends,
When looking for answers and explanations in the first post-war days about how we managed to defend the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, our president and commander-in-chief, the late Alija Izetbegović, said: the secret was somewhere in the souls or character of the people." The unconquered Krajina and the unwavering strength of the Krajina fighters are the most prominent examples of this miracle.
Our heroic resistance rests on the sacrifice of those who were willing to rise up against evil and injustice at the cost of life and to oppose the far superior force of the aggressor.
Only such determination, the determination of the people who defend the right to survival and the citizens who defend the right to freedom and equality, can bear fruit. Such resistance cannot be broken.
We will never forget the goals we fought for. Those who think we will are mistaken. There is no forgetting! We will remember both good and evil, that time of the most difficult temptation for Bosnia and Herzegovina, the heroism of the best BiH sons in the 1992-1995 defence-liberation war, our martyrs and fallen fighters.
The Presidency of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, led by the late President Alija Izetbegović, and the people organized into units of the Army of the Republic of BiH achieved a historic goal: they defended and preserved the entire sovereign state of Bosnia and Herzegovina. And no one can dispute this historical fact, no matter how hard they try.
That victory was not only military, but also civilizational. We managed to gain democracy. We have defended the idea and being of this country, what we carry as a lasting testament from our ancestors. The ability for people of different faiths and nations to still live together. And that's a lot.
Dear friends,
In a summarized history and description of this area, it should be said that this is the area of brave and defiant people, diligent and noble Krajišniks whose loyalty and devotion this country has never doubted. The latest aggression against the statehood and integrity of Bosnia and Herzegovina is the most recent testimony to the sacrifice that the citizens of Bužim and the entire Krajina were ready to make.
In a complete political, informational and economic blockade, in an extremely difficult and complex military-political situation, thanks to members of the 5th Corps of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, the belief that we will preserve the integrity of this country was defended.
In the most difficult moments of the struggle for the survival of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, the 505th Bužim Knight Brigade gave its best sons. 497 of them. Among them was the late General Izet Nanić, the golden lily and the hero of the defence-liberation war. During the most difficult moments for Krajina and the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, General Nanić believed in its survival and the victory of the unity of all peoples who have this country at heart.
In the words of the late Izet Nanić: "God willing, Bosnia and Herzegovina will be ours", the essence of the efforts of all true patriots is summed up, in whose hearts the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina occupies the main place. Preserving its integrity, independence, and autonomy, preserving our centuries-old hearths, were the goals of our struggle and we achieved those goals.
We will forever remember General Izet Nanić. We will remember our fathers, brothers and sons who laid down their lives for the freedom we have today. With the depth of the tragedy that has befallen us, we can measure our obligation towards future generations, with the goal of preserving peace and prevent evil from happening ever again.
The struggles ahead of us are just as crucial as those behind us. It is our obligation to complete the building of the state for which the best among us gave their lives.
Dear soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
While preparing this speech, I thought: what else can we say to the people who, in the most crucial moments of the defence of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, were on the front lines as the strongest link of resistance?
For the past 29 years, it’s as if we’ve spent big words wanting to show how sincere your fight was, how great that courage was, and how much our victory was deserved in the end.
We must not tire. No forgetting! In each subsequent temptation, we draw our strength from that memory, from the memories of the heroes of Bosnia and Herzegovina. That is why they must be woven into every paragraph, into every detail, into every step forward that we make.
That is why we will repeat and remind and look again for words to say that the best among us were members of the 505th Bužim Knight Brigade. All the nations that have transformed their struggle into a healthy and functional state have built it on the heritage of values won by people like you.
It is up to us and the generations to come to preserve the truth about your just struggle and not allow that truth to be ever endangered by deliberate distortion of historical facts.
Dear friends,
Unfortunately, there are still those who impudently attack the sovereignty and territorial integrity of our country, question its sustainability, threaten divisions, undermine its institutions and international subjectivity, and try to nullify the progress we have painstakingly achieved through joint efforts.
The ideological and political followers of those who are the main organizers of the genocide hinder our progress towards full stability, prosperity and membership in the European Union and NATO.
Special mention should be made of the increasingly frequent and aggressive denial of genocide and glorification of war criminals, followed by shameful awards given by the institutions of the Republika Srpska entity, in front of international and national public.
But the end of that destructive adventure seems to be near. No one wants to open new wounds in Bosnia and Herzegovina anymore. The ideological and political followers of the organizers of the genocide are slowly being left alone.
All major international factors resolutely oppose such destructive policies. Our persistent action and pointing out the perniciousness of such a policy, at home and abroad, has helped to set in motion a new determination that we are witnessing.
During my term as a member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, I have clearly warned and called on international officials to stop such actions and point to its disastrous impact on positive processes in BiH, and the urgency and necessity of passing a law that would permanently stop it.
Amendments to the BiH Criminal Code, which prohibit the denial of genocide and other war crimes and the glorification of war criminals, confirm that the international community has realized this.
I think the time has come for the heirs of the policies of Milošević, Karadžić and Mladić, Boban and the like to understand that those who wanted to see the end of Bosnia and Herzegovina ended up in the dustbin of history. History will not have much to say about Milošević, Karadžić and Mladić, except for what is already recorded in the annals of The Hague tribunal, and Tudjman's political and military adventure received an epilogue and its real name: "joint criminal enterprise". That is how they ended and that is how everyone who dares to touch Bosnia and Herzegovina will end.
You can be assured of that.
Dear friends,
Allow me to highlight the following at the very end: It is our obligation to complete the building of the state for which the best among us have given their lives. The challenges of integration into the European Union and NATO are great, but it is a future that will bring us lasting peace and a better life for our children. Let's forget about ideological divisions, party or personal interests, because the interest of the state is above all those individual interests.
We will only succeed if we create an environment in which young people will remain to live with dignity from their work and start families, because that is the only guarantee of the future. We need to keep this in mind every day and work diligently on that goal.
Thank you.

title: Address delivered by Željko Komšić, Chairman of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovin at Defence of BiH - Igman 2021 event
content:
Esteemed families of the fallen soldiers and shahids, disabled ex-soldiers, veterans of the Army and the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Republic of BiH, defenders of Bosnia and Herzegovina, my fellow combatants,
Another anniversary is marked these days of the heroic resistance of the defenders of the City of Sarajevo and the State of Bosnia and Herzegovina. We are marking it in the area of Igman, which was a strategically important point in the overall defense of the State of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Before I say anything else, let me, again, underline an infinite debt that all of us have to the defenders of Bosnia and Herzegovina who gave their lives for the homeland here in the area of Igman. No speech about the defense of Igman, Sarajevo, or the State of Bosnia and Herzegovina is possible without referring to them.
During the aggression against the State of Bosnia and Herzegovina, over eleven thousand civilians, including 1,601 children, were killed in Sarajevo by the chetnik aggressor. I dare not imagine what would have happened if some key defense points, like Igman, important for both the city and the State, were not defended. Without doubt, it is clear now that another Srebrenica would have happened. Such outcome was prevented thanks only to those who were ready to fight and risk their own lives for the lives of all of us. The aggressors’ terror was not yielded to and that is why we now have a privilege to enjoy our freedom.
No freedom was intended for the citizens of Sarajevo. They were meant to be destroyed. The State itself was meant to be destroyed, too. This is best seen from the intensity of aggressors’ actions during the so-called negotiations. In principle, this city was always hit by the greater number of shells at such times when the representatives of the legitimate authorities of the Republic of BiH were forced to sit at the same table and negotiate with the rebels and criminals. It was by killing the children of this city that they wanted to force us to give up the State.
Therefore, no one has the right today to give up the State. No one is afraid any longer from the threatening statements made by the politicians who award war criminals, glorify war crimes, or reject the law on banning genocide denial. They did not defeat us by their tanks, planes or the plethora of weapons they had at their disposal at the time. Therefore, they should know that their current statements and hollow noise do not frighten anyone any more.
We do not live in 1992 or in 1995 any longer, and we do not live in an illusion that there is a possibility of a repentance for the crimes committed. Therefore, we can send a message to them on this occasion that they can say whatever they want, we are not even interested any more in their opinion about the State. However, they will never again repeat what they did almost three decades ago. This is not my belief only, but the belief of all individuals who perceive Bosnia and Herzegovina as their homeland, and there is a majority of us who do so. The intensity of our love for it is stronger than the intensity of hatred of those who hate it. Those who are not with us today share such love for this State, too. Thank you, again.

title: Address delivered by Šefik Džaferović, Presidency member of Bosnia and Herzegovina at Defense of BiH - Igman 2021 event
content:
Respected soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, esteemed relatives of the shahids and fallen soldiers, representatives of the soldiers’ associations, esteemed management of the Sarajevo Canton’s Memorial Fund, members of the Organizational Board of the “Defense of Bosnia and Herzegovina – Igman 2021” event, Your excellences, dear all who are present here today,
First of all, let me extend my gratitude to the management of the Sarajevo Canton’s Memorial Fund, and to the members of the Organizational Board of “Defense of Bosnia and Herzegovina – Igman 2021” event for organizing today’s academy, as well as for their efforts invested in accomplishing their mission through acting as dedicated followers of the achievements of the defensive and liberating war conducted between 1992 and 1995. I am deeply honored to be a patron of the present event.
Dear friends,
We remember today one of the most important defensive battles for both Sarajevo and our State of Bosnia and Herzegovina: the battle of Igman, one of the greatest military victories won by the heroes of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. That miraculous victory was made by our courageous soldiers and officers, and by our politicians led by the war Presidency of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the commander in chief Alija Izetbegović. The victory was based on the righteous aims and universal civilizational values, refined and strengthened by the Bosnian spirit.
Igman is, perhaps, the truest reflection of our resistance. We were attacked from all sides; the aggressor was convinced that breaking down our resistance was just a matter of time. But, we did not surrender or give up. The soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina provided an unexpected resistance. Contrary to all expectations and military logic, that resistance kept growing constantly after the Igman victory. After that victory, the Army grew into a superior and victorious military force. We defended and preserved our homeland, restored its statehood, won peace, albeit unfair, but without which there could not have been any reconstruction or revival.
Let me underline this in particular: that struggle was honorable. In the conflict which was imposed on us we had the strength not only to defend ourselves but also to restrain hatred. The fundamental difference between you and the aggressors lies in restraining hatred. They wanted single-nationalism and single-mindedness. You fought for democracy and multiethnicism, for a possibility that people of different faiths and nations continue to live together. You defended the idea of Bosnia and Herzegovina. That makes up your identity card, the ID card of each single one of you. You can and should be proud of it.
Dear soldiers of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
Now, twenty-eight years later, we live in the time of challenging political and economic reforms that we must implement on our path to the European Union and NATO. It may seem sometimes that in the arduous daily political situations, within the difficult political efforts we invest, under the heavy burden of obligations and pressure we are exposed to, we forget how expensive each particle of Bosnia and Herzegovina which you defended is.
But, let me assure you that we will not get tired, we will not agree to live in oblivion. We will not do that because of each Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina’s soldier whom we lost. We will not do that because of each fallen innocent victim. We do not have the right to live in oblivion or to lenience that may lead to relativization of the truth about our struggle.
We will not and we cannot forget our fathers, brothers or sons who gave their lives for freedom which we enjoy today, for the homeland that we keep improving and in which there should never again be room for uncertainty or repetition of suffering that we went through in the past.
It is upon us and the future generations to preserve the truth on your righteous struggle and not to allow the truth to ever be jeopardized by deliberate twisting of the historical facts.
Dear friends,
Unfortunately, there are still those who attack sovereignty and territorial integrity of our country, while disputing its sustainability, threatening by divisions, undermining its institutions and international subjectivity, trying to undo the progress which we have achieved together by our joint arduous efforts.
The ideological and political followers of those who were the main organizers of genocide have obstructed our progress towards full stability, prosperity and membership in the European Union and NATO.
We should particularly highlight ever more frequent and aggressive instances of genocide denial and glorification of war criminals, and the shameful awarding of the war criminals by the legitimate state institutions of the Republika Srpska entity, before the very eyes of both domestic and international publics.
They still dream about completion of the political project of Slobodan Milošević, Radovan Karadžić and Ratko Mladić, which turned out to be catastrophic for Bosnia and Herzegovina and the whole region alike. We must oppose such dangerous and irresponsible recklessness by strengthening our collective determination to stop opening new wounds in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Such attitude was also established by the Peace Implementation Council members in Bosnia and Herzegovina - they realized that their silence and appeasement in the face of such aggressive actions was sending a dangerous message: that it was acceptable, and that there were no subsequent sanctions. In my few previous addresses, I clearly warmed about a detrimental impact of such attitudes to the positive processes in BiH, as well as about both urgency and necessity of passing a law which would put a permanent end to such unacceptable attitudes. The changes of the Criminal Law of BiH, by which denial of genocide and other war crimes and glorification of war criminals are banned now, confirm that we were right. Therefore, I am even more convinced that the forces of destruction will be defeated and that in the times ahead of us the forces that love this country and work for its progress will keep growing.
The progress of Bosnia and Herzegovina is unstoppable now, which has gradually become obvious to all.
Thank you.

title: Address by the Member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina Šefik Džaferović at the presentation of the project "Museum of Genocide", 10th of July, 2021
content:
Dear mothers of Srebrenica, Dear friends, It is a great honour to be with you here today, on the occasion of the completion of one and the beginning of another important project for the Memorial Centre in Potočari. The completion of the works on the renovation of the roof in the Battery Factory and the presentation of the project "Museum of Genocide" are extremely important events for the memorial culture.
Tomorrow we will mark another sad anniversary at this same place. It’s been 26 years and the wounds are still open. When it comes to genocide, time does not pass in the same way as with other things. Sometimes one gets the impression that time does not even pass, because the pain remains the same, the memories do not fade.
And yet, time passes relentlessly. There are fewer and fewer living witnesses of the genocide every year. The memory does not fade, but in the end, it disappears with the death of the people who carried it deep within themselves. That is why it is of great importance to preserve that memory, using forms of memorial culture, so that the new generations, who were born after the war, would know what happened and learn important lessons for the future.
The key role in preserving the memory of genocide and turning it into remembrance is played by the institutions that focus on this matter. I am referring to the Srebrenica-Potočari Memorial Center first and foremost. There are many museums, institutions, memorial rooms and landmarks throughout Bosnia and Herzegovina and the world. There is an increasing number each year. However, the Memorial Center is the key institution when it comes to memorial culture and remembrance. First of all, because this is where the bloody butchery began in July 1995; because there is a cemetery for genocide victims at this place, and because this is an institution of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
In recent period, the memorial centre was, as is currently, the institution of irreplaceable significance in preserving and protecting the truth about genocide. It will have an even greater significance and responsibility in the future when there will no longer be funerals here in Potočari. Funerals and burials of genocide victims are a key event of each anniversary. One day, when there will be no more funerals, all attention will be focused on the contents that the Memorial Centre will be able to offer.
That is why it is essential that this institution receives full financial and any other support. The mission and responsibility of the Memorial Centre bears a heavy weight that is impossible to be fulfilled without adequate support.
The state of Bosnia and Herzegovina stands and will always stand behind the Memorial Centre. This institution operates on the basis of funds provided by the state and this is extremely important. At the same time, Bosnia and Herzegovina is not in a position to support the work of the Memorial Centre even more, due to the burden of the Dayton structure, which is best illustrated by the fact that the Council of Ministers did not declare 11th of July a Day of Mourning in Bosnia and Herzegovina because the ministers from the entity of Republika Srpska were against it.
Although our hands are tied, our obligation is to continue to fight and find ways, how, despite all the obstructions, the Memorial Centre can continue to work and develop. As a member of the collective head of state, in the past I have insisted that support from lower levels be much greater, and I am glad to see that a significant step forward has been made in this field.
Another source of financial support, in this situation, are our friends from around the world. The Republic of Turkey is among the most generous donors of the Memorial Centre, which today’s event also confirms. Therefore, in the presence of the Deputy Minister of Culture of the Republic of Turkey, I would like to thank for everything that the government of the Republic of Turkey, led by President Erdogan, are doing when it comes to protecting the truth about the genocide in Srebrenica. Please convey my gratitude to the President of the Republic of Turkey and the Turkish people.
The leaking roof has been a symbol of the neglect of the Memorial Centre for years. The previous management and employees did their best, but a thorough action was needed to make a breakthrough. I have no doubt that through the appointment of the new management, led by Director Emir Suljagić and the Chairman of the Management Board Ševket Hafizović, the necessary momentum and synergy have been achieved, thanks to which steady steps forward have already been made. I can say that the Memorial Centre will always have my support, and that I will protect the interests and strengthen the position of this institution wherever I go, as much as I can as a member of the Presidency.
Thank you.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Šefik Džaferović at the official ceremony of opening the “Alija Izetbegović” square in Bužim
content:
Dear mother of the hero of the defensive-liberation war, the late Izet Nanić,
Dear families of our martyrs, families of the fallen soldiers, war veteran invalids, demobilized veterans, esteemed officials from all levels of government in Bosnia and Herzegovina, my dear citizens of Bužim,
It is a great honour for me to be here today in this heroic city, the heroic Bužim, that showed everyone in Bosnia and Herzegovina and in the world what the homeland means and how the homeland of Bosnia and Herzegovina is defended. We are all grateful to you for that and we will remain forever grateful.
Thank you for naming this beautiful place, the square, after the late President Alija Izetbegović.
The late President Alija Izetbegović is the most significant figure in the modern history of Bosnia and Herzegovina. It will forever remain inscribed that he was at the head of Bosnia and Herzegovina and led Bosnia and Herzegovina during the hardest time of her history. Under his leadership, our Bosnia and Herzegovina broke away from the jaws of great state policies and became an independent state, a subject of international law. This was a historical endeavor that rarely happens in history.
Alija Izetbegović led Bosnia and Herzegovina and was at the head of the forces that ensured the independence of this country. After the aggression on Bosnia and Herzegovina, Alija Izetbegović led all patriotic forces in the defense of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Bosnia and Herzegovina was defended. That is why Alija Izetbegović is the most important person in the modern history of Bosnia and Herzegovina. President Alija Izetbegović was a statesman in a true sense of the word. He was a thinker, a humanist and a democrat. We will always remember our late President Alija Izetbegović. And this is one of the ways in which we remember him.
Thank you, dear people of Bužim, for recognizing this and for naming this square after the late President Alija Izetbegović.
Dear friends, we are here today to mark the completion of the construction of one, not large but for this area very big and very important project.
I wish to have as many as possible such and similar projects, especially those related to development, education, health, economy, in Bužim as well as in the entire Una-Sana Canton and in the whole of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Šefik Džaferović at the ceremony marking the 44th anniversary of the University “Džemal Bijedić” in Mostar
content:
Dear Rector of the “Džemal Bijedić” University, Dear Chairman of the Rector’s Conference in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Deans and leaders of university studies, Dear Mufti Dedović, Representatives of legislative and executive government, Dear students, Your excellences, ladies and gentlemen,
It is an honour and a pleasure to be here with you today.
At the very beginning, I would like to express my gratitude to the management of the University "Džemal Bijedić" to date, who managed to preserve and affirm this institution and its role and importance in the society of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Only true commitment to the values and ideals of science and education, but also commitment to the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, could carry out these 44 years of dedicated work. And I congratulate you on that.
I commend Rector Zlomušica and his closest associates for the organization of today's ceremony. I extend my most sincere congratulations to the winners of the "Džemal Bijedić" University award. I extend my deepest expressions of respect to the citizens who lost their loved ones during this plague of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Dear ladies and gentlemen,
one of the most important tasks in the time ahead in Bosnia and Herzegovina is to ensure access to quality education. Lagging behind developed countries is directly related to falling behind in the field of education, especially in the field of science and modern innovation. Education, science and culture are the pillars of every advanced community. Lack of quality education leads to prejudice and encourages xenophobia and hatred. Our approach to addressing these challenges therefore needs to be comprehensive and coordinated.
In more than four decades, despite numerous challenges especially in the war and post-war period, the “Džemal Bijedić“ University has managed to preserve and affirm its role in the Bosnian-Herzegovinian scientific and educational community, which was particularly hard hit during the last aggression on Bosnia and Herzegovina.
It is noteworthy to mention that the University "Džemal Bijedić" in Mostar did not operate only in the service of education, but it also to a large extent educated young people in the spirit of our tradition which requires us to respect our history, origin and diversity of our cultural space.
It is of particular importance that future generations continue to develop in that spirit, and in the spirit of the scientists and educators who have attended this important institution.
Dear ladies and gentlemen,
Sustainable and systematic investment in quality education is one of the best ways to create and improve opportunities for young people who have huge potential for any society. If well educated, they are usually the main generator of stability and prosperity. We should do everything in our power to make quality education available to everyone in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Unfortunately, today in Bosnia and Herzegovina there are examples where young people are fighting for their basic human rights, mostly in the Republika Srpska entity. In schools, classes in the Bosnian language have been abolished and this practice continues and is met with silence by a significant part of the national and international public.
The ideologies that led to bloodshed in the former Yugoslavia at the end of the last century have not been completely defeated.
We need to be aware of that. The battle between those who seek to preserve the pluralistic character and tolerant spirit of the Bosnian-Herzegovinian society and those who provoke, incite and deepen cultural, ethnic and religious divisions is not over.
We must not allow the idea of cultural pluralism to be more seriously jeopardized. We must continue to fight for equality until every person in Bosnia and Herzegovina is guaranteed equal rights.
Throughout its history, the citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina have paid a high price by protecting their pluralistic society and identity. But regardless of that price, we have never given up on those fundamental principles. And we shall not.
Many of you remember the sad moment on November 9, 1993, when the Old Bridge in Mostar was demolished. But I’m sure you also remember July 23, 2004, when we jointly marked the opening of the restored Old Bridge. That event stands as a valuable testimony to the resilience of the spirit of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the determination of our people to rebuild and reconnect.
Dear ladies and gentlemen!
The goal of education is acquisition of knowledge. Diplomas that students receive at the end of a certain cycle of education certify the acquired knowledge.
I wish the staff and students of the University "Džemal Bijedić" to continue in the same spirit as before and to achieve even better results. I firmly believe that the future of this institution is bright and secure.
Thank you!

title: The address by BiH Presidency Member Željko Komšić on the 15th anniversary of the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
Dear excellences, soldiers, NCOs, officers, generals, dear guests! It is my honour to, on behalf of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina as the supreme commander of the Armed Forces, and in my own name, I can address you on the 15th anniversary of the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
With the adoption of the Law on Defence of Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as the Law on Service in the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina 15 years ago, the process of establishing professional armed forces began.
These regulations enabled the formation of armed forces inclusive of everyone, regardless of their ethnicity or religion, conditioned only by their professional ability to withstand the challenges required by being part of the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Our soldiers have shown their ability for the greatest challenges within the UN and NATO peace missions, where they have participated in very complex and demanding tasks, resulting in receiving high commendations in these supranational organizations
We should be especially proud to point out the adoption of the Reform Program of Bosnia and Herzegovina, as a continuation of activities from 2009, when our country officially requested inclusion in the NATO MAP programme, i.e. the NATO Membership Action Plan.
A year later in Tallinn, NATO approved Bosnia and Herzegovina's participation in the MAP, albeit on condition that Bosnia and Herzegovina registers the military property as state property. Despite this, the North Atlantic Council, as the NATO decision-making body approved full participation of Bosnia and Herzegovina in MAP on 5th December 2018, inviting our country to submit its first Annual National Programme.
We did this by submitting a Reform Programme, which contains all five chapters, with the structure and elements, as NATO requires of all MAP participants. On that occasion, we managed to "unlock" the activities on the reform of the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina, which are related to modernization and staffing according to NATO standards, so that our Armed Forces would be improved with better organization and equipment.
On this occasion, I would like to congratulate the Armed Forces of BiH and the Ministry of Defence of BiH on fulfilling over 70% of the activities from the Reform Program of Bosnia and Herzegovina, in the difficult circumstances caused by the coronavirus pandemic.
Fulfillment of these activities enables our country to submit the next Reform Program, which we will submit to the NATO headquarters in the coming period.
This two-way communication process is very important for Bosnia and Herzegovina, because apart from the military part, fulfilling the NATO criteria means establishing the rule of law, protection of human rights of all citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina at the individual level, judicial reform, increased transparency and the fight against organized crime and corruption.
All these processes are complementary to the reforms required to receive a candidate status in the European Union, followed by opening negotiation chapters within the new methodology for accepting new members into the European Union.
These parallel processes have a number of common elements. Therefore, when we see that there are state institutions that can fulfil 70% of the planned tasks in one year, it gives me the right to believe that we can continue to meet other criteria relatively quickly and gain legitimacy for membership in the European Union and NATO. Such a thing would be crucial for Bosnia and Herzegovina
The recent bilateral military exercise at Glamoč, held in cooperation with the military forces of the friendly forces of the United States of America, also contributed to the successful participation in multilateral military exercises.
The activities of the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina are a good indicator that we know how to work, that we have professional staff who know how to do their job, so allow me to express my sincere congratulations.
Despite a number of difficulties, primarily in financial terms, the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina have made continuous progress. They prove to be a guarantor of state stability and protection of the territorial integrity of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
I firmly believe that you will continue to perform your tasks successfully both in the country and abroad to the pride and joy of all citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina
I wish all members of the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina a happy Day of the Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Željko Komšić at Bobovac at the marking of 25 November, the Statehood Day of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
Dear citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Today we mark the seventy-seventh anniversary of the restoration of the statehood of Bosnia and Herzegovina, that is, the anniversary of the First Session of the Anti-Fascist People's Liberation Council of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
I said in press statements yesterday, and I will repeat it here today. The work of restoring the statehood of Bosnia and Herzegovina was in fact the work of an exceptional generation of people. People who, overcoming ideological, political and ethnic differences, had enough wisdom, which we often lack today, to find what is in their common interest. And that common interest is the state.
We could be talking here for hours about the contribution by people like Rodoljub Čolaković, Vojislav Kecmanović, Avdo Humo, Sulejman Filipović and many others. We would still not be able to say everything about them and many other heroes and anti-fascists. Let history speak of them and let books be written about them, as the French do when they write about the leaders of the French Revolution.
Today, we visited several memorials, those from the period of remembrance of the national liberation struggle, and memorials related to the period of the last aggression against Bosnia and Herzegovina. The names of heroes and innocent victims who gave their lives for Bosnia and Herzegovina are woven on all these monuments.
I often stay looking at the names of the victims written on Vraca Memorial and on the Sarajevo Memorial for Children Killed during Seige. And I wonder, what were these children guilty of to the criminals. No answer. Apart from the realization that they were killed by the same ideology, the ideology of fascism, hatred and evil.
Despite all this, despite these painful facts, Bosnia and Herzegovina was not killed, nor was the idea of Bosnia and Herzegovina killed. Bosnia and Herzegovina lives through the younger generations, who love their homeland and want to make their homeland a prosperous and secure state.
Today we are here in the royal city of Bobovac, one of the symbols of the progressive state of Bosnia.
This place is a tangible testimony to the strength of our state and its ability to be its own and no one else's.
The then state of Bosnia, although torn between East and West, found its place under the sky, because, thanks to its then leadership, it was a stable country that firmly guarded its borders from external enemies. Here, on Bobovac, the Bosnian royal crown was kept. Today there are no crowns, but there is still the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina. And we must preserve it as the crown of the efforts of the generations that fought for it, from Kulin Ban to the present day.
The flag with Bosnian lillies would have never waved in front of the United Nations on May 22, 1992, had Stjepan II Kotromanić not built this medieval city, and had it not been for Ban Kulin and other medieval rulers before him.
The lilies flag would not have waved in 1992 had the anti-fascists of Bosnia and Herzegovina not restored the statehood of Bosnia and Herzegovina on November 25, 1943 in Mrkonjić Grad. Nor would it have happened without Bosnians and Herzegovinians who were willing to defend their homeland, as the crown of their great-grandfathers' efforts, at all costs.
We can and must be proud of all those who are deserving of the fact that we can stand here today. If we learn from their experiences and efforts, and I think we have learned, then we will surely know what we are to do in the future.
Our state was not given to us, it had been fought for with great difficulty. Therefore, we will not allow anyone's advocacy of backward concepts to to take us back to the battles we have won. The future belongs to those who want to look ahead. I believe that now there is a basis for the progress of the state, and that we will return to the past only as a commemoration.
I once again wish all the citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina a happy Statehood Day.

title: Address by Chairman of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina Šefik Džaferović at the official event marking the 28th anniversary of the First Corps of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzego
content:
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Dear friends,
It is my honour and pleasure to attend the anniversary of the establishment of the First Corps of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The First Corps is one of the most important corps of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. In the broader, strategic picture of Bosnia and Herzegovina's defense against aggression, the First Corps played an irreplaceable role, performing its task of defending Sarajevo as the capital of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Had the aggressor succeeded in their intent, at the start of the aggression and especially on 2nd May 1992, it is quite probable that the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina would have been very difficult to defend.
Every unit of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina in every part of the country had an invaluable role, because every fighter who was willing to risk his life in defence of the homeland deserves the deepest respect. However, we should not forget that the aggressor had a special focus on Sarajevo, bearing in mind its strategic importance, and the units that defended Sarajevo were a thorn in aggressor’s side.
Despite being immeasurably less armed than the aggressor forces, firstly formed units of the Patriotic League, the Territorial Defence, the Green Berets, and later united in the First Corps, had a much better and stronger motivation. Unlike the aggressors, the First Corps was a real people's army, made up of people who defended their country and their city, their homes and families, their freedom.
Frustrated by the fact that there was no force with which to occupy Sarajevo, the aggressor showed the criminal nature by exposing the civilian population of this city to a campaign of terrorism, sniper attacks and killing, which has remained a planetary symbol of modern barbarism.
There lies the key difference. The difference between civilization and barbarism was witnessed by the whole world.
While the aggressor forces carried out a joint criminal enterprise and carried out a campaign of terrorizing more than 350,000 citizens of Sarajevo, the First Corps of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina protected all citizens of Sarajevo – Bosniaks, Croats, Serbs, Jews and all other citizens who faced relentless attacks.
While the aggressor tried to destroy everything that was Bosnian and Bosniak, the First Corps guarded the multi-ethnic fabric of Bosnia and Herzegovina and Sarajevo, maintaining it through its own composition.
While the aggressor barbarically set fire to the City Hall (Vijećnica), the Oriental Institute, the Post Office, the Olympic Museum, shelled the Presidency, the Bey's Mosque, the Church of St. Vinko Paulski and many other buildings, the First Corps guarded and protected the Orthodox Cathedral, the Old Orthodox Church, the Church of the Holy Transfiguration and other Orthodox places of worship.
While the military and political leaders of the aggressor forces - as determined by the judgments of international courts - ordered their army to commit mass crimes against civilians, the political and military leadership of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina systematically fought against individuals in their own ranks who had committed any crime.
The honourable First Corps, together with the state and military leadership of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, opposed the renegade commanders, who had begun to commit crimes against civilians.
Faced with the heaviest siege in modern history, the First Corps had to find additional strength to fight on the inner front as well, but in the end it managed to defend the honour of this state and this city.
Not only was it not recorded that the aggressor armies dealt criminals within their ranks, but, as it was determined in The Hague, their highest commanders, following a criminal policy, systematically ordered crimes and rewarded the cruelest perpetrators which their followers continue to do to this day.
We shall never forget shaheeds and fallen soldiers of the First Corps who laid their lives for the defence of Sarajevo, from Igman, across Žuč, to Trebević. We shall never forget the honourable names of Safet Zajko, Enver Šehović, Emir Bogunić Charlie, Čedomir Domuz, Vinko Šamarlić and other greatest sons of this country and this city.
We shall never forget war veteran invalids, and all soldiers of the First Corps, its commanders, brigades, battalions and commanders of other units.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
The war is over, but the fight for the truth is still going on. The siege is over, but the political siege of Sarajevo is still in full swing.
Every day we hear expressions such as "political Sarajevo" and accusations against this city. Every day we witness attempts to distort the truth about the siege and aggression. These are the same lies that come from the same barbaric and cynical kitchen from which, after the biggest massacres in Markale or Vase Miskina Street, cynically mocking the passivity of the international community, they claimed that the citizens of Sarajevo were shelling themselves. Every city which has ever faced such evil, with such monstrosity, must remember forever.
These days, we have also heard messages that the Serbs lost Sarajevo and that there were apparently certain "pure Serb municipalities".
No Sarajevo municipality, nor the city of Sarajevo as a whole, has ever been purely Serb, just as it was neither purely Croat nor purely Bosniak.
