As something which is not inherent to us, although these are actually the very people we use to boast to the world about our multiculturalism, co-habitation and common history.And to bring the matter to extreme consequences, these are people who declare themselves as Bosnians and Herzegovinians in the first place, in the state of the same name, and who are for this reason treated as "others." Do we thus have the right to criticise European nations for their resistance to other and different and for double standards towards “original Europeans” and “immigrants”?
The European bureaucracy created a geopolitical, marketing phrase “Western Balkans” for our region. Every man who learnt geography in these regions can ask a question: Isn’t therefore Greece Southern Balkans, and Rumania and Bulgaria Eastern Balkans? The Balkan is synonymous to conflicts, ethnic intolerances, backwardness and lack of perspective – an eternal powder keg. And that image is the result of our common history and different notion of multiculturalism, as co-habitation of ones with the others, or ones alongside the others.
My colleague by duty and yours by profession, Georgi Ivanov stated a counter thesis on this topic, that such an image of the Balkans, equally as the creation of the “Western Balkans”, is artificial. In fact, the Balkans has had long periods of peace “pax Romana” and “pax Otomana”, and intolerances and inter-ethnic conflicts came to surface in times of great geopolitical movements and births of “nations” in these regions. What is even a greater absurd; the nations are a product of civil revolutions which brought about the first concepts of human rights, freedoms, equality and brotherhood. Peoples in these regions have accumulated experience of co-habitation precisely in the centuries-long times of peace. It is perhaps for this reason that the European Union is perceived as a kind of “pax Europeana” merely wishing a better life and prospect of peace for their children.
Europe and the European Union are not the same although it may be striving for this. Our history is part of European history. And European history is no less bloody from the history of the Balkans. Thus the European Union was established as a project which should prevent wars amongst European nations and to turn them towards co-operation, economic, technologic and cultural development. What the European Union must not forget, is it wishes to maintain that project, are the core values upon which lies.
If we could find one thing that could be a message for Europe in the evil which was taking place in our region during the nineties, that would be the case of what happens when citizens are institutionally discriminated against on ethnic and religious basis and when all core values on which a civilised society rests are forgotten, and multiculturalism becomes a phrase we boast with.
Bosnia and Herzegovina needs to appreciate its belonging to the middle-ages Christian circle as well as the half-millennium long influence of the Ottoman Empire. Equally as almost half a century old Austro-Hungarian rule or half a century old socialist organisation which created foundations of the modern Bosnian-Herzegovinian society.
What makes Bosnia and Herzegovina today, with all its positive and negative sides, is the result of our common history and multiculturalism in the Balkans. People in Bosnia and Herzegovina have always been one society regardless of religious, ethnic or national origin. Sometimes they lived ones next to the others, and sometimes more ones with the others. But as part of one history, I dare say and also part of one special culture created by intertwining and permeation of diversity which became part of identity of citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina, regardless of some politicians trying to deny or annul this with their statements.
Thanks to that special multicultural identity of Bosniaks, Serbs and Croats, and all those Bosnians and Herzegovinians who are declaring in a different way, this country survives. That is why we must ask ourselves what we are doing, when we are denying equality to our citizens who are called by the name of the very country they live in. Bosnia and Herzegovina cannot therefore be a national state of the ones nor the others, but a secular and civic state which accommodates all and where everyone has equal rights and same opportunities. Anything else would represent civil regression.
Therefore, respected participants, I wish you success in the work during this scientific gathering and I thank you for your attention.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Chairman Željko Komšić at General Debate of the Sixty
content:
My country's strategic goal of establishing a formal relationship and membership in the EU is based upon ambition of Bosnia and Herzegovina to become part of the big family of democratic states and thus assure full functionality of its own institutions and further development on the basis of free market, rule of law and especially human rights.
Mr. President
Mr. Secretary General
Excellencies
Ladies and Gentlemen
First of all I would like to congratulate you, Mr. President, as well as members of your Team of 68th Session of General Assembly for being elected, and give you my full support in your future work.
Plenary meetings of the General Assembly have always been an opportunity for Heads of State to gather and exchange their opinions about the world situation in order to try to find solutions for contemporary global problems.
Mr. President,
My country's strategic goal of establishing a formal relationship and membership in the EU is based upon ambition of Bosnia and Herzegovina to become part of the big family of democratic states and thus assure full functionality of its own institutions and further development on the basis of free market, rule of law and especially human rights.
Based on the direction and foreign policy activities of Bosnia and Herzegovina our focus remains on furthering our institutional relationship with the EU, in accordance with the Stabilization and Association Agreement and its full implementation.
The aspiration of Bosnia and Herzegovina to become EU member is based upon wide political census.
The fact that the process of European integration demands comprehensive political, institutional and legal adjustments in order to reach European standards in all areas is of essential importance for my country.
We are also fully aware that active participation of all segments of society of Bosnia and
Herzegovina is necessary for the expedited process of European integration.
I expect that expediting the remaining activities, implementation of the Sejdic - Finci ruling of the European Court of Human Rights, will lead to fulfilment of requirements for application for accession of Bosnia and Herzegovina to the EU.
I am also hoping for positive development of events relating to fulfilling conditions for activating the NATO Membership Action Plan and further integration of Bosnia and Herzegovina into NATO security structures.
I would also like to emphasize that Bosnia and Herzegovina is in the final negotiation phase for accession to the World Trade Organization.
Please allow me to emphasize again that Bosnia and Herzegovina has a very clear stance relating to war crimes: All those accused of war crimes will be held responsible for the crimes of which they are accused of either before international or domestic courts.
Mr. President,
Bosnia and Herzegovina puts strong emphasis on regional and sub regional cooperation and dialogue between neighbouring countries whose cultures and traditions have been present in the Balkans for centuries, and which are currently at different stages of transition and democratic reforms.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is turned towards the future and cooperation with neighbouring countries on the basis of mutual respect as well as the respect of sovereignty and territorial integrity.
The development of bilateral relations with all of our neighbouring countries and other countries in the region is focused on several key areas: advancing economic cooperation, the strengthening of regional cooperation and finding constructive solutions for current issues.
Our emphasis in regional cooperation is on the development of communication infrastructure as a basis for better economic, cultural, and scientific ties as well as overall regional development. The potential for regional economic ties are especially strong in the areas of industry, tourism, agriculture and energy.
I would especially like to emphasize our bilateral relations with the Republic of Croatia, which gained new dimension and dynamic with the Croatian accession to the EU and which was marked by eagerness on both sides to find solutions that are in best interests of both our countries.
Mr. President,
I have to state at this time, we continue to live through one of the greatest economic and financial crisis in contemporary history, which is certainly the greatest threat to global peace and security. We must do everything in our power to tackle its negative effects and consequences. Although the latest indicators show that some developed countries are coming out of recession, this is not the case with poor and developing countries, where the consequences of the crisis are very harsh.
Institutions of Bosnia and Herzegovina have been strategically working towards achieving the Millennium Development Goals; thus we deem that despite the difficulties caused by the world economic movements, there will be no obstacles to reach our set targets by 2015. Bosnia and Herzegovina has finalized the "Development Strategy for BiH" and "Social Inclusion Strategy for Bosnia and Herzegovina" while the “Strategy for Poverty Eradication“ has already been designed and implemented. All of these have been done in cooperation with the relevant UN agencies in BiH, and to whom we would like to thank for their intensive cooperation.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is ready to contribute to global efforts in defining development framework followed by its implementation in order to readily face economic, social and environmental challenges. Considering that the importance of the above mentioned three aspects of sustainable development are crossing national borders, Bosnia and Herzegovina believes that regional cooperation is crucial for successful preparation for new post - 2015 development framework.
Bosnia and Herzegovina as, well as all the other Western Balkan countries at this integration phase, follow EU policy and views relating to the new development agenda. Bosnia and Herzegovina consistently supports the position that sustainable development is only possible in harmony with nature.
I am of the opinion that neither economic nor political interests must stand in the way of global consensus as the true beginning of the global fight for preservation of the natural balance of the planet. It is often forgotten that climate change has direct impact on development, poverty, hunger, and consequently on global peace and security. Short term solutions will have long term consequences, and the steps we take today will be our legacy for generations to come.
Mr. President,
All of us present here agree that the United Nations needs continuous and comprehensive reform, which should be done with great caution, assuring a wide consensus of member states. United Nations reform should provide efficient and coordinated functioning of all segments and bodies of the system. It is widespread opinion that reform of the Security Council is crucial for core reform of the world organization. This reform, done with the widest possible consensus of the member states, is necessary for reasons of efficiency and credibility, and that is only possible taking into account contemporary geostrategic reality, which differs from the one of 1945. Because only the Security Council reformed in such a manner can have full authority and respectability in addressing the most important issues of international peace and security, mandate entrusted to the Council by the United Nations Charter.
Dialogue and compromise are the best way to ensure the widest possible support to the reform, and Bosnia and Herzegovina supports the opinion that the Security Council reform should be moved from a standstill as soon as possible. We also believe that the reformed Security Council of the United Nations should have another space for a non-permanent member state from the Eastern European group as the number of countries from this group has more than doubled in last two decades.
I would also like to emphasize from this position that more engagement in preventative diplomacy is expected from the Security Council. We believe that more activity in such diplomacy would help solve many problems and crises before they intensify, which would be more efficient way for the Council to work. Encouraging dialogue to resolve critical issues by compromise, while acting against any kind of exclusiveness, especially in the sphere of human rights, is of utmost importance. Timely and efficient conflict prevention, instead of reaction to already escalated crises, is definitely a more efficient and less costly approach to international peace and security.
We are eager to share with others, both the good and the bad of our post conflict and peace building experiences. Bosnia and Herzegovina believes that every crisis has to be studied carefully with great consideration for the roots of the conflict, culture, religion, local customs and all other factors in order to find a just and long term solution. There are no universal solutions for every crisis, and every single one should be paid attention to and considered separately.
Mr. President,
Bosnia and Herzegovina believes that it is necessary to take tangible steps to prevent nuclear proliferation in the world.
Despite evident obstacles during the last decade, new initiatives give new momentum to the process of disarmament and anti-proliferation. Bosnia and Herzegovina believes that nuclear disarmament can be achieved by encouraging member states that joined the Treaty to respect their obligations specified in the Non Proliferation Treaty. Bosnia and Herzegovina will sign the Arms Trade Treaty during the Arms Treaty Event.
Mr. President,
Bosnia and Herzegovina is gravely concerned about the continuous violence in Syria that has led to worsening of the humanitarian crisis and caused unacceptable suffering of the Syrian people, and is asking all parties to fulfil all of their obligations in accordance with international law and human rights.
Resolving the crisis in the Middle East continues to be one of the most important priorities of the World Organization. We believe that all possible steps should be made towards creating a positive climate in order to achieve just and comprehensive peace in this area. We expect all sides to refrain from any rushed actions and focus on beginning this very important dialogue.
Bosnia and Herzegovina, in order to play a constructive role in international relations and contribute to self-sustainable peace and security, participates in the ISAF mission in Afghanistan. Bosnia and Herzegovina supports international efforts and actively participated in the UN Missions in Liberia, South Sudan and Cyprus.
Furthermore, I would like to emphasize that Bosnia and Herzegovina continues to be very concerned that terrorist attacks around the world take the lives of innocent victims, and Bosnia and Herzegovina is committed to fight terrorism and believes that results in this area could be achieved only through comprehensive cooperation and partnership of as many UN member states as possible.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is also following the situation on African continent with great interest. We expect that, in spite of the difficult world financial and economic crisis, most developed countries will continue to increase their contribution to the official development aid necessary for capacity strengthening in poor African countries. That is why we praise UN activities in the New Partnership for Africa's Development and efforts to set Africa on the path of stable and sustainable development, especially in regards to reaching the Millennium Development Goals. This particularly applies to the countries of sub- Saharan Africa. We also support all efforts of the African Union, African governments, and the UN directed at improvement of the rule of law, democracy and strengthening of civil society and institutions in order to raise the bar for all aspects of society. We are pointing out that continued financial aid to Africa, in a greater capacity, is just as important as strengthening the efficiency and transparency of using the aid funds for sustainable development.
Mr. President,
In today's world with political and social processes more dynamic than ever, when we are facing challenges so different from those of just few decades ago, it is becoming clear that only a strong multilateral approach can give good solutions. The United Nations Organization, in more than six decades of existence, has gone through difficult temptations, but was always, and continues to be, the only guide to a better future; it is still the only organization capable of providing solutions to a wide spectrum of global problems we are facing. It is up to us to make the World Organization stronger and more efficient, as it is the only most comprehensive and inclusive organization in existence today which can help bring progress and wellbeing to our planet. If we work together on implementation of all of our agreements reached at this respected place, there is no doubt that we will live in a better and more just conditions then is the case today. On that path we need to return to the basic values and principles of human rights, equality and world peace which are laid in the foundations of the United Nations.
Thank you Mr. President.

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović in Bužim at the official academy over the Day of the 505th Knights Brigade
content:
I am always glad to come to Krajina, particularly to knightly Bužim. It is here that the freedom, honour, pride and homeland are the most important words. During the time of frightening military superiority of the aggressor, Bosnia and Herzegovina was being defended with heart and blood of heroes.
My dear Krajina people,
Dear shaheeds’ and fallen solders’ family members,
Respected defenders of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
Respected friends, esteemed guests!
I am always glad to come to Krajina, particularly to knightly Bužim. It is here that the freedom, honour, pride and homeland are the most important words. During the time of frightening military superiority of the aggressor, Bosnia and Herzegovina was being defended with heart and blood of heroes. The white shaheed tombstones are the clearest testimony of our fight for Bosnia, freedom and dignity. Bužim, Krajina and Bosnia in August mark the most important dates of its newer history. In them, glory and pride, sorrow and memories intertwine.
The 505th Knights Brigade, one of the most famous regiments of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, was formed on this day, 21 years ago. Its war path is the path of glory, military victories, but also selfless heroism and suffering. There is almost no soldier of this brigade who was not wounded in the fights for BiH, and 471 Bužim heroes’ lives laid their lives for free Bosnia and Herzegovina. A particular place in this collective memory and in the hearts of all Bosniaks belongs to Commander Izet Nanić, General, Golden Lily and hero of the defensive-liberation war. He died in the dawn of freedom, in a victorious liberating march of the units of our army, on 5 August, 18 years ago. The courage of Izet Nanić, his war heroism was and will forever remain the ideal for future generations who will look after our free and proud homeland.
Respected defenders of Bosnia and Herzegovina, dear friends!
The fact is, when we think back to that time 18 years ago, that the victorious march of our army was stopped at its peak. The powerful international creators of the peace process, in their plans and projections, did not allow a military victor in the war in BiH.
However, from this distance, and with full responsibility, I can say that our historical, moral victory no one can take away, nor can they dispute it, no matter how hard they tried. That victory is as clear as a teardrop, won in almost impossible conditions, in superhuman fight against double aggression and with imposed arms embargo for our army.
When the answers and explanations in the first post-war period were asked about how we managed to defend the state and the people, our President and Supreme Commander Alija Izetbegović said: “When the miracle of Bosnian resistance is being deciphered from some historical distance, it will be found that the secret was somewhere in the souls and the character of the people.” Unconquered Krajina and unwavering “heavens power” are the most prominent examples of that MIRACLE and that indestructible spirit. The whole of Bosnia knows that and that is respected by the Bosniaks and all Bosnian patriots, in war and in peace. I am often asked if Alija Izetbegović would be pleased with the achieved when he could see the state of us today. Bearing in mind all that we have been through, resistance and blockades which we faced and with which we are today also politically wrestling – I am convinced he would not be displeased. Because, Bosnia and Herzegovina has been preserved, saved. We have achieved most of strategic goals and the path forward is clear. However, we are progressing slowly, often with delays, but we are moving towards real goals. In the next decade, and do not doubt this, our country will be a member of the European Union and NATO.
Dear friends!
One more fact is clear and there is no dilemma about it: those who tried and wished to tire Bosnia have tired themselves. Bosnia is constant and unquestionable, and their time is passing, their political star is fading away. We will not remember them in a few years. The Bosniak politicians who every so often give “better offers“will not be any better off. They are those who are ready to take the country ten years back for their seats and a few years in the government. They promised a lot, but did little. They spent three years in political hoops, they got lost in own calculations and inadequacy to lead the country on its path of reform. However, we must not allow them to implement their “better offer”. We will not allow for the fear and lawlessness to forestall. The Ranković methods cannot be used to arrest honourable people and introduce a police state. They should know – that will not pass! We will not allow them to sell off the most valuable assets of Bosnia; they are under ownership of generations to come! There will be no dismissal of independent bodies and putting of judiciary under political control! We will now allow the change in the Electoral Law, so that no Bosniak could ever again be a mayor of Srebrenica! Their Law on Residency which would prevent Bosniaks from registering at their burned hearths in the RS will pass. We are not allowing them to elect the Law on Public Procurement, which would allow them the continuation of robbery!
My dear Krajina people!
Unfortunately, those who in peace, by political means wish to accomplish war aims have not left the historical scene. It has been shown that the division of Bosnia is an unattainable goal, but tries to revise the truth about the aggression on our country are a real danger and various services in the RS and Serbia are systematically dealing with this. They are trying to revise the past with various declarations, and relativize the guilt for the war. We must clearly send them a message: Forgeries will not pass! Those who were systematically committing crimes and those who were systematically preventing and sanctioning them cannot be equalised.
However, it is in The Hague that the most truthful history of Bosnia and Herzegovina is being written: Tuđman’s political and military adventure received its epilogue and its real name: “joint criminal enterprise”. And Karadžić will not only answer for the genocide in Srebrenica, but also for the genocide in Bratunac, Foča, Ključ, Prijedor, Sanski Most, Vlasenica and Zvornik. The forgers do not like it when we repeat these facts. They count that we will slowly start forgetting the truth about what happened in Bosnia and Herzegovina from 1992 to 1995. They are wrong! There is no oblivion! There is no equating! There is no capitulation under lies! That is the first condition for the preservation of our pride and dignity! And it is precisely due to DIGNITY that we have been fighting for over two decades. Dignity of a Bosnian man! And we will continue to fight. We must never again allow for ourselves to be weak. Weakness attracts despots. Never again without own army. No demilitarisation, no disarmament.... No low budgets... I invite you here in Krajina today, in our Bužim: let’s be united, strong, conscientious and awake.
I know that all of you, as is the case with the majority of citizens of our country, are concerned with everyday problems. I know the living standards are low, that you are concerned for the existence and future of your children. You rightly ask when the political quarrels will stop and economy come into the fore of interest and action of politicians. I agree with you completely, and I do as much as is in my power to stabilise the state in the region and Bosnia and Herzegovina, because only a peaceful and political stable country attracts capital and investors. Investors run away from quarrels and conflict regions. You can also contribute for the conditions to change. Next year, do not give your vote to those who tricked you, those who are the most responsible for such situation in the state. Give your trust to those who will not betray you and who will return the country to the right path. Support those who will first and foremost be concerned with economic projects which will bring investors, open factories and new working places.
In the end, I wish to add: the census is taking place soon. Do not be confused by various fake ’chaplains’. We know who we are and do not need anyone to teach us that. We are BOSNIAKS; our religion is ISLAM; our language BOSNIAN! There is absolutely no dilemma about that! May all our noble shaheeds rest in peace and let there be eternal remembrance for the all the killed fighters of the Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Thank you!

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović at the 18th anniversary of the breakout by the 28th Srebrenica Division of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina Army, 14 July 2013
content:
July is, as one of the Srebrenica mothers said, the saddest month for us. That is the month of painful rememberance of our innocently killed brothers and sisters. In that month, all our pain over the tragedy and horrid injustice done to us is most clearly focused and presented. But, Srebrenica is not just the symbol of genocide and the worst crime in Europe after the Second World War.
Dear Heroes of the 28th Division of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina Army,
Esteemed Reis-ul-Ulema ef. Kavazović,
Respected guests and friends,
Essselamu Aleykum and good day to you!
These are difficult days for our people.
July is, as one of the Srebrenica mothers said, the saddest month for us.
That is the month of painful rememberance of our innocently killed brothers and sisters.
In that month, all our pain over the tragedy and horrid injustice done to us is most clearly focused and presented.
But, Srebrenica is not just the symbol of genocide and the worst crime in Europe after the Second World War.
The Srebrenica genocide is the culmination of the centuries-old suffering of the Bosniaks, killings, banishment, destruction and burning of our homes, looting of our properties.
In great wars of the twentieth century, in great shifts and tectonic disturbances, us the Bosniaks have always been under fire.
Mainly as the object of historical events.
Weak, abandoned, politically unorganised, dispersed, we were an easy target to looters and killers who were mainly recruited from our closest neighbourhood.
Bosnia is swamped with bones of innocently killed Bosniaks, and the River Drina is our largest mass grave.
In the twentieth century, our grandfathers and grandmothers, fathers and mothers, have endured at least two wars and five states, five state or social systems.
Not one of these state systems was inclined to us.
From one epoch to another, from year to year, we were in increasingly worse position. All the poorer, politically disempowered, nationally indifferent.
We have been paying an enormous price just because we were Muslims and because we did not want to give up our religion.
When we straightened up, in a desire to be equal, when we somewhat recovered and organised ourselves politically, in the last decade of the previous century, we were most brutally attacked.
The objective was total destruction – genocide.
We were heavily wounded – yet not defeated.
The “miracle of Bosnian resistance” happened, as our first President and Supreme Commander Alija Izetbegović used to say.
A part of that miracle was the several days long breakout of the Srebrenica people, a hundred kilometres long, the breakout which the history of war has not seen before.
Alija also said: “We will not allow for Srebrenica and all that Srebrenica means happen ever again. That – that the genocide must never repeat – is and will be the greatest law which will guide the behaviour of our people in the future.”
These words of his we must never forget!
Dear Heroes of Srebrenica and Podrinje,
I know you are in your thoughts with those who should have been with us today, but who have been taken from us on the path of death, breaking through from Srebrenica to the free territory.
This line up is incomplete and sorrowful like the line up organised by Naser Orić at Zlača near Banovići on 25 July 1995.
However, it is not only the sorrow that is part of us, but there is pride, and strength, and determination not to succumb to evil, to hatred, to the forces who wished for us to banish.
This is precisely what we owe to the victims of Srebrenica and its heroes and shaheeds.
Theirs is the eternity, and our obligation is to further fight, not to sink into dispiritedness, resentment, bitterness, and internal conflicts.
We must accomplish their ideals, preserve and improve the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina and our people, as well as make possible for the future generations to return to parents’ homes and live without fear of a new genocide.
We constantly repeat to ourselves and the world, from year to year, from day to day, from our pure moral position, from our bright page of our history, the following questions: How could this have happened to us, how did the world let this happen, how come they did not prevent a genocide at the end of the twentieth century, how did they allow concentration camps, rape, banishment, killing of thousands of children all around Bosnia and Herzegovina?
Those questions remain in the air with no answers.
They are followed by silence and nausea.
I said three days ago in Potočari: “Innocence and helplessness of victims has probably been so obviously and clearly faced with such cold and merciless hatred of criminals, as well as with unprecedented and shameful indifference of powerful world leaders in the Nazi camps of the Hitler's Germany only.”
“Where there is no justice, hatred enters,” one of the surviving Srebrenica men wrote.
However, even with awareness about all this, and with bitterness which has remained for these past 18 years, we should be grateful to those world leaders who feel for us these day and who clearly send a message that the genocide must not be denied and the perpetrators must be punished.
In the end, dear brothers and sisters, I wish for a clear message to be heard from here today, for ourselves, for our future and the future of our children.
That message we must always have in mind.
Never again should we be weak! Never!
The weakness attracts tyrants.
We must be uniform and well organised.
You, the best sons Bosnia has, I invite not to allow to be drawn into daily-political quarrels.
In those fights only manipulators take cheap benefits, and we all lose.
Those who spread lies and divisions expect precisely that.
Remain dignified.
Dignity is in fact the word which most precisely gives an answer when we are asked for what have we been fighting for decades?
For dignity of a Bosnian man.
But also against oblivion, humiliation, lies and injustice!
And we will continue, all together, to fight further!
May all the Podrinje and all our noble Bosnian shaheeds rest in peace!
Let there be eternal remembrance for the killed fighters of our heroic Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Thank you!

title: Address of BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović in Potočari, 11 July 2013
content:
Therefore, from this place, let me deliver a clear message: facing the complete truth on tragic events that took place at the end of the twentieth century, however difficult it may be for some, is a precondition for all reconciliation processes, stabilization and progress of the South Eastern European region.
Dear mothers, dear members of the shaheed families of the Podrinje area!
Dear friends from Bosnia and Herzegovina and the world, who share our grief and compassion for the innocent victims of the Srebrenica genocide!
It has been 18 years today since the genocide in Srebrenica.
We have gathered here to accompany to their final rest mortal remains of four hundred and seven men, boys and elderly men, and of our two sisters – Behara Đelilović and Hajra Mulalić.
We will also bury today four fathers with two sons each: Šaban Salkić with his sons Senad and Smajo, Hamed Halilović with Hasan and Hamdija, Šaćir Rizvanović with Mirzet and Nijaz, Smajo Ibrahimović with Saib and Salih.
We will also accompany 44 minor boys to their final rest, including Nevzet Čević and Denif Halilović, who were only 14 when they were killed, and their friends who were just one year older - Sabahudin Ibišević, Fahrudin Smajlović, Suljo Mašić and Avdija Orić.
We will also lower down to her grave the smallest casket of an infant baby girl whom her mother Hava and father Hajrudin did not have time enough to name.
We have been asking ourselves in the course of these eighteen years to whom and what for they could possibly have been guilty of back in those hellish days of July 1995.
Words are insufficient to describe the crimes that took place here.
Hatred resulting in a multi-day systematic slaughter of 8,372 innocent men just because they were Bosniak Muslims, who defended their families, courtyards and homes they were born in is incomprehensible to a normal human being.
The scale of evil is illustrated by an unquestionable and horrible fact that during those hellish days the death squadrons of Karadžić and Mladić killed one Srebrenica man each minute, while not even sparing the lives of the 12, 13 or 14 year old boys, or of elderly men who were 80.
They did this in an organized, systematic way, down to the last captured person.
In the days, months and years that followed their mortal remains underwent repeated defilement while being transferred through hundreds of mass graves in the territory of 13 municipalities of the Podrinje region, and of five municipalities in Serbia.
In order to try to conceal the genocide, they repeated evil deeds by barbaric indulging in ridicule with the dead victims.
Dear mothers of Srebrenica, dear people from the Podrinje region, dear friends!
The shots fired by the killers from the Special State Unit of Serbia “Scorpions“ in the back of the heads of the Srebrenica boys were also shots fired at the heart of contemporary civilization, the heart of the global order represented by the Dutch UN battalion’s blue helmets in the so-called “safe area“.
Innocence and helplessness of victims has probably been so obviously and clearly faced with such cold and merciless hatred of criminals, as well as with unprecedented and shameful indifference of powerful world leaders in the Nazi camps of the Hitler's Germany only.
Those who could have prevented the tragedy of Srebrenica, and of the whole of Bosnia and Herzegovina, failed to do so, thus failing a test in history.
Srebrenica will remain a dark spot on a cheek of most responsible factors within the international community.
We keep making our oath each year again and again, and this time we make it during the sacred month of Ramadan: we will never forget the victims of Srebrenica, nor shall we allow the shadows of lies to cover up and relativize the truth about the gravest suffering in our people's history.
We also know that, should there be a grain of earthly consolation for the mothers, sisters and daughters of Srebrenica, then such grain is the inevitability of justice that must reach the criminals.
Unfortunately, the victims have been waiting for justice for too long!
The key creator and commander Slobodan Milošević died in the Hague, while Radovan Karadžić and Ratko Mladić often stage an inappropriate theatre show in the Scheveningen, thus mocking at the victims who survived.
Their followers, hundreds of direct executors and killers, still walk freely the streets in Bosnian towns, while defying justice and threatening the returnees.
The criminals must hear a clear message: we will never stop persecuting them. War crimes are not subject to the statute of limitations.
Furthermore, those who negate the genocide in Srebrenica must know that they thus commit a new crime, while siding themselves to the dark side of history.
Lies, provocations and ignoring of the truth must stop.
The genocide in Srebrenica is a crime of planetary dimensions. Not only ourselves, but the whole world must keep repeating that lesson, in the same manner in which we always keep repeating the lesson on the Holocaust.
For all of us, in each school in Bosnia and Herzegovina, this lesson must have particular importance.
The sooner we learn it, it will be easier for us to live on and follow the path of reconciliation to such future in which crimes will not be repeated.
We have no other path to follow.
Therefore, from this place, let me deliver a clear message: facing the complete truth on tragic events that took place at the end of the twentieth century, however difficult it may be for some, is a precondition for all reconciliation processes, stabilization and progress of the South Eastern European region.
Only the courageous, humane, responsible and honest leaders can lead such processes in a credible way.
Self-deceptions and ignorance, that are unfortunately still occupying some minds, will not bring about anything good to anyone.
Such attitudes may only be dangerous sources of new conflicts and violence.
Innocent victims of Srebrenica deserve the truth and peace. We accompany them to their final rest at this site, which should be an important remembrance symbol for the whole world, with the prayer “let Srebrenica never repeat itself to anyone“.
Thank you!

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović at the opening of the new building of the United Nations in Sarajevo, 5 July 2013
content:
UNDP, that is the United Nations Development Programme, is particularly recognizable and accepted in the whole of our country. With its various activities and projects, the United Nations is helping us employ people, strengthen the system of responsible governance, respect of human rights, employment, energetic efficiency, as well as to more expediently include the youth into the public, political and economic life of the country.
Your Excellency Helen Clark,
Dear coordinator Mister Afanasiev,
Ladies and gentlemen!
It is my pleasure to be here with you and open this lovely home of the United Nations in Sarajevo.
The presence of the United Nations Organisation in our country already lasts over two decades.
The United Nations have significantly assisted Bosnia and Herzegovina, through its various agencies and programme, and by addressing various needs of our population.
Unfortunately, the United Nations once did not pass the test in Bosnia and Herzegovina in the UN safe haven of Srebrenica. The genocide was not prevented although the UN troops had the mandate and the obligation to do so.
The whole world saw this and the UN admitted their catastrophic mistake.
However, certain agencies of the United Nations greatly assisted our citizens. UNHCR, IPTF, UNICEF, UNESCO, UNDP, ILO, and so on, have left a deep and positive mark on the development of our country and its civil society in the post conflict period.
We are grateful for that engagement which has lasted to this day and which will be administered from this building which we are officially opening today.
UNDP, that is the United Nations Development Programme, is particularly recognizable and accepted in the whole of our country.
With its various activities and projects, the United Nations is helping us employ people, strengthen the system of responsible governance, respect of human rights, employment, energetic efficiency, as well as to more expediently include the youth into the public, political and economic life of the country. It is due to the above mentioned that I am particularly pleased that we today have an opportunity in Bosnia and Herzegovina, in Sarajevo, to welcome you, Mrs. Clark!
The way you lead UNDP and the UN group for development is very impressive.
I wish you all the best to continue your engagement in building of better and more balanced developed world!
Moreover, I wish every success and all the best to the local UN staff which is continuing to work for the overall benefit of Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Thank you.

title: Address delivered by BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović, patron of the official academy marking the 550th anniversary of Sultan Fatih's Adhnama
content:
Dear President Kučan,
Your Excellencies,
Dear friends,
Assalamu alaikum and good evening,
As the patron of this manifestation, I am very pleased that we have an opportunity to host tonight the high ranking officials of the friendly countries of our region.
These days we have been marking, by a series of manifestations, 550 years since the date when one of the first documents on the protection of human rights in the history of humankind was issued. This document is the Adhnama of Sultan Mehmed Fatih, signed on 28 May 1463 in Milodraž in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
It was by the Adhnama that the Sultan guaranteed the Franciscans peace, freedom, security and their return from places of refuge. It declared that it was prohibited to disturb or offend them, and ensured security to their monasteries and churches.
It is not easy from this distance and from the current perspective to accept and understand fully the greatness and significance of this document. We live in a modern, sovereign, democratic country of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Nowadays our country albeit faced with many problems and challenges, is independent and free again, discrimination is prohibited by the law and the human rights must be respected.
On its path to the society of well organized European states, Bosnia and Herzegovina will have to deal with these issues with increasing intensity. It will continue to perfect itself and provide a better service to its citizens.
Perhaps it seems sometimes to someone that on that path there is no need to turn too much to the past, and that one’s sole focus should be the focus on the future. However, this is not so.
It is the responsibility of all of us to, from time to time, look back and express our deep respect to all those who interweaved their existence into the existence of Bosnia.
To those who, by means of their approach to equality of human beings, enabled creation of our multi-ethnic community which, in many ways, is a precursor of the current European spirit and unification.
Let us try to understand the time in which the Adhnama was written. At that time the conquerors did not pay attention to the collective rights of communities they would conquered. The only thing that mattered was the size of seized territories and prompt establishment of new governance. Enslaving was a common phenomenon.
Prior to the arrival of the Ottomans, Bosnia used to have its own independence and history, her specificity. The Franciscans used to have a very important and recognizable role in the Bosnian specificity and history. This has been the case to date, and will remain to be the case always. The Franciscans have been weaved into the complex multi-ethnic weft of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Sultan Mehmed El-Fatih was obviously aware of this fact, and thus decided to guarantee the Franciscans the right to live and act freely in the new circumstances. The text of the Adhnama which he signed says it all, and it does so in a very unambiguous language.
A documentary which we have seen provides a testimony for this, as well as for other aspects of the history of that time. I hereby express my gratitude to all those who worked on this film.
Of course, many Bosnians and Herzegovinians have mixed and ambivalent feelings regarding this period of our history as all of us who love this country are proud of its overall standing. We are also proud of the achievements of our mediaeval state, which vanished in those days before a mighty empire that, at that period, overflowed a huge portion of the world.
However, it is a historic fact that the time which the Ottomans spent in Bosnia and in the Balkans brought about centuries of peace and development of a unique multi-cultural identity that this country now has. We are proud indeed of that historical period of Bosnia and Herzegovina, too. The Ottoman component is simply an irreplaceable part of the formulae of the Bosnian and Herzegovinian identity and specificity.
Dear friends,
I sincerely hereby thank the organizers of tonight’s manifestation for an excellent job they have done!
I thank all of you for participating in tonight’s marking of the 550th anniversary of the Adhnama.
And I congratulate in advance the recipients of charters and letters of appreciation.
I wish you all the best!
Thank you!

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović at the 4th Sarajevo Business Forum
content:
Your Excellencies,
Dear SBF participants,
Ladies and gentlemen,
Dear friends,
It is my great pleasure to be here today and extend welcome to you to this year's fourth Sarajevo Business Forum.
Let me, in particular, extend greetings to a great friend of Bosnia and Herzegovina, to a man who stood with the people of this country during its most difficult times, one of the world's greatest statesmen of the 20th century, Muhamed Mahatir. I also extend greetings to the former President of Slovenia Danilo Türk, Deputy Prime Minister of Turkey Ali Babacan, as well as His Excellency Humaid Obaid Al Tayer, Minister of Finance of the United Arab Emirates.
It is thanks to a hard-working team of organizers, led by Amer Bukvić, that Bosnia and Herzegovina and its capital have become an attractive site for investors from all over the world, and that this forum has grown into a truly nice tradition.
Here in the open, cosmopolitan city of Sarajevo, we have met and will continue to meet each other in order to do some good things, share experience and ideas, agree on valuable jobs in the interest of our countries and the people who entrusted us with their confidence.
Political leaders and entrepreneurs, or prime ministers, presidents and investors, bankers and managers should compose one team, which will play together in order to create new values, progress and advancement.
If the former are not responsible players, if they are more inclined to disputes and conflicts than to cooperation, dialogue and creation of a positive environment, then, of course, businessmen run away from them and look for other, more peaceful, stable and favourable sites to implement their business plans. Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as our whole region in the South Eastern part of Europe, have slowly progressed to more peaceful political waters. A slogan “zero problems with neighbours“gets more likely to be implemented here in the Western Balkans, too, amongst the countries which were at war just some twenty years ago.
I met with the presidents of Serbia and Croatia Nikolić and Josipović last month, on Wednesday we will attend a tripartite meeting Serbia-BiH-Turkey, hosted by our distinguished host, President of Turkey Abdulah Gül, so that I will not exaggerate if I tell you that better days are ahead of us, for the countries of our region. It is by solving the Kosovo issue that, finally, curtains have been dropped over a difficult and painful period.
A rational conviction prevails in standpoints demonstrated by the key leaders in the region that only peace, mutual cooperation and stability may bring about a better future for all countries established following the break-up of former Yugoslavia. I am not saying that there will be no minor crisis in these relations. However, I am convinced that there is time filled with better news that will follow, and that we have reached a new highway which leads both Bosnia and Herzegovina and our neighbouring countries to stability and stronger economic progress.
Dear friends,
Bosnia and Herzegovina is a country with scars that are still visible due to the late 20th century war. We are still passing through a period of crises and barriers on our European path. But, those who raise political ado, who look for their opportunity in new destructions and conflicts, disqualify themselves actually. They are like temporary thunderstorm. You will see, we will not remember them in a few years. Only courageous leaders with clear vision will bring about prosperity and a better future to both this country and the region.
Bosnia and Herzegovina has got all necessary pre-requisites to become an equal member of the European family of states. From a comparative perspective, we have numerous potential advantages in relation to many other European countries. According to the recently published World Bank's surveys, Bosnia and Herzegovina is the first in the region and the seventh country in Europe by its water resources. This potential has not been utilized sufficiently, and we are yet to implement some major development projects in the electric power sector. In addition to this, with our rich fundamental resources – coal, wood, minerals, and even certain oil supplies – we should look for our opportunity in development of agriculture and tourism.
Let me remind you that we have implemented successfully the Turkish loan amounting to 100 million Euros through projects providing assistance to returnee population, primarily by investment into agricultural production. Therefore, I would like to extend my thanks once again to the Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdoğan and the Government of Turkey for this particularly important assistance to our country.
Infrastructural projects, certainly, have to be in the focus of all development projects, including, primarily, a continuation of construction of the motor road at the Corridor 5C. Things are going well on that issue, too, so that we expect an even stronger impetus in order to complete this traffic “spine“ of Bosnia and Herzegovina in the next few years.
In addition to all this, BiH has a long industrial tradition, educated people, responsible and relatively cheap labour force, high quality managers, proven constructors, innovators and engineers, stable currency pegged to Euro, companies relevant in the international context... What our governments at all levels must do, parallel to persistent and decisive fight against corruption indeed, is to remove all administrative obstacles that now hinder foreign investors and discourage potential entrepreneurs.
Dear Sarajevo Business Forum participants, dear guests,
With all its past and current problems, Bosnia and Herzegovina has shown an extraordinary vitality and strength to move forward, even though it has carried heavy weight on it legs. It has always been supported in this endeavour by its friends: those from the East and those from the West alike. Today's conference is an opportunity in which friends of our country and of our people, leaders who brought about miracles in economic reconstruction and progress of their countries will explain how they did it and thus help us create a similar, positive economic recourse in Bosnia and Herzegovina, too.
I extend my thanks to them for attending this conference, for their efforts, and for everything good that they have done for our country.
Thank you!

title: Address by BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović at the Sarajevo Halal Fair and Forum (SAHAF)
content:
It is my distinct pleasure to, as the sponsor of this fair and forum, greet you and wish you successful future cooperation, and many new joint projects which will bring a concrete benefit to all, and represent Bosnia and Herzegovina in a new and positive light in international market places and global business circles.
Distinguished Excellencies, respected guests, participants, organisers, ladies and gentlemen,
It is my distinct pleasure to, as the sponsor of this fair and forum, greet you and wish you successful future cooperation, and many new joint projects which will bring a concrete benefit to all, and represent Bosnia and Herzegovina in a new and positive light in international market places and global business circles.
I am particularly honoured that this unique event is taking place under mine and the auspices of the esteemed Reis-ul-Ulema of the Islamic Community in BiH, H.E. Mr. Husein ef. KavazoviÄ‡.
Besides the cooperation between business people, academic and scientific institutions, as well as religious circles, a strong support of the institutions of government to such initiatives and projects represents key for success of this and every other positive project.
We are happy and proud that Sarajevo is a host to this important international manifestation which links business people, investors, academic and religious institutions, and companies and officials from Bosnia and Herzegovina and the whole world.
Alongside Sarajevo Business Forum, which Sarajevo has already become recognized for in the international business circles, I wish for SAHAF also to become a traditional manifestation which will offer opportunities and new possibilities for all of us.
Young, educated business people, the initiators of this project, have done an exceptional job in organizing a demanding event and I congratulate them.
Bosnia and Herzegovina has considerable potentials which can enable it to, in relatively short time, develop various industrial activities. Bosnia and Herzegovina can become a perfect connection place of business people from the East and the West.
We understand well the East and the West, as we are located on their crossroads and we share values and convictions of both. Here, any person with good intentions is appreciated and welcome.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is also the central part of wider region of South-East Europe and I see many participants and friends from the neighbouring countries who are attending this event, which represents a testimony and an impetus that we can and must cooperate better. The attendance by the guests and friends from the far countries testifies the fact that BiH is recognized in those countries as a state which has a lot to offer and which has positioned itself on the world map for the halal market place.
Along with the energy sector and investment into infrastructural projects, the halal industry represents a development potential which can significantly contribute to the process of integrations, economic and social development, and to the overall improvement in the quality of life of its citizens. For, halal food is the healthiest food which comes as a product of a completely controlled process of production.
Opportunities for doing business in the field of halal industry throughout the world are enormous. Potentials and demand increase daily.
I am convinced that SAHAF will contribute to the connection of certified halal producers and service providers from our regions with the greatest players in the leading world halal markets and will make them more visible and recognisable within the international framework.
Thank you.

title: BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović addresses the central ceremony on the occasion of the Day of the Army of the Republika Srpska and the Day of the 3rd Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska), Ba
content:
Dear Families of fallen and missing soldiers of the Republika Srpska,
Presidents,
Representatives,
Ministers,
Generals, officers, privates and civilians serving in the AF BiH,
Ladies and Gentlemen!
Twenty-one years have passed since the Army of Republika Srpska was formed, and eight years since forming of the 3rd Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska). We are here today to mark those dates: the Day of the Army of Republika Srpska and the Day of the 3rd Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska) which nourishes the combat path and liberating traditions of the Serb people.
Gentlemen privates, NCOs, officers, Generals and civilians of the 3 Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska), I congratulate you the Day of the Army of Republika Srpska and the Day of the Regiment, and I salute you with our traditional military salute: Pomo'z Bog, junaci! (God Bless Heroes!)
The Army of Republika Srpska was formed on 12 May 1992, with a fundamental aim of protecting the Serb people in BiH, in the areas where they have always lived, in the times of open and organized political and armed destruction of Yugoslavia, as a unique state in which the Serb people lived together with other peoples.
The forming of the Army of Republika Srpska was extorted by political circumstances which threatened repetition of the tragic suffering of the Serb people from the near past, and which too expensively was paid with human lives. The Army of Republika Srpska is political and military expression of the instinct for self-sustainability, collective defense of biological survival and preservation of the Republika Srpska, as political autonomy and self-management of the Serb people in BiH.
Eighteen years after the war in BiH ended, the destroyers of Yugoslavia publicly praise themselves for succeeding in destroying once mutual state of ours. In this flood of new publicity books, documentary and memoir archives of that time, today, open activities and action of various International and internal forces, which worked consciously and with plan on destroying the once mutual state of ours, emerge to the surface. Many of the politicians of those times and military commanders are now national heroes of their peoples and the states created, they seek for recognition for such politics of separatism and destruction. Those who consciously destroyed the mutual state and light the flames of inter-nation war conflicts, lament today over the consequences they caused, rejecting any kind of responsibility for the past events of war.
From the testimonies before The Hague Court and the domestic Courts in the cases of war crimes, undeniable facts which preceded the armed conflict in BiH are being revealed today. The process of armament and preparations for the war in Yugoslavia and BiH can be clearly seen from those facts. It is enough to remind ourselves of the fact that, before the recognition of BiH Independence, while still being the part of Yugoslavia, there had been more than 30 armed attacks and incidents on the Serb people and Yugoslav National Army, as the only regular and joint armed formation of the state in accordance with the Constitution and the laws in force.
Furthermore, we must not forget the facts that the armed formations of other two peoples in BiH had been formed before the forming of the Army of Republika Srpska, which is witnessed by the dates of their marking, which are being celebrated even today. We are not saying that to deny the right to political view of the events to others, bit for the reason of the Serb side having been tendentiously and maliciously attributed with sole responsibility for the destruction of the country and the beginning of the war. We do not deny rights to other people to political organization and self-defense, as nobody can deny those rights either. It is only that we will not let lies to be spread about the Serb people and the Army of Republika Srpska in the past war.
Today, when we are marking the Day of the Army of Republika Srpska and the Day of the 3 Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska), we are both proud and sad. We are proud o live free and in peace in the Republika Srpska, for which the combatants of the Army of Republika Srpska fought for. At the same time, we are sad for many of them gave their lives in the past war and did not live to see the day of peace. Therefore, we honor them, with the due reverence and lasting memory. The Republika Srpska will never forget its people's army, fallen and missing soldiers and their families, because it is our patriotic, moral and social responsibility and duty.
The 3 Infantry Republika Srpska Regiment, in peace, proudly nourishes and guards the tradition of the Army of Republika Srpska and the glorious fights of the entire Serb people in the past. .
The courage, patriotism and knightly moral of the fighters of the Army of Republika Srpska, in the hard times for the Serb people, should be the role model for the members of the 3 Infantry Republika Srpska Regiment , yet to all young generations in the Republika Srpska.
The 3 Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska) is a peacekeeping and defensive military component, directed towards defense and providing collective security, but if some think that for this reason, they will scare us with threats of disappearance of the Republika Srpska, by staging the so called „limited war“, they are wrong and are underestimating our readiness to defend the national identity and by the Constitution and Laws realized rights. We are sending a message to those that they should stop spreading hatred amongst peoples and new delusions to their own people, and that they should turn to progress, future and solving of the problems of people in everyday life.
We are of the opinion that, in BiH, we must avoid these misunderstanding at any price, try to solve the mutual problems and open questions through agreement, but at the same time we are sending this message from this place today, to all those who once again wish to cause conflict, mislead peoples and threaten with the destruction of the constitutional structure of the country, that we shall not let that happen, we shall defend our autonomy and people's elf-management, today, in peace, as we did in the past defensive-liberation war.
We marked the 9 May yesterday, the Day of Victory over the Fascism, which is celebrated as the Day of Europe. As a part of that heritage, we nourish three great European values today: antifascism, democracy and social, political and economic integrations. I wish to remind of the huge contribution of the Serb people to the anti-fascist fight and the victory of the Allies in the WWII, on basis of which the today's democratic and united Europe was built. We will not allow the belittling and minimizing of that contribution, as well as the malicious accusations of the entire Serb people, which come from individuals and groups which are followers of those forces which lost the war, and some of them openly supported the fascism.
We will not allow the political revision of unbeatable historical facts, which tell about the Serb suffering and their contribution to people's liberating fight and building of the modern Europe. We do posses enough of spiritual and intellectual power, knowledge and political power to confront the falsification of distant and near history for the purpose of daily-political needs and propaganda.
Ladies and Gentlemen!
Several years ago, we approached to the reforms of military, security and defense sector in BiH, in accordance with the Dayton Peace Treaty, the process of the region stabilization and the peacetime needs of the country. As a result of the reforms, the 3 Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska) was formed, a one of the three constituting components of the joint Armed Forces of BiH.
The AF BiH, in future, should be adjusted to economic capabilities of the country, sub regional stability and appreciation of possible security threats and challenges.
The AF BiH should be small, cheap and effective defense military organization, in accordance with the overall progress of the society, peace development, stability and the process of the European integrations.
In such organization, the 3rd Infantry Regiment (Republika Srpska) shall find its position, not only as the unit continuing the military heritage of the Army of Republika Srpska, but also as an expression of the equality of the Serb people with the two Constitutive peoples in BiH and guaranty of its existence.
Thank you.

title: BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbregović addresses Official Academy on the occasion of the Golden Lily Day - 09 May 2013 - the Zetra Sports Hall, Sarajevo
content:
It is with grief that we remember our brothers lost and the selfless and noble sacrifice they made. For centuries, the history has marked hard periods which our country went through; it has been marked with huge sacrifices and great heroes, but there had not been harder times for our country than those from the end of the 20th century. That is why the heroism of the best Bosnian-Herzegovinian sons in the Defensive-Liberation War 1992-1995 was historical and recognized all over the planet. We shall never for
Respected families of Shaheeds and Combatants lost,
Dear Golden Lilies and carriers of the Gold Police Badge,
Dear friends, distinguished guests!
It is my tremendous honour and pleasure to be here with you today, the bravest people our Bosnia and Herzegovina has.
Many of you are my personal acquaintances and I firmly believe that to be my great treasure to be acquainted with you. Whenever we mark important dates from our recent history, hard and glorious, painful and honourable, our hearts are filled with pride, yet with grief too.
We are proud to have, even poorly armed and by many condemned to defeat, defended and saved our country, and fought for its bright future on the map of the free and democratic world.
It is with grief that we remember our brothers lost and the selfless and noble sacrifice they made. For centuries, the history has marked hard periods which our country went through; it has been marked with huge sacrifices and great heroes, but there had not been harder times for our country than those from the end of the 20th century. That is why the heroism of the best Bosnian-Herzegovinian sons in the Defensive-Liberation War 1992-1995 was historical and recognized all over the planet. We shall never forget our Shaheeds and Combatants lost.
The eternity belongs to them, and it is our obligation to leave the truth about them and their glorious fight a heritage for the generations to come.
The truth is that we stood up against the powerful machinery of the Yugoslav National Army, the Karadžić’s and Mladić’s murderers, and that in that day to day, month to month, year to year fight we were becoming stronger, more united and organized.
Bravely and wisely, the political leadership of the country, led by the War Presidency of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, the people organised into units of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, led us to freedom and reaching a historical goal – the protection and preservation of sovereign state of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
We prevailed, with many sacrifices, and our glorious army did not lose its face.
Our fighters did not revenge, did not burn villages, and were not killing innocent civilians or destroying churches.
The single crimes committed we processed during the war, and we had the strength to settle accounts with some rebel units of our own.
That is true and we must not let this be diverted in an opposite direction. We must not allow the falsifiers and enemies relativise and equalise the crimes.
The light and darkness cannot be equalised.
We have been and we are remaining on the positive side of the history and we must preserve that priceless capital of ours for the future.
We are manifesting it strongly here today when we, as it was the case previous years, are marking the Golden Lily Day, 9 May, the Day of Victory over Fascism.
Dear friends,
I know you expect me, as a BiH Presidency Member, to share with you my view on the current political situation, and say a few words about what has been happening to us lately. We all witness the crisis that has lasted for too long, fruitless political fights, the wars of political parties, selfish fight for power on which huge energy is wasted.
It all brings the country backwards, and leads people to apathy and hopelessness.
Even our ally friends do not have an answer to this political masochism. The damages we are making to ourselves are huge. Investors run away from Bosnia and Herzegovina; corruption and crime have become profitable occupations. The worse is that people are slowly becoming used to such state.
I shall quote here one of our lucid journalists, who recently said: ”God forbid we were ‘united’ like this on 2 May 1992, the Yugoslav National Army would have walked into the Presidency Building.” Perhaps, these words are too strong, but we have to take them most seriously. That is why, here in Zetra today, I wish to say: Do not let yourself, being the best of us, be dragged into daily-political showdowns and the ruthless fight for power.
Those who spread lies, divisions and strife perhaps expect exactly that. Please remain being who you were during the toughest hardships: brave, decisive, persistent and devoted to the only goal, and that is, strong, prosperous, peaceful and free state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, comfortable to all its citizens and peoples.
When the goal is of the question, there should be no divisions; we have always been and must remain as one there.
We are all there one party only today too. And that is where we shall stay.
Dear fighters, my dear Lilies, dear carriers of the Gold Police Badge, I wish you all the best for the Golden Lily Day, the Day of Victory over Fascism.
God Bless all the noble Shaheed souls of Bosnia and Herzegovina and let it be the everlasting remembrance of the fighters lost in our Defensive-Liberation War.
Love and protect our only homeland – Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Thank you!

title: BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović addresses the Opening Ceremony of the Islamic Centre in Rijeka - 4 May 2013
content:
Good day to you and As-salaam-o-alaikum! I am truly happy to be here today attending this extraordinary event. I congratulate you on having built such an astounding mosque and the Islamic Centre. I thank the Republic of Croatia and the State of Qatar for making this possible and helping the construction of this structure in which Muslims will pray to God Almighty and promote the universal ethic values and morality so needed in today’s world.
Respected President Josipović, the Prime Minister Milanović, Minister Al-Kuweriri, Mayor Obersnel, distinguished Rais-Ul-Ulemma Imam Kavazović, Mufti Hasanović, citizens of Rijeka, dear believers;
Good day to you and As-salaam-o-alaikum!
I am truly happy to be here today attending this extraordinary event. I congratulate you on having built such an astounding mosque and the Islamic Centre. I thank the Republic of Croatia and the State of Qatar for making this possible and helping the construction of this structure in which Muslims will pray to God Almighty and promote the universal ethic values and morality so needed in today’s world.
I ask Minister Al-Kuweiri to convey salaams and expressions of our gratitude to Emir of Qatar Al-Thani for his personal engagement and contribution to the Rijeka Islamic Centre. The Centre’s conference facility will honour the name of this proven friend of Bosnia and Herzegovina and Croatia.
We owe our gratitude to Mayor Vojko Obersnel and the citizens of Rijeka who, with open hearts, accepted and supported their Muslim co-citizens in their multi-decade long endeavour to build a mosque in this beautiful city.
___________________________________________
The messages we are sending from Croatia today bear historical weight and power to which the future generations will testify.
In particular, for the reason we are sending them jointly and sincerely only two months prior to the Republic of Croatia’s official becoming the EU Member.
I am using this occasion too, to congratulate the people of neighbouring and friendly Croatia on this enormous achievement.
I wish and believe that my country Bosnia and Herzegovina will become a part of the great European family of states at soonest.
The peoples and citizens of BiH deserve that, despite all the hardships they are facing on that path.
__________________________________________
Croatia is a good place for life of the Bosniak Muslims.
The way their status is solved can serve as an example to other European states.
They live here freely while majorly fulfilling their national and religious rights.
I am convinced that it shall be so in the future.
We, Muslims, believe in Ayet from the Holy Quran in which it stands that, “God created various peoples around the World for them to get to know each other.”
We know that in this world, we will continue living together, next to each other, or together, and thus it is completely wrong to tend to dominate over others.
Our diversities are our wealth, and in no way they are disadvantages. We should build our future on mutual respect.
Therefore, there is no better symbolism than this one today.
Being responsible people in the times we live in, we have an obligation to better understand each other, not to ignore one another and jeopardize; not to judge on the basis of prejudice, but to learn about each other with plenty of good will, respect and sincerity.
I believe that 1001 kilometre of the border between us, which soon will become the border between BiH and the EU, shall not be any kind of “iron curtain”, but that we will jointly fill that border with points of connection and a more intensive collaboration.
Ladies and Gentlemen!
The today’s event, in its full positive symbolism, overcomes the context of relations of the two neighbouring states and sends the signals to the entire world, and in particular, our region after all the dramatic events from the recent past.
The past ten days have been marked with a new positive energy in the relations amongst the states of the South-East Europe.
I went to Belgrade last week, and I felt good will from key people in the highest authorities of Serbia; the will to move forward, to turn toward future, without swiping the truth about past under the carpet. We should give them support in that endeavour.
I am confident that we all together find ourselves at the new beginning and that the stability and prosperity will be the key points of the future relations in this part of Europe.
May God Almighty, and all the good people amongst us, continue giving support on the path of peace and cooperation.
Thank you!

title: Welcome speech by BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović at the opening of the International Conference “Banja Luka - Model of the United Nations”, Banja Luka, 26 April 2013
content:
BiH, as a member of the UN, in accordance with its abilities provides its contribution to the work of the world organisation, obeying the international law and principles and good-neighbourly politics consistently. BiH was a non-permanent member of the UN Security Council, in the two-year mandate, between 2009 and 2011.
Respected Conference participants,
Dear young friends,
Ladies and Gentlemen!
I thank you for the invitation to open the International Youth Conference “Banja Luka – Model of the United Nations“, which gathers high school students from BiH, countries of the region and Europe, and at which you practice the best achievements of the UN. I am glad that Banja Luka joined the group of more than eighty cities from all over the world this conference is held in.
I am fully confident that this Conference will contribute not only to the affirmation of the subject you are going to discuss in the forthcoming days, but also to the promotion of the city of Banja Luka, the Republika Srpska and BiH.
The UN were founded after WWII, with an aim of preventing new conflicts amongst peoples and states, by standing for the peace, collaboration and peaceful coexistence of the countries, on the basis of collective security.
BiH, as a member of the UN, in accordance with its abilities provides its contribution to the work of the world organisation, obeying the international law and principles and good-neighbourly politics consistently. BiH was a non-permanent member of the UN Security Council, in the two-year mandate, between 2009 and 2011.
BiH Armed Forces members take part in Peace Support Missions of the UN, in several areas of crisis in the world, and thus contribute maintain peace and stability in the world.
As a BiH Presidency Member, I took part in the work of the UN General Assembly and Security Council , and I wish to share with you couple of impressions. The last time it was several days ago, when I participated in the Debate on the role of the International Criminal Justice in reconciliation.
The UN is often the subject of various criticisms by individuals and member states, for its inefficiency, sluggishness at work and is accused of failing to prevent certain conflicts in the past. That is where many demands for the reforms of this Organisation come from, and they have been coming for years. I believe that conferences like this one can contribute, not only to becoming familiar with the work of the UN, but to enhancing its work. However, with all its weakness, it is enough only to imagine what the world would look like without the UN. This World Organisation represents the widest international forum, where all the member states can, in a democratic discussion, deliver their problems and contribute to peace and stability in the world.
Lastly, I wish you successful work at the Conference, pleasant stay in Banja Luka; get to know each other and socialise, and in that way contribute to the values and ideals of the UN and the entire human kind.
Having said that, I proclaim the International Conference „Banja Luka – Model of the United Nations“ open.
Thank you.

title: Speech delivered by the Chairperson of the Presidency of BiH Nebojša Radmanović at the observance marking “60 years of organized archival activities in the Republika Srpska“, held at Banski dvor Townh
content:
As the Chairperson of the Presidency of BiH, I accepted to provide my patronage for this important jubilee and anniversary, not only due to my personal commitment to the Archive of Republika Srpska and to arshivistics as an important social activity but, first of all, due to the fact that I am aware of the importance that the Archive of the Republika Srpska has had and should have in the future in the area of preservation of identity and self-awareness of the Serb people and of the Republika Srpska as a soc
Dear archive workers,
Respected guests,
ladies and gentlemen!
