This is a unique statement in the European and world literature and one of those immortal thoughts which expresses basic truths about a man and his world. These words became the symbol of consistency in behaviour of one man in accordance with his ethical stance and personal convictions. Because of his convictions and active support for the Resistance Movement, professor Ðurić was sent for an early retirement, and then arrested and deported to a concentration camp.
In all times and among all peoples, there were people who, with their human and political action, have been examples of ethical and moral behaviour to the millions of other people in their fight for a better and more just society. These are today the sign posts and lighthouses in a spacious ocean of political life, which is at times dangerous and uncertain.
Politics and politicians are not especially highly regarded in our societies. A low level of trust in politics and politicians is a general trend in the world. In all surveys, we, the politicians are the least trusted but not much can be done without politics and politicians. In our transitional societies, there is a lot of displeasure with the work of the politicians and their regard towards the citizens who elected them to a public call which they had accepted. In BiH, there is a wide belief among the people in which politicians think one, speak another and do something different. Probably, this people's saying can be found in some other form within a majority of European peoples.
Not one ethics in the world can determine general rules of political action and behaviour that is applicable at all occasions and valid for all situations and all times. In any case, all of us who are in politics would have to know that there are means which are not allowed in politics, regardless of the aims. Politics in democracy must be oriented towards the spirit and virtue of its citizens, and less towards singular characteristics of certain politicians.
I believe that every policy derives from the values and goals which are desired to be accomplished, and not vice versa. Politics without ethics is power without a landmark and a compass. Ethics without power and means is ineffective and it ends in a principle. Pragmatism without ideals and ethical values is a bare programme of power. Politics separated from ethics is just a skill of ruling and winning authority, craft without ideas and goals. I believe that ethics and politics are intrinsically united, which enables us to differ good from bad political action.
The politicians from the Balkans are with reason often under criticism, because of the difference between their word and their action. However, our experience in BiH shows that the politicians who come from the West, when they come to BiH, behave under our circumstances, and not the way they would behave in their own countries. They soon forget the rules which exist in their democracies and immediately start behaving irresponsibly and comfortably as if we do not live in the same time and place. In this way, the international representatives in BiH deposed of hundreds of elected political representatives and forbade their work and every activity, without proof and right to appeal, they abolished laws and decisions of the parliamentary assemblies and imposed political solutions without any support within the electoral body and public.
The generations of current and future politicians will have a few challenges which they will have to face in the future:
In my opinion, idealism should be returned to politics as a belief in changes, commitment and dedication to the overall good, a spirit of debate and dialogue should be revived, vision and leadership on the principles of fair and responsible politics.
In a world of rapid changes and searching for the answers to new challenges, politics without clearly set obliging goals and values does not exist.
In future, courage will oppose the cheap populism which brings us the votes, and obstructing serious solution of societal problems.
Politics always refers to ideas. It will be a challenge in the future to find and define new ideas to replace the old ones and new problems of our societies and countries, as well as how to adjust those ideas and solutions to modern values and a view of the world of the civilization.
Ladies and gentlemen,
The School of Democracy organised by the Council of Europe represents a real small garden for future leaders of all generations. The other school awaits outside, in everyday political life. It is hard to give any advice for this. If one had to expose oneself to such a risk, then I would quote Nelson Mandela, one of those political leaders who became a role model to many generations due to his strong moral stance and sincere commitment to the overall good, who said “Believe in your dreams and keep your lives.“
Thank you.

title: BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović Address on the occasion of the marking of the 20th Anniversary of the Patriotic League of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
At this very place, exactly 20 years ago, 356 of the most eminent Yugoslav Muslims, i.e. Bosniaks, gathered here in order to determine the position of our people and our country of Bosnia and Herzegovina in the years of harsh historical development that was obviously going to happen. It certainly was one of the most important gatherings of our people in a thousand year long history of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Dear President of the Association of the Patriotic League - Mr. Hebib,
Dear President of the Coordination Board of the Organisations of the Veterans – Mr. Kulosman,
Brothers and sisters,
Ladies and gentlemen,
As-salam-o-alaikum and Good Day to you!
At this very place, exactly 20 years ago, 356 of the most eminent Yugoslav Muslims, i.e. Bosniaks, gathered here in order to determine the position of our people and our country of Bosnia and Herzegovina in the years of harsh historical development that was obviously going to happen. It certainly was one of the most important gatherings of our people in a thousand year long history of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Very brave and long-sighted Decisions were brought; decisions that would determine the fundamental directions and guidance of the military and political fight of the Bosniaks in the decades ahead, including the time of today.
I will state only some of the positions of the Proclamation which was adopted on that historical day in Sarajevo:
- Bosnia and Herzegovina is the homeland to Muslims, Serbs and Croats, and all citizens who live in it. Its undividableness it granted to itself through Centuries of the live together.... For this reason, we call for all Muslims, all Serbs, and all Croats, and all citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina, to defend their homeland.
- We opt for Bosnia and Herzegovina as a civil republic in which the freedoms and rights of a human and a citizen will be respected, national rights of peoples and minorities will be respected, and in which an economic and political democracy will rule. This is the long-lasting determination of the Muslim people.
- We call for the citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina to decisively oppose every politics and actions which undermine and question equality and integrity of Bosnia and Herzegovina and equal rights of all of its peoples and citizens.
- Convinced in the lasting values of democracy and democratic institutions, we express our readiness to lead a dialogue on all questions of joint life in a democratic and civil Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
- We believe in the need and future of integrations in Yugoslav and European region. This is the reason why the borders of Bosnia and Herzegovina should permanently be opened towards Croatia, Serbia and Montenegro and beyond, across them towards Europe. For the openness of the borders towards all we have one condition only – friendly intentions.
The most concrete part of the Proclamation was the Paragraph 6, which states that, due to „the politics of national hegemony and great-statehood as well as the challenges which threaten the survival of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and by that a direct survival of the Muslim people“, the Council for National Defence was founded, as a new body of the Party of Democratic Action (SDA).
The Council was soon to develop into the Patriotic League, and the Patriotic League would in an incredibly short period of time create conditions for strengthening the army of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and a military force which the history of war and military warfare will certainly remember. For, the creation, strengthening and the military results of the Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina, must be interesting to the analysts, since they simply resist the rational analysis. The fight of the BiH patriots surely deserves, at a first sight, pretentious title of – A miracle of Bosnian resistance! For, let us remember – in 1992, Bosnia and Herzegovina was an occupied country. The Yugoslav National Army units were withdrawn into it along with a massive military technique and over a 100,000 soldiers, i.e. the warriors who had tasted the fights in Croatia. Only in Sarajevo, there were 17 barracks, and the Serb Democratic Party (SDS) had created well equipped para-military formations across Bosnia and Herzegovina. We had practically moved from ground zero, from an occupied state to disarmed Territorial Defence.
Tuđman and Milošević had planned for Bosnia to fall silently (whispery). For it to be divided the way Cvetković and Maček did it, counting for no Muslims to be in it, and that we are only a passive object of division. They were gravely mistaken, they brought themselves, and us too, into one of the bloodiest wars on the Balkans. Tuđman let go of the aggression and great-state plan first, in 1993, and accepted the Washington Treaty. In 1994, the military balance was created despite the full encirclement and lack of communications and supply routes of the Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina, despite the insidious weapons embargo which affected defenders only. Yet the Army, cut off from the rest of the world, strengths and starts to prevail! In 1995, our Army did not lose a single battle – it liberates towns, communications, mountains, and the glorious white banner with golden lilies waving on the freed summit of mountain Vlašić.
The victorious campaign was stopped in the autumn of 1995 under the threat of NATO strikes. The creators of the embargo did not want a military victor, they took away from us the military victory, yet the moral one, nobody can take from us, nor can anyone question it. The soldiers of the Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina, mostly members of the Bosniak people, who went through unprecedented horror, prosecution, concentration camps, genocide – those soldiers did not take revenge. They led a knightly and honourable flight, which, to our people and our country brought a good reputation and respect throughout the world. Both, amongst friendly peoples and those who are not.
Our fight is a founding stone for the future of generations to come. Yes, you see, there are philosophers who claim that the glorious resistance took place spontaneously, by itself. People, allegedly armed and formed resistance by themselves?! I am very sorry to, at this honourable place and on this honourable day, use this word to describe such claims – thus, deliberate, malicious lie and stupidity!
A soccer tournament for the elementary school pupils cannot be formed without any kind of organisation, not to speak about defending the country and people from a well coordinated aggression of immeasurably superior neighbours who were ready to commit the worst crimes! Some of our wise heads did not want to look the truth in the eye, but the Head of the Counter Intelligence Service, Aco Vasiljević, did and who objected to late Alija Izetbegović that SDA was arming the people, but he said: „... We are not concerned about it. The weapons themselves do not mean much. We are concerned that you are creating an organisation...“
Yes. The defence of Bosnia and Herzegovina was organised by the Party of Democratic Action, more precisely, its democratic wing – the Patriotic League. The leaders of people, and later military leaders, starting from a commander of the General Quarters downwards, were the eminent members of the Patriotic League!
There are peoples who cherish the memories of their defeats, the battles lost, they cherish and remember them for hundreds of years, trying to make them their victories. With us, sometimes it is in reverse. Our people are good, brave, yet tending to forget. We forget our victories, the men who won those victories, prepared and made it possible. Meša Selimović says that we are the people who are not easily scared but that the Bosniaks are, after the historical efforts, prone to become, as he says, „sleepers“.
We mustn't ever again become sleepers! Awakening certainly shall be painful! If in 1991 we had to work illegally, hide and destroy our own traces, we mustn't do the same in 2011. We mustn't forget, we have to remember and record our own history, or someone else will do it for us. Mostly, not good-willed ones. In that history, the names of those who had a vision, courage and ability to organise resistance, should be engraved in gold letters. To stop the terrifying military machinery which was coming from all sides, to break its cogwheels and wheels.
May Allah rahmet and peace is upon all those who laid their lives in that unequal fight. We, who stayed alive, owe them and their associates.
We owe them gratitude, respect and memory.
They say that the war is continuance of politics by other means. In the post war Bosnia and Herzegovina, it was the other way around – those who do not love our country, and whom we were forced to share the first post war governments, viewed the politics as the war continued by other means. Bosnia and Herzegovina did not move from ground zero in 1996. It moved from the minus, from below zero. The burnt villages, destroyed cities, wounded nation, halted economy, yet the hardest and the most difficult problems were the constant obstructions that make our political fight a marathon race run with two lead balls attached to the legs.
Yet, we are fit people, strong. And wise too. Political goals which are set properly get a stronger or weaker, yet constant support from the International Community and our energy and creativity are overpowering those who are stalling the progress. In the past fifteen years out of three armies we have created one, out of three border services, we have created one, out of three Intelligence Agencies, we have created one. We have established over 60 institutions at the state level. The processes are moving slowly, but are moving in the right direction, in the direction that we have paved.
This is why I call for all the patriots for a new enthusiasm, new energy and faith. We need more self-confidence, mutual trust and respect. Agreement and patience. More of the solidarity. Annex VII which Mr. Avdo Hebib had already spoken about, if necessary, will be implemented by us alone. Federation must assist the return of Bosniaks and Croats to RS, here is the engine and the power of the state. An enormous job has been done. Longer, harder and steeper half of the way is behind us. We will prevail, with God's help. We will preserve the unity of the country and build a safe and prosperous society in which every honest man on every single inch of this beautiful country, will feel free and secure.
We will realise the visionary determination set in the Proclamation adopted here, 20 years ago.
The fight we will, with God's blessings, bring to an end by political means. Like in chess, this time, with white figures.
Those are our determinations and plans. Some others perhaps may have different plans, less peaceful. Those plans shall remain but a wish. For, the defenders are still in power, and twenty years is just enough for their sons to grow up. Made out of same material, with the same hearts and determinations.
President Hebib, president Kulosman, dear members of the Patriotic League, the patriots of Bosnia and Herzegovina, I congratulate you your Jubilee – twenty years of courage and decisiveness, twenty years of the Patriotic League!

title: BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović's speech at the 17th Summit of the leaders of the countries of Central and South-eastern Europe on the subject of „Paths towards democracy: exchange of exper
content:
Today's Summit is held in the circumstances of the global political, security and economic challenges to the stability of our societies and states.
Dear Mr. Chairman!
Dear Presidents!
Your Excellencies!
Ladies and Gentlemen!
At the beginning, I wish to thank the organisers and those under whose auspices this significant gathering is held, primarily to our host, President of the Republic of Poland, Mr. Bronislaw Komorowski, for a successful organisation of the Summit.
I am using this occasion to congratulate the representatives of Poland on the process of transition completed and for social transformations in the period to date, as well as on successful overcoming of the ongoing global and economic financial crisis.
Today's Summit is held in the circumstances of the global political, security and economic challenges to the stability of our societies and states. There are two major processes that we have been exposed to during last years and months: the one is the global and economic financial crisis that has been shaking markets of our states, brings in instability to the economic system leaving numerous negative consequences to our economic development, sustainability of employment, level of investments and possibility of social care of the population. Second is political turmoil and conflicts in the close European neighbourhood, in the Arabic world and in Africa.
Sixteen years after the war and the peace establishment in Bosnia and Herzegovina, it has built institutions and has made significant improvement in the stabilisation of democracy. There have been six democratic elections in the country since then, which were marked with the highest grades by all relevant international factors. Even though it may look, to some external observers, that in BiH the elections give the same results and actors, after the elections in BiH, government has been changed in democratic and peaceful way in accordance with high electoral standards. Through determination to follow the European values, we have made huge steps towards peaceful. democratic, post-conflict society. Yet, BiH is still divided and unstable state.
On 15 September each year, on the International Day of Democracy, we can see that the world has stepped into a global democracy. Every day, more and more states are joining the society of democratic states. Democracy is the most commonly used word of our age. It has become a magical word of the epoch. There are many of those declaring themselves as democrats. Many of them call upon democracy even opponents and enemies of democracy do so. According to researches, so called indices of democracy conducted by various international non governmental agencies and analytic centres, BiH has been put in the category of "hybrid democracy", which means that country combines and practices democratic and non democratic forms of governing. Due to the Dayton Peace Agreement and the specific role of High Representative, BiH has been marked as "international protectorate" or "controlled democracy". In the post conflict period, BiH has passed new Laws and Institutions of the quality equal to one of the developed democratic states, as the Law on Freedom of Information, Electoral Law, Institution of Ombudsman and other codices and procedures are. BiH has never longer in its history been a democratic state in the modern sense of the word. The state has mainly been an integral part of various complex state rules without a long democratic transition. In addition to this, the state has never had a period of a long peaceful development that would strengthen its democratic potentials. Practically, the first time the country went on the path of democratic development, at its first general and free elections, at the beginning of the 1990s, it found itself in a bloody war and ethnic collapse.
The paradoxes of the BiH democracy are numerous and have constantly been multiplying instead of diminishing. Bosnia and Herzegovina is a European country at the beginning of the 21st Century, in which High Representative without democratic legitimacy has been imposing Laws arbitrarily, annuls Decisions of the legislative representatives of the people, dismissing elected political representatives of the people and arbitrates in the local political processes of the political subjects.
BiH is a non permanent member of the UN Security Council where it has been deciding on other world issues of the sovereign states, yet it alone is under the international protectorate that limits its sovereignty.
All citizens and political subjects in BiH have been devoted to going towards the EU membership. The EU is not an ideal political community, the EU itself has its own democratic deficits, but it is the best that united peoples and states have created with an aim of securing long lasting peace, economic improvement and social wellbeing. However, twenty years after the fall of the Berlin Wall, in many European circles, there is a wall towards the states of the Western Balkans. Let us not create a new "Iron Curtain" and new Balkan Wall. Europe needs to take responsibility for the integration of BiH and other countries of the Western Balkans into the European Union. With this aim, we have been encourages by last visits of the high officials of the European Union, Mr. Jose Manuel Barroso and Baroness Catherine Ashton, who created space for a stronger integration process of the country towards the EU. On the contrary, the Euro-scepticism could destroy political and social improvement made to date and leave us outside the world's ongoings.
Democracy is as important as development. The visionaries of the global democracy have been of the opinion that the values achieved experiences and knowledge can be inherited, gathered over the generations and passed over to the future generations. So can democracy too. We must not persist on this generation of politicians to take on the role of solving all our misunderstanding immediately and for all times. We must create a stable democratic space for future generations in BiH and in the region in accordance with our situation, possibilities and full responsibility to solve open issues of their time. As we are walking away from the war and move on the path of peace and development, towards the united Europe, our societies will be gaining confidence necessary and security towards predictable future. Bosnia and Herzegovina, on this democratic path of changes must move step by step, through the system of patient solution finding through internal dialogue, compromise and consensus, because only in this way it can win solutions for sustainable and long-term period. No solution that would be extorted and imposed externally, and which would not be democratically accepted will help BiH consolidate its democracy and political system. We should not expect miracles from democracy. Democracy itself cannot solve all the problems of a given society. It is a necessary, yet not a sufficient condition of existence of the progress of a society. Democracy can become its opposite in ethnically divided society and in unstable states, without institutional arrangements for conflict solution. It is very important for citizens to use the opportunities that democracy has to offer. We must bring back the spirit of dialogue, debates, discussions and critical observation of reality, into our society, in order to reach the best solutions.
We are living in the world in which we can stand up to the new security threats only through joint collective actions, for these challenges cannot be overcome by the efforts made by single states. Our joint determination is democratic agreement and decisive political actions against mutual threats and dangers to which democratic states in today's world are exposed to. Therefore, the needs of BiH within this region in the future still remain to be the fight against international terrorism, armament control, protection of human rights and minorities, fight against human trafficking and corruption and all other forms of crime.
Poverty is a huge opponent of democracy. The existence of the wide-spread poverty, especially the extreme poverty on a bigger scale is a threat to the social cohesion and political stability of the states of our region. Many social researchers consider that without reaching certain higher degree of development, no stable and sustainable democracy in our society is possible.
The true question of the future of BiH is: democracy or the protectorate? Our answer is democracy. Yet, the political happenings within and around BiH have not been convincing. Certain representatives of the international community have not learnt anything from the history of the international relations when the matter is of Bosnia and Herzegovina and the Balkans. Instead of breaking from the interventionalism of the great powers which in the past had been conducted by their predecessors, today, some representatives of the international communities are seeking for solutions for BiH outside its institutions, avoiding the legitimately elected representatives and democratic postulates of the society. Without democracy in BiH, there is no sincere dialogue within the state. Where there is no political dialogue, no solution exists. Where there is no solution, there is no progress of a country.
The countries of the Western Balkans are dreaming their European dream. The European Union should reach out to us and embrace us. Otherwise, we shall remain the astonished dream on the outskirts of Europe, exposed to devastating actions of various non-democratic political powers and processes which can bear negative consequences onto the whole of Europe and the World.
Thank you.

title: Address of BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović over Day of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
On today's day, 19 years ago, following the Decree by the Presidency of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, all armed formations, in the entire territory of our homeland, were put under unified command of the Territorial Defence Staff. That decision followed immediately after the international recognition of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina on 6 April by the European Community and 7 April by the United States of America.
Dear veterans of the Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
Dear soldiers, officers and generals,
Dear families of shaheeds and killed combatants
Dear citizens!
I CONGRATULATE YOU DAY OF THE ARMY OF THE REPUBLIC OF BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA
On today's day, 19 years ago, following the Decree by the Presidency of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, all armed formations, in the entire territory of our homeland, were put under unified command of the Territorial Defence Staff. That decision followed immediately after the international recognition of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina on 6 April by the European Community and 7 April by the United States of America. The Army was formed under conditions where there was a powerful military presence of the former Yugoslav National Army, helped by the paramilitary, demonstrating force, harassing and intimidating, and soon after killing, persecuting, looting and observing other kinds of criminal behaviour which caused enormous evil to the population of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
It is for the historical, military and political significance of such Presidential Decree, that 15 April 1992 was chosen as Day of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Our generation, which took part in the establishment, development and military action of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina marks this date each year with pride and dignity.
We will do all necessary to keep this day in memory of the nation so that the future generations of the patriots of the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina can continue the tradition of marking such a significant date.
The emergence and development of the Army of Bosnia and Herzegovina was an act of responsibility, patriotic and political maturity of the then state leadership, members of the Presidency: Nijaz Duraković, Ivo Komšić, Mirko Pejanović, Ejup Ganić, Stjepan Kljujić and Tatjana Ljujić-Mijatović, headed by the President and Supreme Commander of the Presidency Alija Izetbegović. Their decisions, fateful for the state of Bosnia and Herzegovina, responsibly followed political and patriotic determination of its citizens and peoples. It is this harmony of their historically significant decisions and patriotic aspirations that ensured unpresedented mobility, determination, persistence and readiness of the citizens to put in effort and sacrifice with an aim to defend Bosnia and Herzegovina as a social and state community of equal and free peoples of different ethnicity and religions.
The Army, together with the police of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, boldly stood up to disproportionally stronger armed force of the agressor, under brutally unfavourable conditions of shamful arms embargo and strategic encirclement, with defence forces completely separated from the sources of supply for war, life and humanitarian needs. In that sense, the history of wars does not account for a case where a state had to defend itself under such complex conditions as Bosnia and Herzegovina faced. Additionally, there is no similar example in the history of war where the moral and patriotic connection of the people, army and state leadership was so strong as was in Bosnia and Herzegovina from 1992 to 1995.
It is for this reason that we are so proud of our Army and behaviour of its members.
Lets remember that time and those people!
Lets keep our pride!
Lets keep our dignity!
We will achieve this only if we fulfill the moral and all other kinds of obligations towards the veteran population, the families of shaheeds, killed combatants, war veterans and civil war victims. And we will achieve this once we fulfill the goals for which we fought and died – when we build a state and society in which every respectable citizen of this country will see a clear and optimistic future for him/herself and his/her children.
As we can see, unfortunately, the situation in Bosnia and Herzegovina is very complex. The blockade of the necessary reforms is causing enormous damage to all citizens and peoples. The threats to the territorial integrity, constitutional order and peace in this region have continued. All those who do this must know that we will defend our homeland, Bosnia and Herzegovina, by all means and at all cost!
We will defend it, first and foremost, with wisdom and benevolence. We have to, not only in words but in action, stand for intra-national trust, because co-habitation of people with different ethnicity and religion in this region does not have an alternative. I call on Bosniaks, Serbs, Croats and all citizens to respect each other and offer neighbourly help, as such behaviour will be good for all of us. And those who are resisting the reforms I advise to stop undermining the prosperous future which the citizens of our homeland are offered with integration into the European Union and NATO.
It is a futile job. The times of disintegrations is forever behind us. People are facing harder living conditions each day. You cannot employ or feed them with irrelevant stories of vulnerability and calls for separations and conflicts. It will only deepen the crisis and further us from the solution, from a better life which each citizen of this country finally deserves.
Good tendencies, democracy, reconciliation and unification must override the tendency of stagnation and disintegration that is threatening to all. Let's be optimistic and turn towards the future. Let’s rationally interpret the interests of the peoples and citizens of this country. And let's start in the right direction.
Finally, once more, I congratulate the 15 April, Day of the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina to all patriots of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Thank you.
Zenica, 15 April 2011

title: Keynote address by His Excellency Bakir Izetbegović, Member of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, at the Sarajevo Business Forum
content:
It is a distinct pleasure to welcome you to Bosnia and Herzegovina and to this year's Sarajevo Business Forum. We are proud to host this unique event that connects investors, businesses, and governments from all over the world around a common goal of creating public and private prosperity. With over 14 billion Euros of investment projects in diverse sectors of the economy, the Sarajevo Business Forum offers many opportunities from which investors can profit...
Excellencies,
Honorable Guests,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
It is a distinct pleasure to welcome you to Bosnia and Herzegovina and to this year's Sarajevo Business Forum.
We are proud to host this unique event that connects investors, businesses, and governments from all over the world around a common goal of creating public and private prosperity.
With over 14 billion Euros of investment projects in diverse sectors of the economy, the Sarajevo Business Forum offers many opportunities from which investors can profit, while – at the same time - creating jobs and economic growth.
This year, the Forum also aims to open a new chapter of mutually beneficial economic cooperation in our region. Improving relations with countries in the region is our top foreign policy priority, and one of the best ways to accomplish this goal is by intensifying economic cooperation.
And I am particularly pleased that this year’s Forum will feature the Education initiatives. These initiatives promise to lay the foundations for a knowledge-based economy that we need in order to keep pace with the accelerating changes in the global economy.
So, I would like to congratulate the management and the employees of the Bosna Bank International for organizing this event. They have worked very hard to put all the pieces together, and they have done a really great job.
It is no accident that the first Sarajevo Business Forum was enthusiastically received, and that it has become an annual event. Besides great potential for development and many investment opportunities it offers, Bosnia is also a natural gateway through which foreign investors and businesses can enter the Southeast European market.
Unfortunately, for many of those investors and businesses the stability and security of my country is often still overshadowed by the war which ended in 1995. Many of them perceive Bosnia as an unstable and risky place, even though we have been at peace for more than 15 years. And this misperception often acts as the main barrier for those who are interested in engaging us in trade and investments. It is my hope that this year's Sarajevo Business Forum will provide you with a more accurate picture of the situation in my country.
Fifteen years ago, Bosnia's starting position was below zero. In 1995, when the war ended, our country was devastated and our economy was at a standstill.
However, through 15 years of dedicated effort, Bosnia has gone a long way. In fact, we have traveled the more difficult half of the journey to becoming a fully prosperous country.
With the generous assistance of many of your governments, we were able to complete the reconstruction process relatively quickly considering the level of devastation.
We started with three ethnic-controlled armies, three border protection services, three tax agencies, three intelligence services.
And we unified all of them into single institutions at the state level. As a matter of fact, we created over 60 of those central government institutions.
We completed wide ranging political, social and economic reforms that have considerably improved the business climate in our country.
We started accession negotiations with the European Union in 2005, and we signed the Stabilization and Association Agreement with the European Union two years ago.
Last year, we were admitted to the NATO Membership Action Plan, and we became a member of the United Nations Security Council.
After a period of successful reconstruction, our GDP continued to grow strongly by about 6 percent annually. Our economy grew 0.9 percent in 2010, which clearly shows that we have overcome the effects of the global recession and are back in a positive zone. We now expect that our economy will grow 3 percent this year.
All of this proves that Bosnia and Herzegovina is irreversibly on the path to becoming a fully prosperous country.
Going forward, we need to focus on three broad priorities – three areas of building:
First, we have to continue to rebuild trust and restore relations among our ethnic groups. The reintegration of our society is a difficult task that can be accomplished only through dialogue and cooperation. And that is why it requires domestic leaders who have the courage to take these steps, and who are ready to listen and understand the other sides.
Second, we need to continue building accountable, effective, and functional institutions at all levels of government – in line with modern standards.
And, third, we have to rapidly build our physical infrastructure in order to enable a faster economic development. Investing in infrastructure is the best way to employ our construction industry – which, in turn, would stimulate many other sectors of our economy to grow. Modern infrastructure increases trade by easing the flow of goods and people. These rising trade activities will accelerate integration by fostering cooperation in Bosnia and in the whole region.
These three processes of building are key to ensuring lasting prosperity for Bosnia. They will reinforce one another and act in synergy to create a positive uplifting spiral of progress.
Unfortunately, the mistaken view that Bosnia is still riddled by instability has meant that foreign investors and businesses remain underrepresented here.
But, such lack of penetration means that those foreign investors and companies who enter our marketplace NOW have a unique opportunity to get in "on the ground floor." The profit they can make is high precisely because the perception of risk is still relatively high.
Bosnia also offers many other distinct benefits, such as:
Excellent geographic location, at the crossroads of the East and the West, the Mediteranian and Continental Europe.
Close proximity to major European business hubs.
Well educated, qualified, and young workforce with knowledge of English and other foreign languages.
We have huge resources that still lie unused and need to be developed, such as water, land, forests, wind, and minerals. Bosnia is especially rich in energy-generating resources and in unpolluted fertile soil that is ideal for organic agriculture.
Our companies have a long and rich tradition of engagement in international trade and business, especially in the Middle East, Northern Africa and Asia. Their considerable expertise and long-standing relations in those countries can be a valuable asset to those foreign companies who choose to partner with them.
The stability of our currency – which is pegged to the Euro - further contributes to a favorable business climate in our country.
A combination of our Central Bank's Currency Board and fiscal discipline has kept the inflation rate the lowest in the region.
The rights of foreign investors in Bosnia are equal to those of domestic investors, and are well protected under our Foreign Investment Law.
Bosnia and Herzegovina signed the Central European Free Trade Agreement with the neighbouring countries. Companies operating in Bosnia further benefit from the preferential trade regime with the European Union. This agreement allows for all goods that fulfill European Union standards to be exported to each of the 27 member states without quantitative restrictions, and free of customs or other duties.
Besides the European Union, Bosnia has preferential export regimes with countries such as Canada, Japan, Russia, Turkey, and the United States.
Over the past few years, we also carried out a number of business reforms which have made doing business in Bosnia easier:
We reduced the corporate income tax rate from 30 percent to 10 percent.
Profit distributions, including dividends, are now tax exempt, and tax losses can be carried forward for five years.
We simplified our labor tax processes, reduced employer contribution rates for social security, and abolished the payroll tax.
We implemented a comprehensive customs reform, creating a new customs law and establishing a new customs administration which has lowered the time needed for trade.
And we also reduced delays in property registration at the land registry offices. Our building permit system was improved by reducing the time to register a new building at the courts and land registry offices.
So, the good news is that Bosnia and Herzegovina is open and ready for business.
Our country offers great opportunities that can be unlocked through partnerships between public institutions and the private sector.
The future potential of these partnerships is limited only by the bounds of our creativity and goodwill.
With that in mind, I wish you all success, and I invite you to enjoy your time here.
Thank you very much.
Sarajevo
6 April 2011

title: Speech of BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović at the First Fair of Municipalities and Towns of Southeast Europe
content:
I wish you a warm welcome to Bosnia and Herzegovina and Sarajevo. I believe this country and this town will remain in good memory for its well known hospitality and warmth. I congratulate you on the realization of the Fair of Municipalities and Towns of Southeast Europe!
Dear friends,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Dear mayors of municipalities of Southeast Europe!
I wish you a warm welcome to Bosnia and Herzegovina and Sarajevo. I believe this country and this town will remain in good memory for its well known hospitality and warmth.
I congratulate you on the realization of the Fair of Municipalities and Towns of Southeast Europe! A fair such as this one is an excellent forum for the exchange of ideas and experiences which can positively affect the development of the environments you operate in.
We are all aware of the fact that it is the local authorities which are the first contact of the state and its citizens. It is the place from which everyday life of a citizen is directly affected on. Based on this experience, perception is formed on the overall quality of the state as a service.
All of our countries, at all government levels, must make every effort necessary to become more efficient and effective services to their citizens. I am convinced that this event will help this process and produce very concrete and useful results.
I am especially pleased that you are gathered here in such a remarkable number for this speaks of your interest in the perfection and greater engagement. I hope that the days of the fair you will spend in an open dialogue, finding the best possible solutions. After all, we all come from the region that faces the same or similar challenges of the transition and reaching of the European standards so we can help each other greatly.
Once again, I bid you a pleasant stay in our country and a successful fair!
All the best!

title: SPEECH BY BiH PRESIDENCY MEMBER BAKIR IZETBEGOVIĆ ON THE OCCASION OF THE INDEPENDENCE DAY OF BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA 1 MARCH 2011
content:
To all citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina, from the bottom of my heart, I wish a Happy Independence Day! I wish you all well, peace, happiness and prosperity.
Your Excellencies, Ladies and Gentlemen, dear guests!
Nineteen years ago, today, the citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina came out to vote in a referendum on self-determination and by a majority vote decided that our beautiful country restores its independence. That day, for the reasons known to us all, citizens stated that the time had come to, after centuries of foreign governance, Bosnia and Herzegovina restores its sovereignty and historically based relevance.
Unfortunately, evil followed such decision. It was a brutal agression agaist our country, its peoples and citizens, against all that generations of Bosnians and Herzegovinians were jointly creating throughout history. Suffering which we went through, but also the resistance we gave in those first years of our restored independence, will forever stay engraved in memory of us here as well as in the memory of the rest of the world.
However, looking into the past has most sense if we are dedicated to a better future. Bosnia and Herzegovina has survived and, thanks God, it has been developing despite all obstacles. It is true that the speed with which the changes for the better are occuring is not satisfactory, but all of us who care for its future must patiently and dilligently continue to work, deliberate to reach agreement and believe in success. Nobody else will do it for us. This is not only our patriotic obligation but also a historical chance. Generations of citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina suffered, wishing for a free, stable and safe country, and we need to do all to accomplish this. Membership to NATO and the European Union will be the best confirmation that we have achieved this.
In this regard, I wish to invite everyone in this country, both those present today and those who are not, to liberate ourselves from the shackles of the Balkan spite and irrationality, from continuing and inhibiting distrust. Lets love our country, secure a better future for our children: together we can ensure peace, safety and stability, and build Bosnia and Herzegovina suitable for all.
To all citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina, from the bottom of my heart, I wish a Happy Independence Day! I wish you all well, peace, happiness and prosperity.

title: Address of BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović held at the Conference of „Parliament for Europe“, on the subject of: “European integrations as a priority goal of BiH foreign policy - suggestion
content:
Foreign Policy of BiH is standing on two strong pillars. These are development of good-neighbourly relations and the EU membership. On this path we have climbed certain steps, as it is the membership to CEFTA, the most important form of regional economic and trade integration.
Mister President,
Your Excellencies,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
It is my pleasure to greet You here on behalf of BiH Presidency.
Foreign Policy of BiH is standing on two strong pillars. These are development of good-neighbourly relations and the EU membership. On this path we have climbed certain steps, as it is the membership to CEFTA, the most important form of regional economic and trade integration. Also, BiH is very close to the World Trade Organisation membership as it is a part of strategic goals, by which it shows clear intentions of taking part in the world trade integrations. In the light of these foreign international processes, there is an internal basic political consensus in BiH.
At this moment, BiH has Potential Candidate Status when it comes to the EU membership. We have agreed relations with the EU through signing the Stabilisation and Association Agreement, which has been respected so far. Unfortunately, BiH is the only country in the region which has not applied for the EU membership yet.
It is known that there is a part of the Agreement which BiH is not meeting, and which relates to creating legislative frame of the State Aid in BiH and to the establishment of the independent operational body to control the State Aid. I believe that an institutional frame for accomplishment of this important task from the Agreement with the EU will be made at soonest.
However, BiH has not yet adjusted its Constitution to European Convention on Human Rights, i.e. the Decision of the Court for Human Rights in the case of Sejdić-Finci. Given that there are concrete suggestions on how to solve this question; I am convinced that, as soon as the new legislative and executional government in BiH is formed, this question will be solved.
The last EU Report on the progress of BiH on the path of the European integrations for the year of 2010 states several levels of this progress in different fields: Significant progress, limited progress, little progress and certain delay. BiH is showing the trend of constant improvement, sometimes slower, but still improvement.
BiH will continue fulfilling obligations with regards to the SAA and adjusting all the fields and sector politics to the standards of the EU.
When it is about the delays, one of the reasons of these should be looked for in the electional campaign and the October elections which, like in any other country, took much of political energy on mutual rivalry of the political forces and internal political questions.
At this moment, non-existence of executive government in BiH after the elections held, takes away precious time which could be used for a significant step forward towards furthering the process of European integrations.
Today, we should ask this question: What should be politics of the EU towards BiH in such phase of our development?
Does the EU have a unified politics and clear strategic vision of what to do with BiH, except the enlargement position? What does formula „More of Europe, Less of the Dayton“of the EU engagement, which was announced by High Representative in BiH, mean? The EU should turn towards the reality, and let go of the metaphors without content, if the statement given by High Representative of the EU is in fact the position of the EU. Announcements by certain powers from the EU on stopping the enlargement process are producing nothing but Euro-skepticism.
The EU has announced that one of these days it is going to deliver a plan of the EU activities in BiH.
It would best for BiH to close the Office of High Representative and abolish the function of the EU representative, and appoint the Head of the EU Delegation in BiH. It is my personal position, and not of BiH Presidency.
The EU politics in BiH cannot be the politics of imposing of a single solution, but the politics of offering the institutional options and searching for the most functional solutions, which meet all European standards applicable.
In this phase of development in BiH, the EU should maintain approach of a negotiator with BiH, and not the arbitrary or dogmatic approach of imposing solutions.
Once, a long time ago, Jean Monnet, one of the architects of the EU, said, „If you have an insoluble problem, enlarge the context “. In other words, the question of BiH position today and its future must be seen in a larger context of the regional stability and European integrations. Only a stable, democratic and sustainable solution for BiH is its integration to the EU as a wider, economically more developed and politically more stable and safer structure. All of the problems in BiH will not be solved in this way, but it is the general frame and political context in which these problems will be solved that will change.
There is a consensus of the relevant political forces in BiH with regards the EU. It is perhaps the most important consensus after the Dayton Peace Agreement on which this country stands. This fact should be respected and used to the maximum, since in BiH there are obstructions of the progress on the path to the EU integrations by certain political centres and forces.
Exaggerated and impossible political demands which are set before the EU from one part of BiH show that those who do that in fact do not wish to join the EU, and so invent and set ultimate demands, and not patiently look for the solutions instead.
Such atmosphere is reflected by the EU and USA as dominant factors of the International politics towards BiH, striving to compel solutions which fit the interests of certain political groups only.
The question of constitutional reforms is increasingly spoken about in public, in frame of which, there is an introduction of the so called European clause, the magic wand which will solve all of our problems, both internal and those on the European path. It is again that the European path is dangerously mystified by various partial interests of certain political forces as well as questionable interests and goals.
Sluggishness of the enlargement of the Western Balkans leaves space for the Western Balkans to be influenced by other various great and regional centres of political power, of which interests, plans and goals we do not know anything about.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Based on all that has been said, I wish to remind ourselves of the words of the European idea visionary, „Depending on the circumstances, related to its creation, Europe will be more less complete. Will it ever be complete? Nobody can say. This is not a reason to delay the effort to reach the unity. Action is better than resignation, and the wish for perfection is a pathetic excuse not to do anything“.
I will conclude in two sentences. There will be as much of the EU in BiH as of our work on it, and not waiting for the solutions. The EU will be complete, if there is more action by the EU itself towards fulfilling its geographical regions.
Thank You.

title: BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović's speech at the Summit of Heads of OSCE States in Kazakhstan 1st and 2nd December 2010
content:
It is a great pleasure to address the Summit at the highest level of OSCE states. It is the fact that 11 years have passed since the last Summit of OSCE at the highest level, which speaks of the importance of our gathering today. This means that we have come to the point that requires strategic vision and decisive collective action for the future of our organisation, the security of the region and the whole world.
Presidents,
Mr Chairman,
Excellencies,
Ladies and gentlemen!
It is a great pleasure to address the Summit at the highest level of OSCE states. It is the fact that 11 years have passed since the last Summit of OSCE at the highest level, which speaks of the importance of our gathering today. This means that we have come to the point that requires strategic vision and decisive collective action for the future of our organisation, the security of the region and the whole world. Allow me to inform you of the development of political situation in BiH and the progress made in the past period, to which BiH membership to OSCE contributes.
BiH represents a positive example of OSCE in the region, action of the international community in peace building, post-war transition and democratic reconstruction of safe environment and international trust in a multi-ethnic and complex country.
A month ago, BiH successfully organised and conducted its 6th elections since the war which OSCE mission and other international organisations marked with highest grades. The last elections are a sign of the readiness of the state and citizens to continue on the path of democratic progress towards a safe and stable political order and economically sustainable community.
This year has marked 15 years since the end of the war in BiH and signing of the Dayton Peace Agreement. Through general framework agreement for peace in BiH a special role was given to the Organisation for Security and Co-operation in Europe as one of the organisations involved in securing the lasting peace and post-conflict recovery of the country. Today, fifteen years later, we can say with pleasure that we have succeeded in accomplishing major aims and intentions of the Dayton Peace Agreement creators and fulfilled hopes and aspirations of peoples and citizens of BiH. Dayton Peace Agreement represents, in the newer world history, an example which has been successfully implemented and which gives hope for the future. Special contribution was given by OSCE in BiH in the field of democratisation, human rights protection, education and creation of safe environment and co-operation. This is an opportunity to thank OSCE for the contribution in post-war reconstruction and stabilisation of political circumstances in BiH.
Through joint effort of the international community and national authorities, BiH has implemented a majority of elements of Dayton Peace Agreement, launched and finished other reforms in different fields within the framework of social transformation and economical transition.
The ongoing reforms and changes represent fulfilment of accession criteria for lodging an application for becoming an EU candidate state, the closure of the Office of High Representative and its eventual transformation. Besides this, another political process has been started and parliamentary procedures have been launched to adjust BiH Constitution to European Convention of Human Rights and implementation of the Decision of the European Court for Human Rights in Strasbourg.
As a result of positive political developments and security conditions in BiH, both NATO and EUFOR have reduced their forces in BiH and redefined their engagement. BiH is the best example of values and effectiveness of the integral concept of OSCE at all three of its dimensions: political-military, economic and humanitarian.
Today, all countries of the Western Balkans are at the certain level of progress towards the European Union. At this moment, BiH is behind its neighbours, but with good chances to accelerate these processes.
All changes in BiH in the future must be based on the rule of law, further building of inter-ethnic trust and reconciliation that would reduce inter-ethnic tensions and secure lasting peace and sustainable economic development.
Ladies and gentlemen!
We live in the world in which new security threats can be confronted through mutual collective actions that cannot be overcome with the efforts of individual states alone. The goal of our countries and OSCE as a whole is prevention against mutual threats and dangers, as well as building of overall and lasting security for all. Priority of BiH needs within OSCE in the future remain to be fight against terrorism, weapon control, human rights and minority protection as well as fight against human trafficking, corruption and all forms of crime.
All efforts aiming to raise degree of efficiency and the work of the OSCE and strengthen its affirmation and promotion within the spectrum of international associations that contribute to peace, development and security in own regions and the world represent our strategic interest.
The OSCE, with its 56 member states, represents wide enough forums for expression and protection of direct interests of BiH, as its equal member, which on the basis of equality takes part in the dialogue on European security and co-operation.
In the framework of the OSCE, every country remains active, based on its own interest, which brings a number of advantages in political and diplomatic representation and enables solution of its own and mutual open questions with other countries.
For this reason, it is needed in the future to firmly keep already confirmed capacity of OSCE as an international organisation with a dominant form of co-operation at interstate level.
As a country that is located in a still unstable region of the Western Balkans, BiH recognises and supports OSCE as a forum and organisation with original mandate for an early prevention of all conflicts. BiH is ready to actively contribute towards early conflict prevention and neutralisation of situations that can cause conflicts in the OSCE region, as much for its own institutional form and readiness, as for the experience deriving from the times of tragic conflict in our country. Faced with the consequences of the tragic conflict in the region of former Yugoslavia, we consider it to be our obligation to actively participate in and support OSCE activities for early conflict prevention or solving situations that can lead to conflict at any phase.
Ladies and gentlemen!
I expect that this highest OSCE Summit opens new space for long-term co-operation of the member countries and brings new important decisions to enable such co-operation. BiH supports common initiatives of the member states aiming at building a high level of trust in Europe, strengthening of security, specifying new procedures in work and greater level of transparency of the work of the organisation.
Thank you.

title: BiH Presidency Member Željko Komšić attended celebration of 5th Anniversary of BiH Armed Forces
content:
It is a great pleasure to address you on behalf of BiH Presidency as Supreme Commander, and in my own name on the 5th Anniversary of BiH Armed Forces. First of December, the Armed Forces Day, is the day of remembrance of those who invested a lot of knowledge, work, effort and expertise in the process of establishing BiH Armed Forces.
On the occasion of celebrating the BiH Armed Forces Day that was held at Rajlovac Base in Sarajevo, BiH Presidency Member Željko Komšić held speech that we publish in full.
“Respected Excellencies, colleague Izetbegović, Generals, Officers, NCOs, Soldiers, Dear guests…
It is a great pleasure to address you on behalf of BiH Presidency as Supreme Commander, and in my own name on the 5th Anniversary of BiH Armed Forces.
First of December, the Armed Forces Day, is the day of remembrance of those who invested a lot of knowledge, work, effort and expertise in the process of establishing BiH Armed Forces.
We are witnesses on daily basis how forming of united Armed Forces was a significant reform step and a move forward for Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Advancement of reforms in the field of defence, where we have gone the furthest, is a strong and positive message to all in Bosnia and Herzegovina. If this could have happened in the field of defence and security, i.e. exactly where the most difficult progress was expected after the events of war, then we can be optimists with every right and hope for the improvement in other fields and segments of BiH society.
There is a wide consensus in Bosnia and Herzegovina related to NATO and EU membership. Sporadic negative positions related to BiH membership in Euro-Atlantic integrations, are mainly with the purpose of internal and daily-political party interests.
The process of establishing and the reform of BiH Armed Forces is an example of a successful reform in our society which gives us the right to be confident that this will continue, but we must not forget that this was a very complex process that required plenty of optimism, vision, decisiveness and patience.
After the approval of NATO MAP for our country, there is open sphere of additional reforms and obligations in reaching the NATO standards, which will bring us to full membership to NATO. I am sure that whatever is asked from us, we can and will complete.
I hope that very soon, at one of the future ceremonies on the occasion of BiH Armed Forces Day, I shall address you as the members of BiH Armed Forces that are full members of NATO.
I must point out and highlight that BiH Armed Forces, within the framework of its capabilities, give its contribution through engagement in allied activities of peace support and stability in the regions of crises around the world.
Because of all that we have done, today, on the Day of Armed Forces, I give credit to all members of BiH Armed Forces, who are active participants in the process of reforms. I am sure that BiH Ministry of Defence and BiH Armed Forces, on the basis of democratic principles of openness and co-operation will give its contribution and do everything necessary for Bosnia and Herzegovina to become equal member of democratic family of European countries.
Ladies and gentlemen, once again, on behalf of BiH Presidency, and in my own name, I wish all members of BiH Armed Forces and their families all of the happiness and a lot of success in the future work and life.
Thank you”.
CABINET OF BiH PRESIDENCY MEMBER ŽELJKO KOMŠIĆ

title: BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović speech on the occasion of the BiH Armed Forces Day at the Formal Academy
content:
It is a great pleasure to congratulate the BiH Armed Forces Day to the members of Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina and citizens of our country. It is the Armed Forces that show and prove, how, through agreement and cooperation great things for this country and its citizens can be achieved.
Your Excellencies,
Generals, Officers, NCOs, soldiers,
Ladies and gentlemen!
It is a great pleasure to congratulate the BiH Armed Forces Day to the members of Armed Forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina and citizens of our country.
It is the Armed Forces that show and prove, how, through agreement and cooperation great things for this country and its citizens can be achieved. Military, by nature, but also by its Constitutional position, is one of the key institutions guaranteeing peace and stability in every country. Because of this, today in Bosnia and Herzegovina, based on the experience of BiH Armed Forces, we may confirm that in this country, great capacity and readiness for mutual work to benefit of all citizens regardless of their national and political, or any other belonging can be made.
Only five years after establishing the BiH Armed Forces, through diligent work and devotion of its members, from generals to soldiers, this institution has become a reliable partner on the international level through engagement in peace-keeping operations in several regions of crises around the world. For such an engagement, never has any complaint been sent to the address of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Praises and high grades for the job our officers and soldiers have been doing, have been the only reactions in the period so far. Thanks to the hard work and readiness to achieve top results, Bosnia and Herzegovina is at a doorstep of membership to the most powerful military Association in the world; NATO. You may be sure that only the most prepared military organisations become members of this Association. NATO MAP approvement for our country is such a recognition.
However, in order to make another huge step towards NATO membership, Bosnia and Herzegovina must fulfill clearly set out condition, which is registering 69 military locations to be property of the state, i.e. Ministry of Defence of BiH. Responsibility to fulfill this condition lies on those creating political environment in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The Armed Forces in BiH have completed their part. It is upon us, from BiH Presidency as the Supreme Commander, to all those in a decision-making process sharing the burden of responsibility, to enable fulfilling of this condition.
Ladies and gentlemen,
Let us use the positive example that we have with the BiH Armed Forces to launch all other processes in Bosnia and Herzegovina in the right direction. And that is membership in the European Union and NATO, i.e. secure and stable future for the generations to come.
Thank you.

title: Speech of BiH Presidency Member Željko Komšić on the occasion of 25 November, Statehood Day of BiH
content:
We are here tonight to remember and celebrate the event of 67 years ago. To remember the event that marked the turn in history of BiH and which placed the foundations that BiH of today lies on. ZAVNOBiH is an event and a historical fact, importance of which we understand more and more as the time passes.
Councilors of ZAVNOBiH, Excellencies, Comrades, Ladies and gentlemen, Dear friends, Appreciated Invitees, Respected Citizens!
We are here tonight to remember and celebrate the event of 67 years ago. To remember the event that marked the turn in history of BiH and which placed the foundations that BiH of today lies on.
ZAVNOBiH is an event and a historical fact, importance of which we understand more and more as the time passes.
I shall remind you that during the meeting with the leaders of BiH People’s Liberation Movement, Rodoljub Čolaković and Avdo Humo, near Kladanj in July of 1943, Josip Broz Tito encouraged and initiated this first conference of ZAVNOBIH. His position then was, and so it was later on, that BiH should be an equal unit within the future state community which, to be honest, was not what many had wished then.
On that 25 November 1943, for the first time in history, representatives of all its peoples met for the first time and brought political decision that would suit their mutual interest.
They had enough strength, knowledge, wisdom to meet at the time of the highest culmination of, up to that time, the worst clashes and suffering, crime and unprecedented inter-ethnic hatred.
They showed then that the only overall national interests were the fight against fascism, fight for the equality of all of its peoples and citizens, and fight for Bosnia and Herzegovina. The importance of ZAVNOBiH is seen in the fact that, even today, every single sane human being would, without thinking, sign for these aims. Besides, let us not forget that, not so long ago, we fought in arms for the same aims.
Respected friends…
We, as a society, but also as individuals, must have the strength to face the truth of the past; we must have a wish and will to learn from the past. I think this gathering of ours today can serve to this cause.
We must not forget that after WWII, in the newly formed state community, all federal units had gained status on the basis of national criteria.
The only exception was BiH, which gained its federal status within Yugoslav community, on the basis of the fact that it had been a community of all its peoples that had lived in it for Centuries, but not on the basis of national criteria.
It may be a bit unusual, but it is true that today, in the age of computers, Internet, mobile phones, digital and cable TV, postulates of ZAVNOBiH sound current.
If we take a closer look, today, every single human being in this country needs for life and as a human being, all that was proclaimed 67 years ago, i.e. one of the ‘sacred rules’ of ZAVNOBiH, which is that every citizen of Bosnia and Herzegovina is equal in his/her rights, way of life, regardless of which part of Bosnia and Herzegovina he or she lives in, regardless which people he or she belongs to, regardless whether he or she belongs to ‘majority or minority’, that every single piece of Bosnia and Herzegovina belongs to its every citizen.
Today, the followers of defeated ideologies and individuals claim that the certain parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina, are exclusively Serb, Croat or Bosniak. They see it in the way they actually want to see it, exclusively tailored to their wishes, not taking into account others and the different ones.
Honestly speaking, these occurrences are more or less spread throughout BiH and it must stop and change in any possible way. It is our mutual disgrace, in a way, yet only through honest acceptation for the necessity to change this, we shall be able to change ourselves and be better.
Not the single people alone in Bosnia and Herzegovina has spare homeland. Not anybody has exclusive right to BiH, or any part of it.
I say this because it would be easier for all of us and simpler to accept or at least understand this.
Dear friends...
We do not have right to waste time and money of the citizens of this country any more through endless quasi-political demagogic discussions, the only aim of which is rising tensions and causing fear.
Our destiny and the primary aim is to become NATO member and the European Union state and there is no other way for us. How long it will take for us to achieve this depends on us alone. The sooner the better for all of us. NATO and the EU primarily mean new obligations, new way of thinking, new way of behaving, and we can do it.
We must all be clear with the fact that nobody, apart from ourselves alone, can arrange relations among us. For this we need honesty, trust and mutual respect.
There is an obligation upon this generation to pave the way for the future generations towards free, democratic Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bosnia and Herzegovina of prosperity and NATO and the EU state.
With the wish to persist in building and strengthening our homeland, as a country of wellbeing and safety, and the overall good, I want, once again, to sincerely congratulate the Statehood Day to all of you.
Thank you and Cheers!

title: BiH Presidency Member Bakir Izetbegović address on the occasion of 25th November, Statehood Day of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
Thank you for answering the invitation to come and celebrate one of the most important dates in the history of our country. Sixty-seven years ago, in a small Bosnian and Herzegovinian town of Mrkonjić Grad, i.e. Varcar-Vakuf, historical and legal continuation of Bosnia and Herzegovina was confirmed. The foundations of the Statehood of this country were also confirmed. The idea of togetherness and equality of its all peoples and devotion to determined struggle against fascism, evil and violence were also con
Ladies and gentlemen, dear friends,
Thank you for answering the invitation to come and celebrate one of the most important dates in the history of our country. Sixty-seven years ago, in a small Bosnian and Herzegovinian town of Mrkonjić Grad, i.e. Varcar-Vakuf, historical and legal continuation of Bosnia and Herzegovina was confirmed. The foundations of the Statehood of this country were also confirmed. The idea of togetherness and equality of its all peoples and devotion to determined struggle against fascism, evil and violence were also confirmed. It was the time of WWII, the time of the hardest historical temptations that our country and its people went through.
Fifty-two years later, on the other side of the planet, in the American town of Dayton, in even more difficult historical circumstances for Bosnia and Herzegovina, political leaders of the time showed wisdom and courage and reached the agreement that stopped the war and physically confirmed the principles of ZAVNOBIH. The basis of the Dayton Agreement are state and legal continuation of Bosnia and Herzegovina, equality of its peoples and citizens, strong affirmation of human rights, and opposing to any form of discrimination. The price of peace was paid in the shape of entitiy line that was drawn, yet this Agreement had marked the way to reintegration and strengtheing of the state towards restoration of the multi-ethnic community.
History has, to any reasonable man, been the best teacher of life. In the past Century, it proved that Bosnia and Herzegovina as an idea and a historical and legal fact, is stronger than the power of destruction and desintegration. It has overlived powerful enemies. And every other attempt dividing this country brought only useless suffer to its citizens and yet to those who were trying to divide it.
This is why I call for all those wishing to divide this country and wishing for other misunderstandings and disintegrations to, as our people would say nicely, „okanu corava posla“ (steer from dirty business). Bosnia has only one way and it is the way of agreement and integrations. The European way.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
It is time for this country to move forward in huge steps towards stable and prosperous future under the patronship of Euro-Atlantic associations. This time asks for people who have learnt the lessons from the past and who recognise importance of decisions to be brought. There is an opportunity for us, as it was for those before us, to have political courage and wisdom to create environment of co-operation and agreement to open new better pages of history of this region. It is what we owe to those who laid their lives for this country, but also an obligation to ourselves and to those who will come after us.
Citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina deserve better future.
It is upon all of us to, within the limits of our abilities but also responsibilities, give our contribution to stay remembered as a generation that understood challenges of the time it lived in and which left Bosnia and Herzegovina, safe and as the state of prosperity, a European Union and NATO state for the future generations.
With regards, let me once again congratulate the Statehood Day of Bosnia and Herzegovina and to thank you for having glorified this occasion with your presence on this day.

title: Address of the Chairman of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, Nebojsa Radmanovic, at the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) meeting on Afghanistan, Lisbon, 20 November 2010
content:
Four years ago Bosnia and Herzegovina expressed its readiness to take upon itself the obligations and rights implied by the membership in Euro-Atlantic family of free and democratic countries by joining the Partnership for Peace NATO Program. Authorities of Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as its society as a whole, have taken a thorough and comprehensive approach to implementation of reforms in different fields with the goal of integration of Bosnia and Herzegovina into the Euro-Atlantic structures.
ADDRESS OF THE CHAIRMAN OF THE PRESIDENCY OF BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA, NEBOJSA RADMANOVIC, AT THE NORTH ATLANTIC TREATY ORGANIZATION (NATO) MEETING ON AFGHANISTAN
LISBON, 20 NOVEMBER 2010
NATO Secretary General,
Esteemed Presidents,
Your Excellencies,
Ladies and gentlemen,
Four years ago Bosnia and Herzegovina expressed its readiness to take upon itself the obligations and rights implied by the membership in Euro-Atlantic family of free and democratic countries by joining the Partnership for Peace NATO Program.
Authorities of Bosnia and Herzegovina, as well as its society as a whole, have taken a thorough and comprehensive approach to implementation of reforms in different fields with the goal of integration of Bosnia and Herzegovina into the Euro-Atlantic structures.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is determined to contribute towards global peace and security. Armed and police forces of Bosnia and Herzegovina have in the past participated in the UN peacekeeping operations in Liberia, Sudan, East Timor, Cyprus, Haiti, Congo etc. An EOD unit of the BiH Armed Forces, consisting of 350 soldiers who were members of this unit during several rotations, successfully participated in peacekeeping operations in Iraq and returned to the country with positive experiences.
Bosnia and Herzegovina signed the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF) Agreement and the Financing Agreement with the NATO Secretary General on 11 March 2009. Presidency of BiH adopted on 27 July 2010 a Decision to send 45 members of AFBiH to the International Security Assistance Force mission in Afghanistan, upheld by the House of Representatives at the Parliamentary Assembly of Bosnia and Herzegovina. In October this year first rotation replacement infantry unit was sent to the mission, engaging within the Danish contingent in Helmand province on providing security for immobile military facilities. A year earlier BiH sent 10 officers to the ISAF Mission NATO Command. BiH adopted a Decision to send 10 military police instructors and trainers to Afghanistan. Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina has also adopted a Decision to send 4 officers to ISAF headquarters. In 2010 BiH has donated 60 howitzers to the NATO Trust Fund for Development of Afghan National Security Forces (ANSF).
In its relations with NATO, Bosnia and Herzegovina has so far proved to be a responsible partner, ready to share the burden of security challenges of today.
BiH contribution to the ISAF Mission is substantial, considering that Bosnia and Herzegovina is a small and economically weak country.
