The fact that certain structures of authority, still performing these duties, negate that, tells us that in fact they want to use the position of BiH State and to negate it at the same time.
I remind you that there are still members of the fascist ideologies that do not acknowledge BiH today, just as they didn’t acknowledge it then. Today, as in the World War II, members of these ideologies lay claim on BiH, calling it Serbian, Croatian or of Bosniacs. There are still certain forces that are against Bosnia and Herzegovina, which are trying to equate the credits of antifascists and patriots and members of various criminal traitorous formations. That will not happen.
I would like to reiterate that the conditions for holding ZAVNOBIH were created thanks to BiH antifascists – the partisans, and we should not and will not ever forget it.
Thank you!”
Zenica, 25.11.2006

title: Welcome speech of Zeljko Komsic, Member of BiH Presidency, marking 63rd anniversary of ZAVNOBIH
content:
We are here today to remember and officially pay tribute to this congress which took place 63 years ago; this event was a turning point in the history of Bosnia and Herzegovina and represents foundations of today's BiH.
Welcome speech
of Zeljko Komsic, Member of BiH Presidency,
marking 63rd anniversary of ZAVNOBIH
Sarajevo, 24 November 2006
"Councillors of the National Antifascism Council of National Liberation of BiH (ZAVNOBIH),
Comrades,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Your Excelencies
Dear friends,
Honoured guests,
Respected citizens,
We are here today to remember and officially pay tribute to this congress which took place 63 years ago; this event was a turning point in the history of Bosnia and Herzegovina and represents foundations of today's BiH.
Bosnia and Herzegovina, a country of peoples and citizens that are all equal, is our only homeland, built on centuries' old traditions of cohabitation and tolerance between nations, cultures and religions. BiH antifascists and patriots fought for and defended those values. We must nurture and foster them for our diversities are our wealth and not our shortcoming.
As a member of the BiH Presidency I myself, like most of us in BiH, am proud that a CROAT, JOSIP BROZ, remembered by his alias TITO; at a meeting in July 1943 with the leaders of the National Liberation Movement, Rodoljub Colakovic and Avdo Humo in Kladanj, initiated and convened the first session of the National Antifascism Council for National Liberation of BiH (ZAVNOBIH). His conviction was then and always remained that BiH must be an equal unit within the impending state union.
On November 25th, 1943, for the first time in the history of Bosnia and Herzegovina, representatives of all its peoples gathered and took a political decision which was in their shared interests. This was a historical turning point. Bosnia and Herzegovina was given back to its peoples who only as equals could choose their destiny. This is why 25 November 1943 is one of the most important dates for Bosnia and Herzegovina and its history. It is the day that marks Bosnia and Herzegovina’s return to its true self.
Before then, the destiny of Bosnia and Herzegovina had been decided in the European centres of power; Berlin, Paris, London and Moscow but also in Belgrade and Zagreb, without listening to the voice of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Dear friends,
As its name states, ZAVNOBIH was the assembly of the Council of Bosnia and Herzegovina’s antifascists from all its peoples. It is a fact that the leaders of the Antifascist movement were Communists. At the same time, however the majority of these antifascists and patriots were not members of the Communist Party of Yugoslavia.
Equating antifascism and communism is a blatant political and historical error which sometimes turns into a naive attempt to blame antifascism for the mistakes, abuses and failures of Communism. It is an attempt to diminish the importance of antifascism and call into question its universal character. Antifascism is a movement much larger than Communism. Communist movement was simply part of the Antifascist movement.
So, antifascism is not the same as communism, and even less like bolshevism. But in our case, let me reiterate it, the communists were leaders of the antifascist movement and this is a historical fact. If anyone because of Communism
wants to negate or erase antifascism from the history of Bosnia and Herzegovina, then he is not on our side.
I would like to remind you that there are still followers of fascistic ideologies who neither then nor now recognise Bosnia and Herzegovina. As in the Second World War, the followers of such ideologies claim Bosnia and Herzegovina to be Serb, Croat or Bosniak. There are still forces that are against Bosnia and Herzegovina and they attempt to equate the achievements of the antifascists and patriots with acts by followers of various criminal traitorous formations. This is unacceptable.
ZAVNOBIH is a milestone of contemporary, modern statehood and a model that shows how Bosniaks, Serbs, Croats and other peoples in BiH, can live together. We must not forget that after the Second World War, all federal units obtained their status in the newly formed state union based on national criteria.
The only exception was Bosnia and Herzegovina which did not acquire its federal status inside Yugoslav union according to national criteria but as a historical community of peoples who for centuries had lived together.
BiH antifascists and patriots fought for and defended those values more than sixty years ago. They defeated followers of fascistic traitorous ideologies. So will we, now and in the future.
Principles determined in ZAVNOBIH have a long lasting historical value and by respecting those principles Bosnia and Herzegovina can integrate into Euro-Atlantic structures. This was an event which not only confirmed the continuity of Bosnia and Herzegovina's statehood but also its multi-national character.
With regard to an appropriate way of marking the Statehood Day; that is, disregarding it in some parts of Bosnia and Herzegovina, I would like to underline the following:
I consider the day of signature of the Dayton Peace Agreement as an important date in the recent history of Bosnia and Herzegovina, which should be marked in a dignified way, but the twenty-fifth November – the day when ZAVNOBiH took place and when key decisions were taken – I personally consider it to be undisputedly and unreservedly the only Day of Bosnia and Herzegovina's statehood.
Nobody should ever forget the hundreds of thousands of antifascists and patriots from all peoples in Bosnia and Herzegovina who more than six decades ago heroically gave their lives, fighting and defending the principles of ZAVNOBiH and Bosnia and Herzegovina. Having in mind the enormous and inconceivable number of victims, I consider any attempts to diminish and deny the importance of ZAVNOBiH as anti-civilisational and unacceptable.
Especially, I do not accept some quasi-intellectual discussions and polemics on the importance of ZAVNOBIH and its heritage and even less so for some day-to-day political interests and unprincipled petty politics.
As we live in the same country, and as we are the citizens of the same country, the minimum of civilised behaviour and conduct should allow this day to be a common public holiday of all its citizens.
It is possible to discuss and debate whether it is the twenty-fifth November, or some other date. I do hope that very soon, all Bosnians and Herzegovinians will have at least one common holiday and celebrate accordingly. It is high time that people stopped saying that Bosnia starts where logic ends.
Dear Citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina
After all adversities, enormous hardship and suffering which befell us in the recent past, it is up to this generation to pave the way to a common future. It will not be easy. We have to confront every evil and look to the good. Free, democratic and prosperous Bosnia and Herzegovina is our wish and reality. It is the firm interest and a necessity for all its citizens.
Without respect for each other, any kind of prosperous Bosnia and Herzegovina is unthinkable. Simply saying, no one people can exist without others in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
After all I have said; I would like to emphasise that nobody but ourselves can normalise our relations.
We, as a society, and also as individuals, must have the strength to face the truth of the past; we must wish and be willing to learn from our past and to acknowledge it. I think that our gathering today might serve this purpose.
Finally, we have gathered here to underline that today's Bosnia and Herzegovina must find the strength for courageous steps forward and bold moves, when its fundamental commitments and its future are at stake.
The future of Bosnia and Herzegovina is in a community of equal peoples, a society of equal citizens where differences are our richness and where no one has more or less rights than the others.
Without facing the truth about our past there will be no future. BiH antifascists and patriots fought for the principles of ZAVNOBiH and for our future more than six decade ago. We are fighting today for the truth about them and their battles in order to give them the place they have earned in our history, and ensure for all of us a happier future.
Thank you"

title: The address by Željko Komšić, the BiH Presidency Member, at the Ninth regional association conference on missing person from the territory of former Yugoslavia
content:
The truth must be known, and the past must not be suppressed, especially not forged. Every attempt of distorting the truth is beforehand condemned to failure and everyone of us must face the truth about ourselves, and only then about the others.
A greeting speech
by Željko Komšić, the BiH Presidency Member
at the Ninth regional association conference on missing person from
the territory of former Yugoslavia
Brčko, 24.11.2006
“It is very difficult for me to talk at these gatherings, where you can practically feel all our individual tragedies in the air.
The amount of the suffered evil is such that any kind of revenge would represent only a small compensation for what you had gone trough. The only thing that gives strength and evokes spiritual peace to us all is something called JUSTICE AND DESERVED PUNISHMENT.
Regardless of how slow it may be, only justice, at least for a bit, can restore our faith in life and future. Although indifferent and satisfied with the crimes that they have committed out of inexplicable, animal impulses, only justice and deserved punishment is what the criminals of all kinds and profiles makes restless and agitated, because they know that somewhere, someday, they will get their deserved punishment.
The truth must be known, and the past must not be suppressed, especially not forged. Every attempt of distorting the truth is beforehand condemned to failure and everyone of us must face the truth about ourselves, and only then about the others.
As I have mentioned earlier on several occasions, I will continue to fight and I will not hesitate or get tired trying to help in clearing up the destiny of those still considered missing across BiH – on all sides.
Tens of thousands of misfortunate families across BiH must finally find their peace. Finally, they must be able to light the candle and pray for their dearest in a dignified and human manner.
This country must finally stop being a country of missing persons and a land of hidden and dislocated mass graves! Criminals of all kinds and profiles will not walk freely and enjoy the benefits of their crimes in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Justice and punishment are only two words that can follow what has been the worst crime in Europe since the World War II. For me, everything else is unacceptable, at the cost of life.
Against evil and villains, for justice and punishment of evil, I have fought all my life. I promise you that I will consistently do it in the future as well, together with all of you. Finally, I am just one of you.
Thank you.”

title: Speech by BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović at the ceremony on occasion of celebrating the 11th anniversary of the Dayton Peace Agreement
content:
As much as it has been criticized for creating new administrative divisions, untypical constitutional solutions, slowing down the decision-making processes and similar, all that will always be considerably less than what it has brought: peace, freedom of movement, democratic development possibility, trust reconciliation and prospects for the future. Those that blame the Dayton Agreement for all our current difficulties today seem to forget that it has created an opportunity to tackle them together at all
S P E E C H
by BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović
at the ceremony on occasion of celebrating
the 11th anniversary of the Dayton Peace Agreement
“Your Excellencies,
Esteemed guests,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
It is my pleasure to greet you in the name of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Celebrating the eleventh anniversary of signing the Dayton Peace Agreement is an opportunity not only to sum up the results we have achieved since the end of the tragic conflict in these areas, but also to turn to the plans for the future of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Although the reason is of festive nature, it is no time for celebrations and festivities; not because we do not know how to be joyous or because we do not have a reason for celebration, but because there is a lot before us to be done.
From where we stand now, the Dayton Peace Framework Agreement in Bosnia and Herzegovina was a great success. Today, it is absolutely clear that the recent history of Bosnia and Herzegovina will be divided into times before and after Dayton. Our awareness of it will become clearer as we become more and more distant from it. As much as it has been criticized for creating new administrative divisions, untypical constitutional solutions, slowing down the decision-making processes and similar, all that will always be considerably less than what it has brought: peace, freedom of movement, democratic development possibility, trust reconciliation and prospects for the future. Those that blame the Dayton Agreement for all our current difficulties today seem to forget that it has created an opportunity to tackle them together at all.
Our efforts in the future must be pointed in the direction of relation development between peoples and citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina that would stimulate a new optimism and trust in the European future. Everyone is invited and welcomed to join that path. No one is freed from an obligation and responsibility to act in general course of our European future. If every man in Bosnia and Herzegovina does everything he can, if all of us do our best, this country will walk more courageously and more decisively toward development and progress.
We have worked hard in the previous period, but there are plenty of unfulfilled tasks and goals that needed to be achieved. For conducted reforms in the area of defence, armed forces and security, administration of justice and state administration, economic changes, creation of unified economic space, fiscal politics, achieved progress in cooperation with The Hague and so forth, we rightfully expect to be rewarded with an entry in the Partnership for peace program, understanding for our position for joining CEFTA, visa regime facilitation for our citizens and with other benefits of the international community.
Upcoming transformation of the Office of the High Representative into the Office of the Special Representative of the European Union, regardless of what the outcome might be, is a confirmation that Bosnia and Herzegovina has done a significant progress in the reform processes and that the time has come that the domestic politicians are to take over the responsibility for leading the country, Bosnia and Herzegovina is moving with giant steps toward the European and Euro-Atlantic integrations. On that road, we need to turn our differences into our advantage and point all our energy and knowledge at revitalisation of destroyed economy and dealing with social matters. In order to achieve it, we will still need an unselfish help from the international community.
However, we mustn’t delude ourselves that we have completed everything. We mustn’t shut our eyes before the evermore spread poverty, growing intolerance, and denied national equality of our peoples.
We must return dignity to the intransient virtues and values of life, such as personal integrity, living on one’s work, belief in oneself and one’s aptitudes, affirmation of capable not suitable, equal possibilities for all people, solidarity for the weak and frail, etc.
Upcoming changes before Bosnia and Herzegovina need to be a result of democratic agreement and cooperation between the elected political representatives of all constituent peoples and citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina, not imposition of any kind. All changes should aim at stability, equality and democratic and economic development and a general progress of country toward the European future.
I don’t see a better guiding principle to be a road sign for our path to future then a famous Hindu leader and a thinker Mahatma Ghandi:
“Be a change you desire to see.”
We will certainly succeed.
Thank you.”

title: The BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović’s speech at the third Regional Economic Forum for South East Europe, held in Miločer, November 15
content:
It is crucial for our European future to exchange experiences and encourage cooperation in all areas of importance to our citizens as well as mutually good relations trough these or similar gatherings
S P E E C H
by the BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović
at the third Regional Economic Forum for South East Europe
Miločer - Montenegro, November 15-16, 2006
“Dear presidents,
Excellencies,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
It is my great pleasure to greet you and at the same time, to thank the organizer for inviting me to participate in this Forum’s work. It is crucial for our European future to exchange experiences and encourage cooperation in all areas of importance to our citizens as well as mutually good relations trough these or similar gatherings. That is in our interest.
Our goal is certainly to achieve continuity of economic growth and a better life of citizens, while simultaneously accepting and achieving the European standards. There can be no successful development without competitive economy. We are aware that there can be no increase in competitiveness without quality macroeconomic environment, efficient institutions, developed infrastructure, latest technologies, quality microeconomic environment, clear strategy for developing economy and enterprises.
Building competitive economy represents a difficult and complex process that requires constant work, which is confirmed by experiences of developed and successful transitional countries. The today’s presentation shows where we are in the overall competitiveness. Every country’s position can be evaluated by comparing it with other.
I am pleased that Slovenia and Croatia have high rankings in competitiveness. That is a challenge for us, as well as a hope that by following their experiences we would ensure a better position of our economies in the world competitiveness.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is lagging behind its neighbours, especially the developed ones. The reasons for that greatly lie in the past war events, which left marks on its economy and population. I must also use this opportunity to stress out the great support of the international community in reconstruction of infrastructure. Strong investment activity, financed by donations, has contributed to the high post-war GDP real growth rate. What encourages us is the fact that economic growth was also continued after the foreign help was reduced. Parallel to the reconstruction, major reforms of the entire system commenced. Achieved reform results so far are unbalanced in respective sector.
Allow me to turn to some segments of economy, which competitiveness depends upon.
Bosnia and Herzegovina was a success in achieving macroeconomic stability. Inflation was reduced to that of the developed country. Domestic currency – Convertible Mark is stable, with the constant growth of foreign exchange reserves. The fiscal budget balance has been established , thanks to successful tax reforms, and especially thanks to the introduction of value added tax. Fiscal discipline has been intensified due to establishment of Treasury and the budgetary management audit office, so Bosnia and Herzegovina managed to develop a competitive banking sector, including the regulatory and supervisory bodies. Thanks to these reforms, we have established macroeconomic stability, and due to this component, Bosnia and Herzegovina is now highly ranked.
Bosnia and Herzegovina requires faster and a more decisive work in building and strengthening efficient public institutions capable of ensuring greater security, rule of law, respect for agreements, and for stamping out corruption and crime. Previous governments did not pay enough attention to this matter. The position I have recently been appointed to and the party I belong to, will attach special significance, trough system institutions, to building efficient institutions, because we are aware that without good institutional environment that fuels entrepreneurship and competitiveness, there can be no economic growth and development.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is significantly lagging behind in building necessary infrastructure for the European integration and joining the global market. Therefore, we are not surprised by the huge efforts put in by European Union in investing infrastructure in order to ensure relatively equal conditions for development of all regions. The road infrastructure of Bosnia and Herzegovina has become a critical factor for quicker inclusion of BiH economy in the world economy. We will put in efforts to fix the situation in the field of infrastructure using concessions and joint ventures. I use the opportunity to express our readiness to build main road routes, trough joint ventures that would contribute to a quicker development of the entire region.
Due to the insufficient investment activities on the part of domestic sources and a modest influx of direct foreign investments, Bosnia and Herzegovina is technologically lagging behind the world. Realistically, we expect a more significant influx of foreign investments in the following period: due to the privatisation of Telecom, oil industry and envisaged investment in the electric power sector. That will contribute to a further economic development, export increase, modern technology introduction and ensuring new jobs. I am pleased that the neighbouring countries have shown interest in investing in the electric power sector.
To ensure competitiveness, reforms at the microeconomic level are equally important because the wealth is created at that level – i.e. it lies in the competence of the enterprises to produce valuable goods and services efficiently.
We will strive elaborately and systematically to enhance competitiveness in order to ensure a more quality life for our citizens. I am convinced that our economies would become more and more competitive, which would open doors to become recognised by our export, not just import, by production, not just consumption. We can achieve this trough reforms, with a further support from the international community and its financial institutions. I am convinced that we possess enough strength and opportunities to do that.
Thank you!”

title: The BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović’s speech at the 14th session of the Igman Inititative
content:
I am certain that this topic “Cooperation leads to European values” can and should be discussed from different angles, comprehensively and that this session will be an initiator of many important debates to come that would offer quality solutions
S P E E C H
by the BiH Presidency Chairman Nebojša Radmanović
at the 14th session of the Igman Inititative
Miločer – Montenegro, November 16, 2006
“Gentlemen Presidents,
Excellencies,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
It is my pleasure today to greet the participants of the Igman Initiative session, which in contrast to the previous sessions, is being held in quadrangle, and especially because we are discussing the European perspective of our countries and the European values.
The Igman Initiative mission was very important in the previous period; its visions about the future gave hope; it achieved the unthinkable in the difficult moments; it offered solutions. You are still doing it today, so in the name of those that I represent, I thank you.
I am certain that this topic “Cooperation leads to European values” can and should be discussed from different angles, comprehensively and that this session will be an initiator of many important debates to come that would offer quality solutions.
Cooperation between four countries, which are also each other’s neighbours, is no longer in question. Today, we know that we have had our children’s diseases, we have made successful contacts and we see the results of that cooperation.
The continuation of friendly relations is necessary; the highest bodies are already determined and besides the nongovernmental agencies, the state institutions are working on it as well. Possible small resistance can be ignored and in time will be even smaller.
Overcoming the earlier hostilities is needed – decided the Europeans over a half a century ago. We have reached the same conclusion, and we started to act accordingly. We have not done everything yet, but we must do it. To do it, we need reconciliation, and reconciliation needs truth. Not one, not three, but to jointly establish the truth. It is important to affirm equality as a condition of having joint life in each of the countries, but to affirm equality in interstate relations and in Europe as well.
Current EU members, right after their mutual conflicts, have realized that it is necessary quickly to ensure the revitalisation of national economies. Most of them are the most developed countries in the world. We, living in this area, also realize the importance of economic development, but we cannot manage to go forward in the same tempo.
The third, possibly the most important, and it seems the most difficult principle was turning differences into an advantage. We have often insisted on differences in the past, which led us to difficult and sometimes even hopeless situations. A great part of Europe went trough similar periods and succeeded, just as we did. Their differences have become their advantage. Peoples and citizens living in our quadrangle, at certain points in the past also knew how to use this. That shows that we can do it, we simply have to try harder.
We must find joy in each of our success, wherever it occurs; we need to ask help from each other; we need to help one another.
We are not talking about who is older as a state today, which has progressed in democracy more, and which in economy.
Today, we are not talking about how to go on, how will we be together, how will we help one another; we need that, we can do it, and I hope we will achieve it.
Ladies and Gentlemen, the West Balkan must be included in the future shape of Europe.
In its earlier convocations, the BiH Presidency has clearly advocated the need to build good relations with the neighbours, which you all know. I believe that it is important to say today that the newly elected members of the BiH Presidency, the three of us, in our separate inauguration speeches, underlined the importance of cooperation and development of good-neighbourly relations.
How to walk toward the European values? It seems to me that we must remember the principles that Europe started from in the ‘50-ties of the last century, toward its unification – the today’s European Union.”

title: The Chairman of the BiH Presidency Nebojša Radmanović’s address at the formal session
content:
According to the current Constitution, the Presidency is the most important institution in BiH. That fact demands seriousness, principles, responsibility, and vision. It is not a good time for evaluation of whether it was like that or not, but the time is right to say today that this is how it should be. That is how I imagine the BiH Presidency Member post must be like
AD D R E S S
By
BIH PRESIDENCY CHAIRMAN
Mr NEBOJŠA RADMANOVIĆ
AT THE FORMAL SESSION, NOVEMBER 6, 2006
"Ladies and Gentlemen,
Your Excellencies,
Esteemed colleagues, members of the BiH Presidency,
Change of power, regardless of what it might be or when it takes place, is an important step. It gives hope, but awakens fears as well. It is the same all over the world, and especially in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
Our assignment is that the change is not important only for a minute; the change must be felt today, and particularly in the future. Everyone in Bosnia and Herzegovina must feel it. This is how we will beat the fears.
According to the current Constitution, the Presidency is the most important institution in BiH. That fact demands seriousness, principles, responsibility, and vision. It is not a good time for evaluation of whether it was like that or not, but the time is right to say today that this is how it should be. That is how I imagine the BiH Presidency Member post must be like.
BiH must take giant steps forward. The question is do we all know where we are going and how. I am certain that the majority in BiH knows that answer. We must become a real part of Europe. The question is do we have a road to take in our vision and do we have enough responsibility, desire, knowledge and will to commit ourselves to this job to its very end. We must ask ourselves “Do we all in BiH want it?”. I believe that the majority feels this way; therefore, I am determined to work in interest of that majority.
The time is right to remind certain people in Europe that descendants of ancient European peoples live here and that they need support in this phase of development. European Union needs to support its southeastern part because of its own development as well.
That support must be well intentioned, flawless, without any hasty, insufficiently planned actions. Mistakes were made in the past, Europe had paid them dearly, and us, who live here, above all.
In order not to repeat those mistakes, we need to affirm certain goals, the BiH internal goals; the same goals that Europe started from toward its unification.
It is necessary to overcome the earlier hostilities completely. For doing that, we need truth, conviction for all criminals, understanding and reconciliation. It is highly important to affirm equality as a precondition of a mutual life; it is highly important to do everything in order to put an end to feeling endangered.
Rapid development of the destroyed national economies is a task, which most of the current EU member countries had realized and fulfilled, so can and must we in BiH. Without it, there will be no survival in this area; without it, we cannot come closer to Europe, and without it, we cannot align ourselves with the developed countries.
Differences, which undeniably exist in Europe, especially in BiH, must not be a source of conflict; on the contrary, that must be an advantage. There was a time in the past when we knew how to use it, I am sure we can do the same in the following period as well.
All that requires knowledge, persistence, patience, and good intentions. I sometimes feel that we mostly lack good will. Every citizen of BiH, notably the elected people’s representatives, must find joy in every success, wherever it may occur in BiH. That is a way to go forward. Truly to have that, BiH cannot and must not be a mother to some of its citizens and a stepmother to others. There must not be important ones and those less important, dearer ones and those less dear among us. Equality is a condition and without it, we cannot go on.
I am convinced that the road to development of BiH, and the Republic of Srpska and the Federation of BiH as its constituent parts, is not hard to find if we are lead by good intentions and if we rely on competent, reasonable and independent people.
Progress needs reputation, and reputation cannot be regulated and it cannot be ordered. Reputation can only be earned.
Achieving it would mean victory over the fear of future; it would awaken the hope in dignified life.
I see the mandate that I have received as an obligation. I have a great obligation to numerous citizens of the Republic of Srpska, who voted for me, but also to those who didn’t. I have an obligation to every citizen of Bosnia and Herzegovina. I will fulfil it.”

title: The BiH Presidency Member Željko Komšić’s address at the formal session
content:
The elections are behind us and it really does not matter that some of you had chosed different candidates during the elections. I find all the citizens equal and I want to serve you all and our homeland
A D D R E S S
By
BIH PRESIDENCY MEMBER
Mr ŽELJKO KOMŠIĆ
AT THE FORMA SESSION, NOVEMBER 6, 2006
“Citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
Esteemed guests from the country and abroad
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Dear friends,
I speak to you today with a sense of great honour, pride and responsibility for the high function I have just taken.
The elections are behind us and it really does not matter that some of you had chosed different candidates during the elections. I find all the citizens equal and I want to serve you all and our homeland.
I am bounded by the trust of citizens to perform this duty honourably and honestly. Together with you, I will put in all my means, strength and knowledge to make BiH better and different.
I invite all citizens of BiH to support my efforts and convictions that our country must be democratic, civilized and progressive State, a State of rule of law and tolerance, and a State where no one will be discriminated, where everyone will be equal and even.
As a youngest elected member of the BiH Presidency so far, I belong to this country’s generation of destroyed youth and I am fully aware and understand that young people desire better life and most of them want to leave Bosnia and Herzegovina.
I will do everything in order to change it, because we are here not to describe the past and presence, but primarily to defend the future. Hopelessness, lack of perspective and perishing youth cannot be and must not be the future of our children!
We must not allow the past to disable our road to future. However, past cannot and must not be suppressed, especially not forged. Every fight against truth is sentenced beforehand to failure and all of those who do not want to face the truth about themselves and their own past, are nothing but cowards. Courage is to face the truth, first the truth about yourself, then about others.
I will continue to work and I will not get tired in efforts to help clearing up the destiny of those who are even today considered missing – on all sides. Devastating uncertainty about the destiny of their dearest ones must finally come to an end for tens of thousands of despondent families across BiH. BiH must finally stop being a country with missing persons and a country with the mass graves! Notably, BiH must stop being a country where war criminals of every type and profile walk freely! There is no other alternative for me.
The future of this country lies in resisting current fears and those feeding on those fears, those who persist in their own national paranoia and who divide people and territories trying to maintain their own little empires.
As a member of the Croatian people in BiH, I know what it means to be outnumbered. However, Bosnia and Herzegovina, in all its beauty, is a country where in every part of it someone is in a minority.
I promise that I will fight for full application and affirmation of the basic principle, which the universal idea of the civilized society is based on, and which in fact is an integral part of Bosnia and Herzegovina since its beginning. The principle is: THAT THE MAJORITY IS APSOLUTELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MINORITY.
I will never give up on the full application and resuscitation of that principle in all its beauty and power in every part of our homeland.
I promise that while performing my duties as a Member of the BiH Presidency, I will never be guided by interests of daily politics or narrow- party interests! The only interest that I will advocate and follow is the interest of the citizens of this country, especially the growing generations, our children!
We must finally put an end to the separate education of children of different nationality as a darkest form of mistreating the youngest.
This darkest fascist political maltreatment of children handicaps them beforehand and takes away the normal life, which is in harmony with the universal values of the humanity and modern Europe. In addition, this anti-civilized way of education is mostly advocated by those who do not mind the fact that their children in abroad are receiving their education along with the children of other nationalities, religions and races.
Empty phrases, false promises, i.e. immoral and dishonourable policy on basic ethical values – this country does not deserve this and cannot take it any longer.
I will perform my duty responsibly, honestly and conscientiously. I will represent all the citizens of this country, because you have been my impetus and you have given me a direction how and why to fight in political and public scene.
To reinforce all institutions of the legal state, to respect human and minority rights, freedom of the press, create a stable and permanent framework of market economy and socially responsible State – that is our joint task and duty.
As a Member of the BiH Presidency, I will act in accordance with my constitutional duties against the social injustice, crime and corruption and every form of abuse of power. Before the law, everyone must be equal, regardless of nationality, religion and political conviction, age or sex.
BiH where people would live agreeably, living on their work and work results, where knowledge, expertise and qualification would be valued instead of crime, corruption and ignorance – I want that BiH.
BiH wishes to live in peace and cooperation with its neighbours. We will do everything in our power to make BiH a stable and secure, democratic and prosperous part of the region in its path toward joining the Euro-Atlantic integration.
A democratic BiH, a State of all its citizens, equal citizens, has been and will remain my first and most important goal!
Furthermore, I promise that BiH will remain devoted to fight against global terrorism, which is the greatest evil of modern times, wherever it may be used and regardless of the mask and pretences under which it might be used.
Citizens brought me to this high duty and entrusted me with the function of the BiH Presidency Member; I am here for you and I will work for you in the next four years.
Thanks!”

title: The BiH Presidency Member Dr Haris Silajdžić’s address at the formal session
content:
We will try to enhance the friendly relations with the surrounding countries. The past teaches us that in this part of the world, it is advisable strongly to hold on to the principle of non-interference in the internal affairs of the neighbours
A D D R E S S
By
THE BIH PRESIDENCY MEMBER
Mr HARIS SILAJJDŽIĆ
AT THE FORMAL SESSION, NOVEMBER 6, 2006
“Excellencies,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Esteemed colleagues,
These elections have shown that Bosnia and Herzegovina is ready for a full democracy and that the citizens have surpassed the political organization that frames their lives.
The question how to reform the existing system and bring in harmony with the needs and aspirations of Bosnia and Herzegovina is now open, and it needs to be solved with the full participation of citizens and all the subjects interested in the future of Bosnia and Herzegovina. We need assistance of the International Community in harmonizing the basic principles and norms with accomplishments and practises of the democratic world.
There is not any doubt that the citizens of BiH are determined to join to Euro-Atlantic integration and that on the average, 80% of population supports that road. There are, of course, serious differences in views of the ways and the roads to achieve that goal, and those differences should be tackled patiently, trough agreement and respect for different opinion.
Bosnia and Herzegovina is a multi-ethnic state with the heavy past. Turning differences into an advantage is a difficult task for us all, especially those entrusted by the citizens during these elections. I hope that we would live up to expectations. Full equality and constitutionality for all on the entire territory of Bosnia and Herzegovina is not an issue, neither is a sovereignty or the territorial integrity of Bosnia and Herzegovina. We will try to enhance the friendly relations with the surrounding countries. The past teaches us that in this part of the world, it is advisable strongly to hold on to the principle of non-interference in the internal affairs of the neighbours.
Unfortunately, we must admit to be witnesses of an occasional interference in the internal affairs of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and that the lessons from the past have not been learned well yet.
The best thing to do is all of us to turn to solving our own problems. If we behave friendly, the borders will not separate us but connect us.
The State of Bosnia and Herzegovina wants to be a good neighbour and a constructive member of the European and the World Community.
Excellencies, Ladies and Gentlemen, esteemed colleagues,
Measure for a true maturity of a society is its humanity, and it can be manifested in relation to those who are having the most difficult time in enduring the life tribulations. Whether those are the families of the killed soldiers or demobilised fighters, pensioners, self-supporting mothers or returnees and their status, property and human dignity, it is clear that responsibilities to them are being fulfilled only partially.
In many cases, their basic human rights are being violated constantly, intentionally and systematically.
The duty of the Presidency, and of all other factors, is to do everything in order to have a more just society in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
One of the consequences of the mass violations of all human rights, including the right of life, is what we call a Diaspora. It is enough to say that hundreds of thousands of our citizens are scattered all around the world today.
Their rights, related to return and property are little respected and even less achieved. On the other hand, today that Diaspora represents, trough its potential, the basis for the future in Bosnia and Herzegovina and a real partner in building a modern state.
A lot depends on our stance on Diaspora and to what extent would that potential be used for the purpose of progress of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Of course, all that is closely connected with education and care for the youth in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
There is no doubt that all these goals are easily achieved with having a strong economy. In the following period, a lot can be done in course of that. The basic obstacle is a system that blocks the potentials of Bosnia and Herzegovina, including the divided economic space.
However, in cooperation with the International Community, trough diplomatic missions, World Bank, International Monetary Fund and an active approach to potential investors – it is certain that we could start projects vital to life of every citizen of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
All that requires capable people who will have public interest in mind above else, and Bosnia and Herzegovina has that kind of people.
Finally, we are here today because of the will of the citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina. We, members of the BiH Presidency, are obligated to respect that will, and I am sure that our friends outside of Bosnia and Herzegovina would also be guided by the same, democratically expressed will and help us in achieving the common goals.
THANK YOU!”

title: Speech on occasion of honouring the 3rd anniversary of death of the first president of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina
content:
Three years have passed since the death of Alija Izetbegovic, the first president of the Presidency of an independent Bosnia and Herzegovina
I send greetings and say salaam to
all the present members of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina from the period of aggression against our country,
The family of late president Izetbegovic,
Reis’l-ulema Dr Mustafa eff. Ceric,
Dear friends,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Three years have passed since the death of Alija Izetbegovic, the first president of the Presidency of an independent Bosnia and Herzegovina.
On this occasion, we have gathered to evoke the memories and reminiscences of his figure and work. We have summoned his closest associates from the roughest days of defence of our homeland from the aggression, the representatives of certain institutions and the members of his family.
PhD Ejup Ganic, as a member of the Presidency of the Republic of BiH and his first associate, will talk about the persona of late president Izetbegovic and the joint fight for Bosnia and Herzegovina.
As time goes by, the righteousness of Alija Izetbegovic’s way and his vision of Bosnia and Herzegovina as multiethnic, democratic, European country of equal peoples and citizens are receiving more and more confirmation. The name of Alija Izetbegovic will remain remembered worldwide as a synonym for fight for justice, freedom and democracy. All of us, who support such a vision and follow the way of late Alija Izetbegovic, can best prove it by building a stable and prosperous European Bosnia and Herzegovina, where all its peoples and citizens, in its entire territory, would enjoy equal human rights and freedoms.

title: SPEECH OF MR. BORISLAV PARAVAC, THE MEMBER OF THE PRESIDENCY OF BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA AT THE SUMMIT OF SOUTH EAST EUROPE COUTRIES “FIGHT AGAINST ORGANIZED CRIME AND TERRORISM” Karadjordjevo, October
content:
First and foremost, I would like to express my pleasure for participating in the today’s Summit, so please allow me to thank our hosts in Serbia and Mr. President Boris Tadic personally for a cordial welcome and excellent conditions in which this meeting is taking place
Mr. Chairman
Esteemed Presidents of States,
Your Excellencies,
Ladies and Gentlemen,
First and foremost, I would like to express my pleasure for participating in the today’s Summit, so please allow me to thank our hosts in Serbia and Mr. President Boris Tadic personally for a cordial welcome and excellent conditions in which this meeting is taking place.
Mr. Chairman,
At this Summit, we are discussing the issues of great importance to overall situation and future of the countries in the region. This is an another opportunity to continue with the practise of open exchange of views on stances and activities directed to further development of security and friendly relations in the region in general. Our everyday experience confirms that the regional countries are decisively dedicated to strengthen the stability and cooperation, in which the dialogue and understanding truly have no alternative, because only in this way, we can examine issues of common interest to our countries.
In regard to the joint fight against organized crime and terrorism, we are encouraged by the initial results achieved in the joint campaign of South East Europe countries.
Confirming, therefore, support from Bosnia and Herzegovina to this I Summit of South East Europe countries, where we openly talk about “fight against organized crime and terrorism”, I wish to emphasize that notably this problem, due to escalation of terrorism over the last few years, has practically shocked the world public.
Today, the world is also under the heavy impressions of terrorist attack in the USA, on September 11, 2001, when the innocent people were killed, and many children among them, as well as during the later attacks in Madrid, London, the school in Beslan, North Ossetia. Obviously, the end of this is not discernible and today, the world lives in fear of new attacks.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
The international terrorism and organized crime endanger peace and security of the entire freedom-loving world and not a single country is spared in the process. When talking about South East Europe, we must always bear in mind all the challenges we could encounter on our way to a free and undisturbed development and the Euro-Atlantic integration.
The organized crime and terrorism are common evil that represent means of destabilisation of countries and the greatest threat to peace, stability and in general the development of friendly relations in our region as well.
When talking about Bosnia and Herzegovina in that context, it has undergone some very difficult trials deriving from the times of the tragic war. After the known events from September 2001, as a European country and a member of the United Nations, Bosnia and Herzegovina has joined the extensive alliance of countries that had undertaken emergency measures, internally and externally, in fight against organized crime and terrorism. In that context, the Coordination Team for fight against terrorism was formed and “Plan of activities of the B-H institutions and the Entities in preventing terrorist activities and actions” was reached.
We have instilled determination, conclusions and commitments comprised in the resolutions of the United Nations 1333 and 1373 in those activities, as well as the conclusions and initiatives undertaken by the European Union Council, i.e. those deriving from the Brussels Conference Declaration.
Mentioned programmes of measures are of wide scope and can be summarised to five basic courses of action.
First, legislative measures and activities directed to encircling the legal framework for fight against organized crime and terrorism.
Second, instilled measures and activities related to a higher level of security and protection of civil air services.
The third element are measures of more rigid operational activities of internal affairs, border agency, intelligence and security agency and the State Investigation and Protection Agency, especially concerning the ID, passport, citizenship, stay permit checks, etc.
The forth element of action represents a group of measures related to the issues in the field of international relations. Above else, it is related to visa regime and their accordance with the Schengen rules and standards, the inspection of real and declarative activities of various associations and non-governmental agencies, etc. In addition, efforts have been intensified to achieve Bosnia and Herzegovina’s association to remaining international conventions and protocols in the field of fight against organized crime and terrorism.
Fifth, at the level of institutions of Bosnia and Herzegovina, adequate organizational and technical foundations were created for coordinated and efficient implementation of all these activities trough formation of a special ministry – the Ministry of Security of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
With these measures we are undertaking in the field of fight against organized crime and terrorism in Bosnia and Herzegovina, we clearly want to show our determination to become a part of a broader regional and world network of fight against organized crime and terrorism, for a common wellbeing.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Citizens of Bosnia and Herzegovina, the multiethnic and multi-religion country and after September 11, 2001, have shown their political maturity and responsibility for not allowing those not-so-long-ago war events to become the means of new manipulations, but sided with the anti-terrorist coalition. However, apart from decisiveness and determination of the bodies and institutions of Bosnia and Herzegovina in the field of fight against terrorism, unfortunately, relicts of the past still linger, so much more must be done to make B-H a more secure and safer country. In order to achieve it, more must be done for mutual cooperation with the regional countries, by means of cooperation between intelligence and security agencies, police, and development of joint educational, scientific and research programmes relevant to fight against organized crime and international terrorism.
In that sense, I would like to confirm Bosnia and Herzegovina’s wish that the Secretariat of the Process for Cooperation in South East Europe should be located in Sarajevo, which, among else, will take over the activities of the Stability Pact.
Mobilisation of the entire world in fight against organized crime and terrorism will make a significant influence on whether the times of peace, security, democratic values and prosperity for all lie ahead of us, or would it be ordeal and demise of human and civilisation values.
Therefore, fight against organized crime and especially terrorism, must not be conflict of religions or civilisations, on the contrary, it must be fight for peaceful joint life of peoples of different cultures and religious denominations.
By signing the joint Declaration of fight against organized crime and terrorism today, we are taking a historic step in creating a safer and securer region, as a precondition of a general prosperity and association with European Union and the Euro-Atlantic integration.
Thanks!

title: The Declaration of South East Europe Heads of States at the Summit of the South East European countries “Fight against organized crime and terrorism”, Karadjordjevo, October 15
content:
Speeches
The Declaration of South East Europe Heads of States at the Summit of the South East European countries “Fight against organized crime and terrorism”, Karadjordjevo, October 15-16, 2006
We, Heads of States of the South East Europe countries: Traian Basescu, Brankso Crvenkovski, Stjepan Mesic, Alfred Moisiu, Borislav Paravac, Filip Vujanovic and Boris Tadic, in the presence of Franco Frattini, the Vice-president of the European Commission an the European Commissioner of Justice, Freedom and Security
We, Heads of States of the South East Europe countries: Traian Basescu, Brankso Crvenkovski, Stjepan Mesic, Alfred Moisiu, Borislav Paravac, Filip Vujanovic and Boris Tadic, in the presence of Franco Frattini, the Vice-president of the European Commission an the European Commissioner of Justice, Freedom and Security,
Gathered here at the Summit in Karadjordjevo on October 16, 2006, in times when democratic developments in the world, including the construction of democratic institutions and strengthening the rule of law, have prevailed; when the countries in transition are entering a new phase of their democratic transformation surpassing the remnants of the recent past in that way and confronting the challenges of corruption and organized crime; when the region is entering the phase of a greater stability, still burdened with open issues,
deeply aware of the threat that poses the organized crime and terrorism and strongly determined to jointly confront this evil,
firmly re-condemning the organized crime and terrorism, in all its forms and manifestations, as a greatest challenge and a threat to security in the modern world,
also, confirming the generally-accepted fundamental principles and standards of the international law regarding the organized crime and terrorism,
dedicated to respect for human rights in fight against organized crime and terrorism,
guided by relevant conventions and protocols of the United Nations and the Council of Europe in regard to fight against organized crime and terrorism, as well as decisions of the United Nations General Assembly and the Council of Security,
welcoming the agreement reached at the United Nations General Assembly on global strategy of fight against organized crime and terrorism,
expressing readiness to contribute and actively cooperate in fight against terrorism and to tackle all forms of organized crime,
following the commitments in the process of Euro-Atlantic integration, as well as the expressed interests of the South East Europe countries,
emphasizing the importance of our previous activities and cooperation in the framework of regional organizations and initiatives active in this field, especially within the Stability Pact of the South East Europe,
confirming the conclusions of the Regional Table of the Stability Pact of the South East Europe (Belgrade, May 30, 2006), as well as the Roadmap towards a regionally owned cooperation framework in South East Europe, encompassing the priorities of future regional cooperation, inter alia, justice, internal affairs and security sector cooperation, and
expressing willingness to strengthen cooperation in the framework of the Agreement on Police cooperation in South East Europe,
we adopted a joint
D E C L A R A T I O N
On fight against organized crime and terrorism
Organized crime and terrorism represent a global security threat, and the countries of South East Europe are exposed to it to a great extent, in the process of consolidation of stability in the region. In regard to organized crime, as one of the main sources of financing, as well as a means to destabilize countries, terrorism represents the most dangerous threat to peace, stability and democratic development of our region.
Bearing in mind that joint action in fighting organized crime and terrorism represents a necessary condition of security of each country and the region as a whole, we pledge to work jointly on:
Enlarging the normative capacities of the regional countries to fight organized crime and peril of terrorism successfully trough ratification of an agreement on police cooperation;
coordinating the legislative framework and the legislation of European Union so that all countries of the region could successfully prevent and tackle organized crime and terrorism internally, and in the framework of international cooperation of relevant institutions, including judiciary, police, security and intelligence agencies, as well as financial authorities;
establishing and developing all necessary ties and forms of cooperation with proper bodies of European Union, which are holders of fight against organized crime and terrorism, as well as with NATO;
developing capacities of intelligence and security agencies, police and judicial bodies to detect, monitor, document and process the actors of organized crime and terrorist activities. In that context, we especially insist on developing capacities of the mentioned bodies jointly to work and exchange all information necessary for fight against organized crime and terrorism in good will.
developing capacities of border, customs and immigration services in preventing the movement of organized criminal groups and terrorists and creating areas in the region in which they have the freedom of movement;
increasing the capacities of the mentioned services to act in emergency situations, in joint actions in eliminating the consequences of terrorist acts, especially acts committed with the weapon for mass destruction;
preventing the access to weapon and other materials suitable for conducting the terrorist acts, notably materials for mass destruction weapon production, as well as information exchange on emergence of new weapon and devices that could be used in terrorist activities;
cooperation based on the best practise in the region, aiming to create and strengthen national capacities for export control, as well as aiming to exchange experiences and cooperation in this important area;
optimal utilization of all existing mechanisms for development of regional cooperation in the field of fight against organized crime and terrorism;
developing the instruments for prevention of financing the organized criminal groups and terrorism, and
exchanging expertise and development of joint educational and scientific and research programmes of great significance for fight against organized crime and terrorism.
In view of achieving the mentioned goals, we pledge to establish an enduring dialogue at the level of Heads of States (or Governments).
We confirm that meetings at the ministerial level of relevant competence (internal affairs and/or justice) will be held regularly, once a year.
The cooperation at the level of experts will be organized permanently, as trough existing forms of regional cooperation, as well as bilaterally, and trough new forms of cooperation that will be determined on the basis of common interest.

title: H Presidency Chairman, Sulejman Tihic on occasion of the terrain inauguration – laying a cornerstone for the Modern Art Museum in Sarajevo
content:
Of course, special gratitude goes to the author of the project – Mr. Renzo PIANO. We are proud to have an architectural accomplishment by one of the most eminent world architects in Sarajevo
Speech on occasion of the terrain inauguration – laying a cornerstone for the
Modern Art Museum in Sarajevo
Sarajevo, September 14, 2006
“Ladies and Gentlemen,
I thank you for the invitation to lay a cornerstone today, here at the location where the Modern Art Museum – ARS AEVI will soon be built.
As we all know, I have been supporting actively this great project. The issue of ARS AEVI Museum was one of the topics during my talks with the President of the Republic of Italy and the UNESCO Secretary-General in March and June, this year.
I have also emphasized the significance of the ARS AEVI project for Bosnia and Herzegovina and the entire South-East Europe at the recent Summit of the South-East Europe countries and UNESCO in Opatija.
Why do I support the ARS AEVI project?
Firstly, because it confirms how much culture and arts can contribute to a country’s affirmation.
I remind you that the ARS AEVI project was initiated by a group of B-H cultural workers, led by the current General Director, Mr. Enver HADZIOMERSPAHIC in then surrounded Sarajevo. Even during the war, the ARS AEVI project became one of the most important ones in the area of modern area in Europe.
Secondly, because the Sarajevo collection ARS AEVI, according to an opinion of the most important world authorities of this field, is one of the most important European modern art collections today. Every country in the world would be proud to have such a cultural value.
Thirdly, the Sarajevo Modern Art Museum was drafted by one of the most important world architects, Renzo PIANO. In that way, Bosnia and Herzegovina will become one of the most significant modern art centres in Europe.
And fourthly, the ARS AEVI project will give an additional image to Sarajevo and our country as a tourist and cultural destination. The Modern Art Museum in Sarajevo will attract a great number of visitors worldwide. That means new job openings, directly or indirectly related to the museum.
Ladies and Gentlemen
I would also like to use this opportunity, in the name of Sarajevo and Bosnia and Herzegovina, once again to thank UNESCO and the Government of the Republic of Italy, the Italian city Toscana and cities Rome, Venice, Florence and Milan for the previous and, I hope, future support. I thank the artists from all over the world, whose works are part of our collection.
Of course, special gratitude goes to the author of the project – Mr. Renzo PIANO. We are proud to have an architectural accomplishment by one of the most eminent world architects in Sarajevo.
I assure you that I will do my best to support this project in the future as well.
Thank you.”

title: H Presidency Chairman Sulejman Tihic’s speech at the event “Defense of Bosnia and Herzegovina – Igman 2006”
content:
I would like to thank everyone present here today, who confirmed, together with us, that memories of defenders of our homeland Bosnia and Herzegovina are still fresh
Speech at the event
DEFENSE OF BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA – UGMAN 2006.
Igman – Veliko polje, August 4, 2006.
“Dear families of shehits
and killes members of the RBiH Armed Forces
Dear defenders of Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Ladies and Gentlemen!
First of all, I would like to say salaam and greet you all. I would especially like to say salaam to the members of the Igman battles – defenders of Igman and Sarajevo!
I would like to thank everyone present here today, who confirmed, together with us, that memories of defenders of our homeland Bosnia and Herzegovina are still fresh.
I will not talk about the Igman battles today, because celebrated commanders and soldiers are those who should be talking about it. I would like to say here that defending this territory had an enormous strategic significance. This territory connected Sarajevo with the free territory in the Middle Bosnia, Herzegovina etc.
This is a chance to commit ourselves once again:
to continue with the fight for Bosnia and Herzegovina, the State of equal peoples and citizens, for which our best sons gave their health and their lives!
to preserve and nurture the legacy of the defensive and liberation war and defend it from the malicious and cheap politics attacks!
particularly, we will not allow equalization of those who defended Bosnia and Herzegovina against the aggression and our people from destruction and those who committed the severest mass and systematic war crimes and had participated in the aggression and division of our country!
we will defend the values for which our best sons gave their lives, and we will take care of their families and disabled veterans!
we will persevere in the legal actions against Serbia and Montenegro for aggression and genocide! That is our commitment and we owe it to the victims and to justice and truth, but also to prevent evil from happening to anyone ever again!
I would also like to re-emphasize:
- that then, for the first time in the recent history of our country, we had the Bosnian army that fought only for Bosnia and Herzegovina and only in Bosnia and Herzegovina!
- thanks to the Army, numerous B-H patriots and a wise politics of our State leadership, led by president Alija Izetbegovic, Bosnia and Herzegovina was defended, as well as the highest human and civilisation values of a multiethnic society, a thousand-year long tradition of coexistence, international and inter-religious tolerance! The idea of Bosnia and Herzegovina was defended, according to which the European Union has been created.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Of course, we must not forget what has happened! We must not forget that we were killed and harassed only for being different from our neighbours! And, why withheld it, for being Bosniacs and Muslims! However, we must not think that all of them are alike, because it is not true. If everyone would be the same, there would not be any Bosnia and Herzegovina.
At the same time, we will never stop seeking justice! For the sake of justice and permanent peace, those responsible for crimes must be brought to trial! Moreover, we must face the future and continue the fight for Bosnia and Herzegovina in peace and trough democratic means! That is the only way and the best one!
Our goal is Bosnia and Herzegovina – a State of equal peoples and citizens on the entire territory and every part of it! Bosnia and Herzegovina can and should be a homeland to all its peoples and citizens!
We can reach this goal just as we had defended Bosnia and Herzegovina, which means that all B-H forces should be united in this path! We must be serious and responsible. Conflicts and divisions are in no one’s interest. We must preserve the peace that was difficultly established. We must not make mistakes or to be taken in by provocations! Especially us, who do not have any alternative and to whom Bosnia and Herzegovina is the only home!
Some people are trying to question something in Bosnia and Herzegovina that has been established long ago (referendum, sovereignty and integrity) and to make connection between that and the regional problems (Kosovo). They will not succeed in it! We will not allow them, like we did not allow it in 1992, when they were much stronger and when the YNA troops had occupied Bosnia and Herzegovina!
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Brothers and sisters!
Regardless of destabilisation attempts, there are no serious political forces, within our outside of B-H, which can endanger its territorial integrity and sovereignty! Country’s integration processes are building up; numerous State institutions were created. We have the State Border Service, the State Intelligence Agency, the Indirect Tax Administration, the State Customs Service, the state Armed forces and the Ministry of Defence, and if God wills it, a unique police system!
I know that this is still not the Bosnia and Herzegovina, for which her best sons have given their lives, but we are heading in the right direction.
All that, requires a lot of work, patience, expertise and wisdom. The only realistic policy is a policy of agreement, not confrontation! It is not possible to solve all the problems at once. The policy of solving problems gradually, i.e. step by step, will ensure solving the rest of the problems as well!
We are convinced that we have the strength, knowledge and wisdom to achieve this goal! We owe it to Igman, and every other B-H hero – defender of Bosnia and Herzegovina!
We are heading to become a member of the Partnership for Peace and NATO. We are fulfilling the conditions for membership in the European Union. Membership in these organizations means permanent security and prosperity. I am convinced that there is a place for Bosniacs in the union of equal European peoples, and for our religion, tradition and culture.
Finally, I would like to say salaam and greet you all. Next year, if God wills it, we will have gathered here in a greater number to pay respect to our defenders. I am convinced that our homeland – Bosnia and Herzegovina, will be stronger and closer to achieving its set goals!”

title: H Presidency Chairman Sulejman Tihic’s speech at the media conference, held on July 27, 2006
content:
Od 23. do 26. jula sam, na poziv predsjednika Libije Muamera El-GADAFI-a, boravio u zvaničnoj posjeti Libijskoj Džamahiriji. Posjeta Libiji bila je deveta bilateralana posjeta u svojstvu predsjedavajućeg Predsjedništva Bosne i Hercegovine
"In the period of July 23 – 26, upon invitation of the Libyan President Muammer El-QHADAFI, I was in an official visit to the Libyan Jamahiriya. The visit to Libya was the ninth bilateral visit as a B-H Presidency Chairman (Belgium, Luxemburg, Italy, Holland, USA, Bulgaria, Qatar, Austria and Libya).
During this visit, I had meetings with:
- the President of Libya, Muammer El-QHADAFI
- the Prime Minister Dr El-Bagadi El-MAHMOUDI (on three occasions)
- the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Muhammed Abdurahman SHALGAM
- the Minister of Health, dr Muhammed RASHID
- the Minister for International Cooperation, Muhammed SAJAL
- the President of the Organization and the University of Islamic DAWA, Dr Ahmed Muhammed Esh-SHERIF
- the Director of the Institute for Dialogue and studying the Green Book, dr Milud El-MEHETBEL
- the General Director of ELECTRICAL INDUSTRY OF LIBYA, Omran BUKRA
Bearing in mind the great importance of Libya to Bosnia and Herzegovina’s economy, during this visit, there were our prominent businessmen in the Delegation: Tomislav GRIZELJ, the General Director of the GRIZELJ company and the President of the B-H Employers’ Association, Mujo SELIMOVIC, the General Director of MIMMS, Edin ARSLANAGIC, the General Director of BOSNALIJEK, Mehmed DRINO, the General Director of HIDROGRADNJA, Abdulharis SETA, the Deputy General Director of ENERGOINVEST, Nijaz VELADZIC, the General Director of SANITEKS and Emir GRANOV, the General Director of the GRANOFF company.
On this occasion, in the name of our country, Mr. Grizelj signed the Protocol on establishing the Business Council for Economic Cooperation between Bosnia and Herzegovina and Libya, and there was also a special meeting between our economic delegation and the Council of Libyan Businessmen. Our businessmen presented the economic possibilities of Bosnia and Herzegovina to their Libyan colleagues and proposed concrete forms of cooperation.
During the visit to Libya, I have visited the Monument to the unknown hero and the grave of President QHADAFI’s father, Muhammed Munyar Al-QHADAFI, one of the most famous fighters for independence of Libya, and I visited the shehit cemetery.
I also had pleasure to visit the newly opened juice factory JAFARA-MIMMS, which was recently opened by our MIMMS Company from Sarajevo as a first foreign investment in Libya. The factory already employs over 100 workers, out of which 43 are from Bosnia and Herzegovina. The JAFARA-MIMMS factory is an example of the B-H economy’s ability equally to compete in the world market.
A meeting with President Qhadafi
I met President Qhadafi immediately after arriving. We talked about the past, the aggression against Bosnia and Herzegovina, causes of the war in Bosnia and Herzegovina and its consequences, the reconstruction, the reintegration, the situation in the region, etc. The special accent was given to the economic cooperation, and I asked the Libyan leader to give the B-H companies a concrete work, to ease their work, but also to have Libyan companies participating in investment and privatization in Bosnia and Herzegovina. President Qhadafi emphasized that relations between Libya and Bosnia and Herzegovina have a special character, i.e. B-H companies have a privileged position while entering their market. Right after our conversation, he instructed the Prime Minister that this visit should result in concrete ventures. We also agreed that Bosnia and Herzegovina should have a central role in Libya’s relations with our region.
The main events of this visit:
1. I have initiated the establishment of special economic relations between Bosnia and Herzegovina and Libya, enabling our companies to have privileged position while entering the Libyan market, as well as numerous other benefits deriving from it. Libyan President Qhadafi accepted the proposal and authorised the Prime Minister to implement it.
2. The Libyan party accepted a request that B-H companies should get new jobs in the Libyan market, of course, in accordance with their possibilities.
3. I have requested exemptions with getting visa and working permits for our workers, as well as certain exemptions with applying Libyan legislation concerning hiring the foreign working force. That means that B-H companies could engage a greater number of our workers and would be exempted from a strict compliance with the rule to employ one of their citizens for every foreign worker in Libya.
4. We agreed to establish a direct airline Sarajevo-Tripoli, which would be maintained by AIR BOSNA and the Libyan National Airline Company together.
5. We have reached agreement on re-engaging our doctors and medical staff to work in Libya. The Libyan Minister of Health will visit Bosnia and Herzegovina in a few weeks to sign the bilateral agreement on this matter.
6. We have discussed the modalities of returning B-H debt for a credit amounting to 12.5 million US dollars, which our country took in 1991. The loan could be returned by giving a certain number of shares of one of the B-H companies to the Libyan Government. Considering the shown interest of the Libyan side, that company could be BOSNALIJEK.
7. I have received support from the Libyan Government and the Secretary-General of the non-governmental World Organization Islamic Dawa, which is UNESCO member, for completing support projects for the sustainable return of refugees. This Organization is also ready to help in restructuring the mosque FERHADIJA in Banja Luka, trough a special fund opened by UNESCO for this purpose. The Organization Islamic Dawa will open its branch in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
8. We have discussed establishment of scientific and technical cooperation of corresponding B-H institutions and the Institute for studying the Green Book.
9. We have agreed on starting the negotiations on a prompt signing of bilateral agreements between Bosnia and Herzegovina and Libya on
- stimulation and protection of investment
- avoiding double taxation
- cooperation in the area of tourism
- cooperation in the system of payment.
10. At the end of the visit, Libyan Prime Minister Dr El-Bagadi El-MAHMOUDI informed me about the following:
- that they have accepted my request to grant job of building 400 KW of portable long-distance power line to ENERGOINVEST of 160 million EUR worth. Moreover, I believe that the Libyan side would equally react to my insistence on contracting the ENERGOINVEST to build the cathode protective pipe in the Great River Project.
- that Bosnalijek, Saniteks and Maja-a pharmaceutical company should establish business cooperation that would enable Bosnalijek not only to sell medications and medical material in the Libyan market, but also to have a joint production and disposal of goods, not only in the Libyan market, but African as well. All these companies have already signed the Protocol on Special Cooperation.
- My initiative for Libyan participation in privatisation was accepted and they asked B-H to deliver them a proposal of privatisation and investment projects in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
They showed interest in infrastructure and tourism.
- From earlier, we had information involving the decision of the Libyan Government to close a certain number of embassies in the world, including the embassy in Bosnia and Herzegovina, and I talked with the Libyan leader especially about it. After that, the decision was changed and the Libyan Embassy in B-H will continue to work.
At the end of my visit to Libya, Prime Minister Dr El-Bagadi El-MAHMOUDI emphasized that the leader, Muammer El-Qhadafi has requested, perhaps for the first time, that his Government and all institutions should sign contracts with the B-H companies (for example ENEGROINVEST-Long-distance power lines), and to give them priority in the future.
During the meeting with President Qhadafi, the very first day, I was given a personal attention. All following collocutors started talking by saying that they were working on leader Qhadafi’s instructions and that they have to close concrete deals.
I would also like to stress out that our Delegation in Libya was welcomed with the highest State honours and a special media attention (for instance, 17 minutes of the Central News of the Libyan State Television, on July 24, was dedicated to our visit).

title: H Presidency Chairman Sulejman Tihic’s speech at the ceremony on occasion of laying the cornerstone for building the border crossing Bosanski Samac
content:
Bosanski Samac, a town at the mouth of river Bosna into Sava, has always been Bosnia and Herzegovina’s doors, hence is the right place to build a border crossing. Nevertheless, it should also be what it always has been – a place of joining, not separation!
The ceremony of laying the cornerstone for building
the border crossing Bosanski Samac
Bosanski Samac, July 10, 2006
“Ladies and Gentlemen,
I wish to greet you all and to express my pleasure for attending the ceremony of laying the cornerstone for building the border crossing in Bosanski Samac.
Perhaps it is unusual for a Chairman of the Presidency to attend such a ceremony. However, it is perfectly normal and expected of me to be here in Bosanski Samac today as a Chairman of the B-H Presidency, because this is also my town, where I was born and where I live.
Bosanski Samac, a town at the mouth of river Bosna into Sava, has always been Bosnia and Herzegovina’s doors, hence is the right place to build a border crossing. Nevertheless, it should also be what it always has been – a place of joining, not separation!
