I would like the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina to be a prominent institution which will represent this country on the basis of the Constitution in the manner it is arranged in every other country, and in terms of power within the state, to show with its actions, based on the principles of agreement and consensus, that Bosnia and Herzegovina can exist as a complex and a functional state of the constituent peoples and equal Entities.
Starting from the mentioned principles and so far pragmatic experience, I believe the following activities shall be the priorities for the Presidency in the oncoming period:
-More intensive and comprehensive cooperation with the State, Entity and other BH institutions,
-Implementation and improvement of the foreign policy of Bosnia and Herzegovina,
-Cooperation with the OHR and other international organisations in Bosnia and Herzegovina,
-Further development of defence and security system,
-Economic development and economic revival of the country
I Cooperation with the State, Entity and Other BH Institutions
- The Presidency shall in the upcoming period have a more intensified and comprehensive communication primarily with the BH Parliamentary Assembly, specially through the active attitude towards the key issues which are going to be discussed in the Parliament. This is a country of a parliamentary democracy, thus our attitude towards the Parliament affirms the both the Assembly and the Presidency. On the other side, the Presidency is obliged to explain the most important issues concerning Bosnia and Herzegovina, in the very Parliament, the issues like elements of foreign policy, BH Budget, legislation concerning the Central Bank, defense and security etc. The cooperation with the Council of Ministers and the respective Entities Governments is also very important in seeing all economic and overall development indicators as well as in carrying out foreign policy which, more than ever, must be in function of economy, particularly foreign investments. Development projects at the level of Bosnia and Herzegovina, entity as well as local communities level based on the foreign investments should be available to the Presidency which shall, within its activities, create the environment for their realisation.
II Foreign Policy Implementation
Starting from the constitutional competences of the Presidency in the field of foreign policy and the strategic paper "General Guidelines and Priorities for Foreign Policy of Bosnia and Herzegovina" (2003) I would like to emphasise the following activities in the oncoming period:
- The main foreign policy aims for BH shall remain the membership in the European Union and joining the "Partnership for Peace". These aims are fully supported by all political parties both position and opposition. I am convinced that this is also the wish shared by the majority of the BH citizens. This imposes an additional obligation to us to actively participate in realisation of these aims. We are aware of the obligations before us and determined to fulfill them. I am assuring you that I will, in performing the role of the Chairman of the BH Presidency, do my best to fulfill the requirements for concluding the Agreement on Stabilisation and Association between Bosnia and Herzegovina and the European Union, as well as the requirements for BH admission to the Partnership for Peace.
The way to the European Union and other Euro-Atlantic integrations offers us a chance and an obligation to make the arrangements in the country according to the highest democratic standards and be an equal member of a great European countries family. Therefore, we do not want to be a burden for the European Union, but and equal partner in every way.
- The relations with the neighbours represent a priority in the foreign policy of Bosnia and Herzegovina. Being already on the high level, these relations shall be further developed in the oncoming period. Particular efforts shall be put in the further improvement of economic exchange and development of inter-state transport, economic and other communications, as well as in finalisation of the process of border-related arrangements. The other open issues, return of refugees and resolving the property issues, disputable economic issues, etc, should be solved through the institutions, direct contacts and sessions of the Inter-state Councils in the shortest possible time. It is very important for the work of the Inter-state Councils with the neighbouring countries to be more efficient and operational in terms of resolving the concrete issues. A series of unresolved issues between Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia and Montenegro, and Croatia imposes the need for a tripartite effort in their resolving, on which the Presidency shall particularly insist.
- Significant attention will be put to the relationships with the U.S.A. particularly in fighting the international terrorism and developing economic relationships. I am fully aware that the USA have played an important role in establishing the peace in Bosnia and Herzegovina and that today they lead in a wide front against terrorism. Our maximum support to such efforts reflects in determination to concretely contribute that plan in accordance with our international commitments.
- The Presidency shall pay much attention to improvement of the relations with Southeastern European countries, Russian Federation as well as the members of the Organisation of Islamic Countries. Traditionally good relations with the Russian Federation should be more utilised in the sphere of economy and the observer position in the Organisation of Islamic Countries ensures Bosnia and Herzegovina more favorable conditions for economic cooperation.
Clearly, in realisation of the mentioned and other priorities in foreign policy, the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina shall, as well as so far, closely cooperate with the BH Council of Ministers and particularly with the BH Ministry of Foreign Affairs being the most responsible operational body.
III Cooperation with the OHR and Other International Organisations in Bosnia and Herzegovina
International institutions, headed by the Office of High Representative play a very important, key role in this post-war phase of Bosnia and Herzegovina development. This fact must be an important factor in the activities of all BH institutions, as well as the Presidency.
If the intention of the national institutions is to gradually take their own responsibility for the country then it is going to be through active attitude towards the international institutions in Bosnia and Herzegovina, which must be partners to the local authorities. That is the only way of trust and restoring the authority of the national institutions and politicians in BaH.
Accordingly, the Presidency needs to develop active relationships and cooperation with the OHR and especially with the High Representative.
Keeping in mind the fact that our way towards the regional and European integrations is mostly conditioned by the cooperation with the International Criminal Tribunal for former Yugoslavia in the Hague, I would like to clearly express my standpoint: that cooperation must be be full and in accordance with the legal obligations and determinations of Bosnia and Herzegovina. The Presidency fully supports the transfer of the jurisdiction to the domestic judiciary. We believe it is a necessary process and we are sure that the BH judiciary is ready to perform this complex task. The judicial reforms, which the Presidency strongly supports, represent a guarantee for the above belief.
IV Defence and Security
In this segment the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina shall continue to strongly support the BH Ministry of Defence and other defence institutions on the state level, as well as the Reform Commission in a consistent implementation of the BH Defense Law and other reform solutions in this sphere, all with the aim of fulfilling the professional and technical requirements for joining of Bosnia and Herzegovina to the NATO Partnership for Peace Programme.
Within its constitutional and legal powers, the Bosnia and Herzegovina Presidency shall continuously perform the role of civil command over the armed forces in Bosnia and Herzegovina, particularly in the sense of fulfillment of the international obligations of BH in this sphere.
Given that the general political and security circumstances in BH have significantly improved, and an apparent progress made in establishing cooperation and mutual trust at all levels, the BH Presidency strongly supports the reduction of the international military presence in Bosnia and Herzegovina and replacement of the SFOR with EU forces. In so far and also in the future negotiations with the EU and NATO representatives, the Presidency shall actively and precisely participate in the implementation of the EU Mission (ALTEA) in Bosnia and Herzegovina.
The Presidency has clearly expressed its attitude towards further presence of the NATO troops in BH, particularly in terms of further support to the reforms in the sphere of defence and expert and material assistance to the defence structures in BH.
With the aim of fighting all forms of organised crime and BH contributing to the general fight against terrorism in the world, the Presidency shall continue to strongly support equipping and training of the State Agency for Investigations and Protection, State Border Service and the Ministry of Security in general.
The Presidency shall continuously insist on equipping the State Border Service for a full control over the state border, discovering, prevention and investigation of the cross-border crime, and SIPA to detect, prevent and investigate serious criminal acts of organised crime, terrorism, arrest the war crimes indictees and suspects for commercial crimes, money laundering and other criminal offences committed against Bosnia and Herzegovina.
V Economy
The key issue for the future of Bosnia and Herzegovina, its economic-social and political stability is ensuring the economic growth, which will lead to establishing a self-sustainable economy, reduction of unemployment and dependence on the international assistance, reduction of poverty and increase of the international competitiveness of the economy.
The answers to these challenges are to a significant extent offered in the “Midterm Development Strategy for Bosnia and Herzegovina” the realisation of which should enable BH to become economically self-sustainable by 2007. The Bosnia and Herzegovina Presidency fully supports this strategic document and monitor and encourage its realisation.
We have to provide for a long-term sustainable growth of the GDP rates of over 5% per annum, develop production and services on the basis of modern technologies, innovations and expertise, increase international competitiveness of our economy. I believe that there is no fast economic recovery and development of a country without direct foreign investments, and I will particularly insist on that in all my contacts with the representatives of the other countries. The Presidency shall encourage reforms that will lead to creating a more favourable climate for direct international investments being the key factor of economic development and growth.
The Central bank of Bosnia and Herzegovina has proved to be one of the most successful institution in Bosnia and Herzegovina so far. The results of their activities are shown in maintaining the stable currency - convertible mark, which has led to monetary and price stability. In its further activities, the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina shall support the activities of the Central bank bodies, based on the consistent application of the laws and the Currency Board rules, with the aims to improve functioning of the overall banking system.
Ladies and Gentlemen,
Your Excellencies,
Dear Colleagues, Members of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina
I am fully committed to, together with you, continue realising these and other tasks that stand before us. I expect your full support in realisation of these aims and quality step forward in the work of the Presidency of Bosnia and Herzegovina, being the only way of demonstrating, primarily to our people and citizens, as well as the entire European and world public that we are competent to perform this the most responsible function in the state. I would like to convey my sincere gratitude to Mr. Sulejman Tihic, the preceding chairman of the Presidency, as well as to Mr. Dragan Covic, for our joint work, wishing to put the so far good practice of agreements and mutual understanding to a higher level in our future activities.
Thank you for your attention!
